loans.name: Rosel

texts.es:
Rosel tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus 5 menores hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el CPM Condorhuasi, distrito de Pinpingos que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Rosel se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de varios años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cria de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, platano, vituca).El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento y cultivo de 2.5 ha. De las 3 has de café que tiene en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosel is 37 years old. He lives with his spouse and his five minor children in their own house built of rustic materials. They live in CPM Condorhuasi, Pinpingos district which is located in the province of Cutervo, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru. Life in this district is quiet, the inhabitants works mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Rosel works in agriculture specifically growing coffee. He has a number of years experience in the field and and has good personal and work references from the district. He also raises small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and others) and grows food products (yucca, plantains and taro). The loan will be used to maintain and grow 2.5 hectares of coffee. With the 3 hectares he now has in production he will be assured of a good harvest for the 2015 season, providing a greater volume of sales and in the end he will obtain more income and doing this be able to improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain and grow 2.5 hectares of coffee.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Grace is 46 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Grace has a repair shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her repair shop.

Grace has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her repair shop.

loans.name: Sobia Bibi

texts.en:
Sobia Bibi is a responsible mother of three sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for the last few years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Sobia Bibi's husband needs to do maintenance on his vehicle because the current condition of his vehicle is not good. It requires some maintenance charges to maintain his taxi car. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do maintenance of his vehicle. Therefore, Sobia Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repair cost of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Jesús Alberto

texts.es: Jesús es un joven de 22 años de edad que reside en Cartagena de Indias, es un apasionado de las fragancias y perfumes que promueven diferentes casa nacionales e internacionales y consideró que podría iniciar su negocio partiendo de sus propios gustos y conocimiento de producto; así que no lo dudó ni un instante en asumir el reto y con su capital compro sus primeros perfumes.  Hoy en día, cuenta con tres años de experiencia ofreciendo a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, fragancias para toda ocasión y brindando comodidad de pago.  Jesús está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en perfumes y colonias de diferentes marcas.  Su meta personal es casarse y conformar una familia y en su negocio poder vender más y obtener mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Jesús is a 22-year-old young man who lives in Cartagena de Indias.  He is passionate about fragrances and perfumes promoted by national and international companies.  He realized that he would be able to begin his own business springing from his own taste and knowledge of this product.  So, he didn’t hesitate for an instant in taking on this challenge.  With his capital he bought his first perfumes.  

Nowadays he has three years of experience selling fragrances for every occasion to his neighbors, friends, and family members, offering them convenient payment plans.  Jesús is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to invest in perfumes and colognes of different brands.  

His personal goal is to get married and start a family, and his business goal is to sell more and earn higher profits.

loans.use: to invest in perfumes and colognes of different brands.

loans.name: José David

texts.es:
José es un pequeño productor de café en una comunidad de Jinotega, departamento de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa en su pequeña finca, la cual ha venido mejorando como parte del plan de mejoramiento nutricional para sus cafetos. Su cosecha de café promedio ha sido de 30 quintales de café pergamino aproximadamente, los cuales produce bajo los criterios de certificación Fairtrade. 

Para este año, José está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que le permita garantizar un plan de manejo integrado de plagas y enfermedades en sus plantaciones. Esta inversión contribuirá a incrementar la producción en este ciclo en un 20%. Todo esto derivará en mejores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Jose is a small coffee producer in a community of Jinotega, department of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife in a small farm, which he has been improving as part of the nutritional improvement plan for his coffee plots. His average coffee harvest has been of approximately 30 quintals of parchment coffee, which he produces under the criteria of fair trade certification. For this year, Jose is requesting a loan to buy inputs and fertilizers that will allow him to guarantee an integrated management plan of plagues and diseases at his plantations. This investment will help increase the production in this cycle by 20%. All this will result in better income for the well being of his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs that he will use in his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Suyapa Juventina

texts.es: Suyapa, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene cuatro hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Barbara. Lleva 7 años de tener una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, frijoles, manteca, azúcar, pan, huevos, productos de limpieza  y productos enlatados. Ella solicita un prestamo por  25,000 lempiras para surtir con nuevos productos para que hayan mas ventas, comprara azucar, frijoles, manteca, pan, huevos, harina, productos de higiene, refrescos, embutidos, carnes etc. Invertir la hace sentir con trabajo y le da la facilidad de poder salir adelante con su familia. Su meta es seguir creciendo y ayudar a sus hijos para tener mejor vida.
texts.en: Suyapa is 30 years old and lives together with her partner with whom she has four children.  She lives in the town of Macuelizo, Santa Barbara.  She has been running a corner store for the past 7 years where she sells basic household products such as rice, beans, butter, sugar, bread, eggs, cleaning products, and canned goods.  She is asking for a loan of 25,000 lempiras (Honduran currency) in order to supply her store with new products so that she will have good sales.  She will buy sugar, beans, butter, bread, eggs, flour, personal hygiene products, soft drinks, sausages, meats, etc.  This investment will help her be successful in her work and will help her be able to move her family ahead.  Her goal is to continue growing and helping her children have a better life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, butter, bread, eggs, flour, personal hygiene products, soft drinks, sausages, meats, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Elena is 50 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Ma. Elena has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Luzminda works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling flowers. Luzminda is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more charcoal to sell for her charcoal retailing business.

Luzminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta lives in Liquisa, and her business is printing rental. She lives near many people, so she had one idea to open a rental business for everybody so when they want to print a document, they will not be far away. She opened her business this year, but she is earning a good income every day because many people come to print a document in her rental business, so she is very happy with her business.

Now she is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business because she wants to open a bigger rental in the future. She started to open a rental business in 2013 with her own working capital of $500. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy paper, ink, glue, insulation, and other materials to use.

She hopes that with this loan her business will improve in the future.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink, glue, insulation, and other materials to use.

loans.name: Mujeres De Pahaj Group

texts.es:
Arcadia es una mujer ejemplar, porque se esmera día a día para darle a su familia lo mejor, ella tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de los cuales son dos mujeres y dos varones, Arcadia tiene 52 años de edad, y vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Arcadia (la primera del lado izquierdo de la foto de blusa morada)  su entusiasmo de hacer que su familia tenga lo necesario lo ha llevado a mejorar, su calidad de vida a través de su negocio de compra y venta de pantalones con el que ya lleva tres años de realizarlo, ella realiza esta actividad desde el lugar de su domicilio porque esto le permite realizar otras actividades para el bienestar de su familia.
Arcadia es una de la pocas mujeres que tiene la visión de prosperar por su familia, y es por ello que ahora solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más telas, hilos y todo lo relacionado con la línea se elaboración de pantalones.
El gran sueño de Arcadia es que sus hijos cuenten con sus propios negocios y también sus propias casas para tener una mejor vida.
texts.en: Arcadia is an exemplary woman, because she works hard every day to give her family all the best. She has a beautiful family of four children, two girls and two boys. Arcadia is 52 years old and lives in a community of Sololá. Arcadia is the first on the left side of the photograph wearing a purple blouse. Her enthusiasm of having her family have all that is needed has made her improve her quality of life through her business of buying and selling pants, which she has had for three years. She works from her house, because this allows her to do other activities for her family's well being. Arcadia is one of few women who has the vision of prospering for her family; and for this reason she is now requesting a loan to buy more fabrics, threads, and everything related to the line of making pants. Arcadia's greatest dream is that her children have their own businesses and also their own houses so they can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads to make pants.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Leoncia buys and sells scrap from the community of Panglao, Bohol. She has been doing this for ten years. Her partner is a painter and they have a 16-year-old son. They work hard to have a better means of living.

Leoncia plans in the future to expand her business and to make it sustainable. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy different metal scrap to sell.

loans.use: to buy different metal scrap to sell.

loans.name: Ferlita

texts.en:
Ferlita is 30 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school. Ferlita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Ferlita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Yosly Karolina

texts.es: Yosly, tiene 25 años de edad, esta casada, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Yosly lleva 5 años de dedicarse al comercio y ayudar al hogar. Vende ropa como blusas, camisas, pantalones jeans, faldas, vestidos y otros. Esta venta la realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos. El prestamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo y es por 6,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar ropa como camisetas, camisas, pantalones, blusas, faldas para  aumentar el inventario y sus ventas. Su plan es mantener y crecer con el negocio para darle buen estudio a su hijo.
texts.en: Yosly is 25 years old, married and has one son. She lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Yosly has been working and helping her household for five years. She sells clothing like blouses, shirts, pants, jeans, skirts, dresses and others. She sells itinerantly and by order. The loan she is requesting is her second loan and is for 6,000 HNL. She will use it  to buy clothing like t-shirts, shirts, pants, blouses and skirts, to increase her inventory and her sales. Her plan is to maintain and expand her business to provide a good education for her son.

loans.use: to buy clothing like t-shirts, shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, etc to sell.

loans.name: Noun's Group

texts.en:
Noun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. She works as a farmer to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Martinha

texts.en:
Martinha opened a furniture shop in her house in 2001. She started her business with her own working capital. Martinha is married and her husband is a carpenter. 

Martinha is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional materials, including wooden beams, wooden boards, and tools for machine backup. She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business bigger in the future and her income will increased.

loans.use: To buy wooden beams, wooden boards, and tools for machine backup.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Nov is a 50-year-old widowed mother of one child. She is a rice farmer in the local area and supplements her family’s income by working as a garment worker. Having been in the business for 32 years, she can earn a daily income from her current business of around 40,000 KHR per day and is able to save about 20,000 KHR per day after expenses. 
 
This is Nov's first loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 2,400,000 KHR from VisionFund because she wants to buy a decent motorbike for her child to commute to work.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to have a proper motorbike so as to reduce her motor-taxi expenses.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her child to commute to work.

loans.name: Song Taaba Rabele Group

texts.fr: Haoua, âgée de 46 ans mariée mère de 2 enfants tous majeurs. Elle exerce son activité de restauration depuis 5 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est son accueil du client et, l’expérience et le travail bien fait. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter 49 500 f de sacs de riz et arachide ; 7 500 d’huile 2  litres à 1600 f cfa ; bois 5 000 f ; feuilles 25 000 f ; viande 11 400 f. L’utilité du prêt c’est de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de satisfaire ses clients. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt plusieurs fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Haoua is a 46-year-old married mother of two grown children. She has been working as a caterer for five years. What makes her business successful is her customer service, experience and good work. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase 49,500 francs worth of bags of rice and peanuts; 7,500 francs worth of oil (2 liters at 1,600 francs); 5,000 francs worth of wood; 25,000 francs worth of greens; 11,400 francs worth of meat. This loan will be used to purchase enough supplies in order to satisfy her customers. She has already received loans many times and made reimbursements on time to ACFIME.

loans.use: to buy 49,500 francs worth of bags of rice and peanuts; 7,500 francs worth of oil (2 liters at 1,600 francs); 5,000 francs worth of wood; 25,000 francs worth of greens; 11,400 francs worth of meat

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en: Ratha lives with her parents in Phlov Kou Village and works as a public service officer in her district. Besides working for government, she helps her parents with farming. As her parents grow older and older, Ratha wants them to have a comfortable life. She wants her family to have a reliable energy source. However, her current energy source can't fulfill her needs. She has to spend money and time charging her car battery every two or three days. As a result, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a reliable solar home systems. Ratha believes that by using this system, her family can save on utility fees and her parents will be able to live in comfortable conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Phlov Kou Village, Banteay Preal Commune,Rolea Pe

loans.name: Bernardita Del Rosario

texts.es:
Bernardita mujer ecuatoriana, nació en la ciudad de Latacunga, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos  y su esposo, Berardita  es una joven muy emprendedora y trabajadora, desde muy pequeña se dedicó a trabajar duro para ser un apoyo para sus padres, quienes lo han sacrificado todo para darle educación, pero que lamentablemente por no tener recursos económicos solamente le pudieron dar la educación secundaria, pero esto no ha sido obstáculo para ella, a pesar de que su madre falleció hace algunos años.
Actualmente Bernardita es empleada pública desde hace ya dos años, pero siempre se ha dedicado a la crianza de animales menores, y es por eso que en este momento desea emprender con la crianza y venta de cerdos ya que esto ayudaría mucho en su economía además de que le gusta esta actividad, todo esto lo aprendió de sus padres, desde muy pequeña, quienes han sido para ella un ejemplo de lucha constante. 
Hoy está solicitando un crédito para emprender con su sueño  ya que actualmente, la demanda  es muy buena, esto ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
Vino a la Fundación por muy buenas referencias y quiere agradecer muchísimo a quienes forman parte de esta noble institución quienes le han abierto las puertas para poder cumplir con su necesidad, es por eso que agradece a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Bernardita is a Ecuadorian woman born in the city of Latacunga. She lives in her own house with her husband and her children. Bernardita is an enterprising and hard-working young woman who since she was small has worked hard to be a support for her parents. They sacrificed everything to provide her with an education but unfortunately, due to a lack of resources, could only provide her with her secondary school education. But this has not been an obstacle for her in spite of the fact that her mother died a few years ago.

Currently Bernardita is a public employee. She has been for two years but she has also always raised small animals. For this reason at this time she wants to start raising and selling pigs as this will help her a lot with her finances. Plus she enjoys this activity a lot. She learned it from her parents when she was quite small. They have been an example of constant striving for her.

Today she is requesting a loan to begin her dream as right now demand is very good and this will help her improve her revenues.

She came to Fundación Alternativa through very good references and she wants to profoundly thank those who form part of this noble institution and have opened the door for her to fulfill her needs. She is grateful to Kiva for making possible the growth in her personal and family life.

loans.use: to start raising pigs, these additional revenues will help improve her and her family's finances.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more juice, soda, and milk for sale

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is 53 years old, married, and had three children. She is operating a store for income. She sells grocery items to gain income. She wanted to improve her earnings so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits, noodles, and soap to sell. This will help improve her sales and keep gaining regular customers. She will pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, noodles, and soap to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 45-year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marites has a general store business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like rice, canned goods, snack food, and other groceries.

Marites has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, canned goods, snack food, and other groceries.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a resident of Anai in Lira district, Uganda. She is 43 years old. She is a widow and has three children. Pictured is Grace with two of her children.

She is hardworking and provides financial support to her family single-handedly including educating her children and providing for other financial obligations. Grace is engaged in the business of selling agricultural produce in Lira's main market. Grace is doing well in her business because of high population in Lira town and this increases the demand for produce in Lira town. 

Grace has future plans of expanding her business, so she applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from UGAFODE microfinance to help her buy stocks of ground nuts and beans to boost her business. She is very grateful to UGAFODE and Kiva funders for the great financial support they have given to her. She would not be able to support her business if it weren't for the low interest loan from UGAFODE.

loans.use: to boost her produce trade.

loans.name: Aita's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de deux  femmes transformatrices a été crée depuis le 27/05/2005.Elles sont unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles .
Madame Aita la responsable est mariée et mère de trois filles et trois garçons tous scolarisés.Elle s'active dans le commerce de poissons et la transformation et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps. Son nouveau crédit de 430000 francs CFA lui permettra de se payer des paniers de poissons frais qu'elle va transformer et revendre au détails au niveau du marché de sa localité.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires et scolaires de ses enfants et de renforcer se épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group, composed of two transformative women, was created on May 27, 2005. They are united by good social and professional relationships. 

Mrs. Aita, who is in charge, is a married mother of three girls and three boys, all of whom are in school. She works in the sale and preparation of fish and has good experience in this area, having done it for a long time. 

Her new loan of 430,000 francs will allow her to pay for baskets of fresh fish that she will prepare and resell in retail at the market in her village. The profits she makes will allow her to cover the dietary and educational needs of her children and to increase her savings at the local bank.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fresh fish to prepare and then to sell.

loans.name: Salomon

texts.es: Salomón, tiene 40 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos con su esposa y reside en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara.  Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de chile, maíz y frijol. Hace 9 años decidió hacer cultivo de café el cual le genera sus ingresos para la familia, esta producción de café la vende en la misma zona. Ha decidido solicitar el tercer ciclo de prestamo en la institución, y es por 7,000 Lempiras para comprar abono para fertilizar su finca de café y mejorar la producción. Su idea es seguir cultivando para mejorar las utilidades y su economía.
texts.en:
Salomón is 40 years old. He is married. He and his wife have three children, and he lives in a village of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. He has always worked in agriculture, with the cultivation of chili peppers, corn, and beans. 

Nine years ago he decided to make a planting of coffee, which generates his income for the family. He sells this coffee production in the same zone.

He has decided to apply for the third loan cycle with the institution, and it is for 7,000 Lempiras to buy compost to fertilize his coffee farm and improve the production. His idea is to continue farming to improve his profits and his economy.

loans.use: to buy compost to fertilize his coffee farm.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is a 59-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has six adult children. To earn a living, Daniela has a hog raising business. She has been doing this business for 10 years. 

She works hard to have a better life in the future. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional piglets and feed. Thus, to have healthy piglets, she also plans to buy vitamins and medicines. In the future, Daniela wants to improve her business to have a better means of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, vitamins and medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for the agronomic management of his coffee crop

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 49-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has an 18-year-old son. Her husband is a construction worker, while she is engaged in a hog raising business. She has been doing this business for four years. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy two piglets, feed, and vitamins for the healthy growth of her pigs. Lydia plans to build a bigger piggery to have enough space so she could raise more pigs in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Meldrina

texts.en:
Meldrina is 47 years old and has four children. Meldrina is married and has two children who are in school.

Meldrina is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Meldrina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Meldrina has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Meldrina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sobia Shaheen

texts.en:
Sobia Shaheen is a 28-year-old married woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of three sons and her husband is a vehicle repair mechanic by profession. Her husband has been providing services to people in the form of vehicle repairing. He has been running a vehicle repair workshop in the market where he performs his services. He also has spare parts in the workshop to use in vehicles he repairs. 

Sobia's husband needs to purchase some equipment for his workshop. This purchase will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the needed items. Therefore his wife, Sobia Shaheen is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. This loan will help him to buy workshop items like tires, tubes, axles, brake shoes, etc. 

Sobia Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to buy workshop items like tires, tubes, axles, and brake shoes for her husband's vehicle repair workshop.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 34 años, es separada una situación muy difícil para ella ya que no tiene el apoyo económico de su ex esposo, es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que ha sacado a sus hijos adelante a pesar de su situación. Lastimosamente por falta de recursos de sus padres tan solo pudieron culminar sus estudios primarios.
María vive en el barrio San Luis en la parroquia Ignacio Flores una ubicación muy reconocida por la ganadería y la producción de leche. Ella se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, a la crianza y venta de animales, y tiene extra unas actividades en una plantación es así como puede obtener ingresos para mantener a sus hijos.
Solicita su crédito para comprar fertilizantes para su plantación y con estos ingresos extras podrá terminar su casa y así poder vivir más dignamente junto a sus hijos, agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a KIVA por la prestación que se le ha dado porque puede concluir con uno de sus sueños y poderles dar más comodidad a su hijos a pesar de la dura situación que está cruzando.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman of 34. She is separated, a very difficult situation for her, since she doesn't have economic support from her ex-husband. She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who has moved her children forward in spite of her situation. Unfortunately, because of the lack of resources of their parents, they were only able to compete their primary education.

Maria lives in the San Luis neighborhood in the Ignacio Flores parish, a location very well known for livestock raising and the production of milk. She does the domestic tasks, raises and sells animals, and has some extra work at a farm. This is how she is able to obtain income to support her children.

She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farm, and with this extra income she will be able to finish her house and thus be able to live in a more dignified manner along with her children. She is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the loan which has been granted her, because she can complete one of her dreams and be able to give more comfort to her children in spite of the difficult situation that they are going through.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm, and with this extra income from the sale of animals, she will be able to finish her house and live in dignity.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 31 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.
 
Mary Grace requested her fifth loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Cyvercadz Group

texts.en:
Nobelinda is the featured borrower of Cyvercadz group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon with a better income to support their beloved ones back home.

Nobelinda is a 49-year-old married mother of two children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions, so she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her daughter's necessary medical treatments. She is the first lady on the left. 

With respect to the other group members, Mirasol is the lady standing in the middle, and Felisa is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's necessary medical treatments

loans.name: Juan Bernabe

texts.es:
Al Noroccidente de Pichincha en San Miguel de los Bancos Recinto Saloya con un clima cálido húmedo con gente muy unida, trabajadora que se dedica a las labores del campo, vive Don Juan en unión libre y tiene un hijo de 6 años son una familia muy unida, él ha buscado la manera de triunfar en la vida uno de sus logros fue en este año comprar su propio vehículo para pertenecer a una compañía de taxis en Los Bancos ya que anteriormente solo era chofer.
Tiene muchos sueños que quisiera concretarlos uno de ellos es darle  a su pareja e hijo lo necesario dándole una buena educación para que en algún momento llegue a ser un profesional  y no tengan que pasar ninguna necesidad.
Don Juan desea invertir su crédito en el taxi de su propiedad ya que como lo usa todos los días de la semana necesita darle un buen mantenimiento, a esta actividad le dedica de 12 a 15 horas diarias, tiene mucha acogida debido a que tiene carreras diarias a distintos sectores del Noroccidente de Pichincha  con clientes e instituciones del sector, está convencido que sus ingresos mejorarán la situación de su hogar debido a que siempre le pone mucha fe y dedicación a las metas que se propone. 
Don Juan agradece profundamente a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada para mejorar su calidad de vida y poder pronto cumplir con sus sueños, está convencido que esta oportunidad que se le presenta debe aprovecharla al máximo.
texts.en:
To the northwest of Pichincha, in San Miguel de los Bancos in Recinto Saloya, the people are very united and hardworking.  This area has a warm and humid climate, and the people work mainly in agriculture.  This is where Juan lives.  He has a partner and a 6 year-old child.  They are a very united family.  He has sought a way to triumph in life.  One of his achievements was that this year he was able to buy his own vehicle and join a taxi company.  Prior to this he was only a driver.


Juan has a lot of dreams that he wants to achieve. One of these is to give his partner and child everything they need.  He also wants to give his son a good education so that he can become a professional and will not have to do without.

Juan wants to invest his loan in his taxi.  Since he uses it every day of the week, he needs to do some maintenance work on it.  He works 12 to 15 hours a day, and his business is well received because he makes daily runs to the various neighborhoods of northwestern Pichincha with customers and institutions from the area.  He is convinced that his income will rise and his household finances will improve, because he always puts a lot of faith and dedication into reaching his goals.  

Juan greatly thanks the Fundacion Alternativa and Kiva for the support and for the opportunity he is being provided with to improve his quality of life and rapidly achieve his dreams.  He is certain that he will be able to take maximum advantage of this opportunity.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on his taxi

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia, mujer emprendedora , tiene 42 años de edad, es soltera vive con dos hijos actualmente , ella solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, ella desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación con la que cuenta Cecilia y su familia es la falta de dinero para asistir de forma oportuna el café, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que ella hace una solicitud de crédito , es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Cecilia is an enterprising woman. She is 42 years old and single. She is living with two children now. She asked for a loan wishing to buy materials such as fertilizer and fumigation sprays. She wants to help her coffee crops in order to keep them is good condition during their growth so that she can have a quality yield. The only limitation that Cecilia and her family have is a lack of money to help the coffee at the right time, because they depend on this financial activity to get ahead. That is why she is asking for a loan. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had any other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with more ease of payment and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy materials for coffee.

loans.name: Oscar Alcibar

texts.es:
Al Noroccidente de Pichincha se encuentra ubicado el Cantón Pedro Vicente Maldonado un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo con  gente que lucha día a día por superarse, este Cantón es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros  ya que a los alrededores del mismo tienen varios sitios de descanso, distracción y muchas hosterías en las que se puede pasar momentos agradables en familia, a unos pocos minutos de este Cantón en el Recinto la Célica vía entrada Río Pescador ahí vive y tiene el negocio el señor Oscar un hombre luchador, es soltero no tiene hijos casi toda su vida paso viviendo con los papas ayudándolos en la finca, actualmente su Padre le cancela un mensual por las labores que realiza en la finca como es el cuidado y ordeño de vacas y también tiene en su propiedad tiene plantación de cacao que le ayuda a tener otro ingreso.
Aprendió de este negocio desde su niñez junto con los papas, entre el empleo como jornalero que en ocasiones realiza y el negocio trabaja un promedio de 8 horas por día, solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio y poder comprar los insumos y más plantas de cacao, con esta inversión mejorara la producción de cacao, el señor Oscar está pensando en pronto formar un hogar y tener hijos, por ese motivo quiere que sus ingresos económicos mejoren, Don Oscar agradece a Fundación Alternativa y Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
In northwest Pichincha there is the Pedro Vicente Maldonado canton, a canton with a warm, humid climate with people who fight to get ahead day to day.   This canton is much visited by national and international tourists because its surrounding areas have places to rest and play and there are a lot of hotels  where people can spend a lot of time with their families. A few minutes away from this canton is the Recinto la Célica on the way to Río Pescador. That is where Oscar lives. He is a fighter. He is single and doesn't have children. He has lived almost his whole life with his parents, helping them on the farm. Right now, his father pays him every month for the work he does on the farm such as caring for and milking cows. He also own a cacao farm which helps bring in more income.  

He learned this business since the time he was a child with his parents. Between the work he does sometimes as a laborer, and the business, he works an average of 8 hours a day. He is asking for this loan to invest in the business to buy materials and more cacao plants. With this investment, the cacao yield will improve. Oscar is planning on starting his own family soon and having children. That is why he wants to improve his income. Oscar is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and opportunity that have been given.

loans.use: to buy more  cacao plants. If everything goes well, he plans on starting a family and having children with financial standing to give them the best.

loans.name: Betsy Ann

texts.en:
Betsy Ann is 25 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them.

Betsy Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Betsy Ann has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Betsy Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: William Efrain

texts.es:
William es un joven productor de café del norte de Nicaragua, que vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 2 a 6 años de edad, en su pequeña parcela de 2.81 hectáreas, de las cuales 1.4 son de café. Su finca está certificada por Fairtrade, y en los últimos años ha venido mejorándola para incrementar su productividad.

Para garantizar las actividades de mantenimiento de su café este ciclo, él está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita asegurar la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que se requieren para asegurar una buena cosecha. William dice que este rubro es rentable y que la inestabilidad del mercado se puede enfrentar con los precios mínimos que ofrece el mercado Fairtrade, por lo que su objetivo es incrementar su producción y con ello sus ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
William is a young coffee producer from northern Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and three children, who are ages two to six years old, in his small 2.81 hectare parcel, of which 1.4 hectares are coffee. His farm is Fair Trade certified and in recent years he has been improving it to increase its productivity. 

He is requesting a loan to ensure the maintenance of his coffee this season. This will allow him to ensure the purchase of supplies and fertilizers that are required to ensure a good harvest. William says that this work is profitable and that the instability of the market can be faced with the minimum prices that the Fair Trade market offers. His goal is to increase his production and thus his income to improve his family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Esmeralda Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo junto con su esposo y sus cuatros hijos, habitan en casa de familiares ya varios años.
Margarita cuenta con su negocio desde hace años atrás, comenzó con la venta de ropa y cosméticos de manera ambulante, visitaba a su clientela fija, luego pudo poco a poco poner el negocio en su casa, con sus ahorros fue comprando vitrinas y surtiéndolo, actualmente es una microempresaria feliz ya que cuenta con su bazar y además vende artículos de papelería ya en su casa, donde puede estar también cerca y pendiente de sus hijos. Su esposo también le apoya mucho, él se dedica a la construcción, juntos han podido apoyar a sus hijos en la educación.
Margarita es clienta nueva de la institución, vino recomendada, con este crédito ella podrá surtir más su negocio, comprar mercadería para incrementar y mejorar su bazar. Se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad de seguir mejorando su negocio gracias a los créditos Kiva y de Fundación Alternativa.
texts.en:
Margarita lives in the city of Santo Domingo with her husband and her four children. They have been living in with relatives for several years. Margarita has had her business for several years. 

She started selling clothes and cosmetics door-to-door, she visited her regular clients. Gradually, she was able to put her business in her home. With her savings she bought cabinets and started supplying her business. She is currently a happy micro-entrepreneur because she has her store. She also sells paper supplies from her home where she can be close to her children and watching them. Her husband also supports her a lot, he works in construction. Together they have been able to support their children in their education. 

Margarita is a new client with this field partner, she was recommended. With this loan she will be able to stock her business and purchase merchandise to increase and improve her store. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity to keep improving her business thanks to Kiva loans and Fundacion Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and stock her store.

loans.name: Grupo San Jose Chacaya 4 Group

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer muy entusiasta, está unida a su esposo con el que tiene procreado diez hijos de las edades entre 18 y 30 años, ella tiene 52 años y vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Juana (la primera del lado derecho de blusa rojo) con el afán de seguir prosperando con su querida familia, ella desde hace diez años se dio cuenta que era muy necesario buscar una actividad donde pudiera generar sus ingresos, es por ello que la actividad que ella eligió fue el comercio, específicamente de la venta de mostacia, pero aparte de ello trabaja con el gobierno como trabajadora comunitaria.
Juana desde hace varios años ha tenido la iniciativa de poder comprar más mercaderías y ofrecerle a sus clientes una variedad de productos, sin embargo su mayor dificultad es no contar con el capital suficiente, es por ello que se ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más productos de bisutería porque realizar prestamos es la única manera de poder prosperar.
El gran sueño de Juana es poder hacer crecer su negocio para generar empleos a su comunidad.
texts.en:
Juana is a very enthusiastic woman, who is united with her husband with whom she has had ten children aged between 18 an 30 years old. She is 52 years old and she lives in a community in Sololá.
With the desire to continue prospering with her beloved family, ten years ago Juana (the one on the right in the red blouse) realized that it was very necessary to find an activity which could generate income. For that reason the activity she chose was trade, and specifically the sale of beaded necklaces, but as well as that she works with the government as a community worker.
A few years ago, Juana had the initiative to be able to buy more merchandise and offer her clients a variety of products; however, her biggest difficulty is not having sufficient capital. For that reason she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more jewelry products because getting loans is the only way to prosper.
Juana's biggest dream is to be able to grow her business to create jobs in the community.

loans.use: to buy jewelry products.

loans.name: Gwizumugisha Group

texts.fr:
Amélie  fait partie du groupe  Gwizumugisha  et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 48 ans et est marié à Fulgence, un menuisier. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants  dont 5 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de vin de banane   depuis  20 ans. 

Elle  est à son dixième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes  à transformer en bière de banane  à  vendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en: Amélie is a member of the Gwizumugisha group, and she lives in Gitega. She is 48 years old and is married to Fulgence, a carpenter. They have seven children together, five of whom are studying. She has sold banana wine for twenty years. This is her tenth loan with Turame. With this KIVA funding, she will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to turn into banana beer, which she will sell to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas to make banana beer for resale.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré depuis le 19 Novembre 2013, il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe. Elles vivent dans le même village et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Madame Fatou, âgée de 50ans (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 garçons et 03 filles. Elle s’active dans la transformation de savon artisanal.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter de la soude à 11000 et 01 sac de sel à 1500f et d’autres produits secondaires à 5000f et après transformation les revendre en détails dans son village

Les bénéfices lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins de la famille et leurs soins médicaux.
texts.en:
Inaugurated on 19th November 2013, the group members have a good rapport with each other. They live in the same village, and maintain relationships of mutual support and help. They are principally small traders. Fatou, 50 years old (standing on the far right in the photo with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of five boys and three girls. 
She is a manufacturer of artisanal soap. With her new loan, she intends to purchase sodium hydroxide for 11,000f, a sack of salt for 1,500f and other secondary products for 5,000f, and to sell the resulting product in the village in retail quantities.
The profits will allow her to meet the family's needs and also their medical costs.

loans.use: to buy sodium hydroxide, one sack of salt and other secondary products, and to sell the resulting manufactured product to customers in the village.

loans.name: Hawa's Group

texts.fr:
Inaugurer le 18 Septembre 2013 le banc villageois est composé des femmes qui habitent le même village, entreprennent des activités génératrices de revenus pour renforcer leur capacité de financement. Elles entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide et  s’activent dans le petit commerce. 

Madame Hawa, âgée de 57 ans (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 02enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de sucre, de thé et d’huile et d’autres condiments qu’elle achète dans un marché hebdomadaire et revend dans son village.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter de la marchandise d’un montant de 20000f tout les 15 jours pour le revendre en détails chez elle.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et faire de l’embouche.
texts.en:
Started on 18th September 2013, the village lending group is comprised of women who live in the same village, and undertake income-generating activities to increase their creditworthiness. They maintain relationships of solidarity and mutual support, and work as small traders.
Hawa, 57 years old (standing on the far right in the photo, with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of two children. 
She is a seller of sugar, tea, oil and other condiments, which she buys in a weekly market and resells in her village. With her new loan, she intends to buy merchandise for a value of 20,000f every fortnight in order to resell retail in her village. 
The profits will enable her to improve her family's living conditions and to fatten some livestock.

loans.use: to buy goods worth 20,000f every fortnight to resell at home.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Agée de 45 ans, Ami est une femme qui habite à Vakpossito . Mère de deux enfants, Ami  prépare et vend de la bouillie faite à base du maïs au bord de la route près de son domicile. Ami s’approvisionne chez une grossiste dans le quartier. Ami souhaite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs en vue de gagner plus de bénéfice et aider son mari à payer les frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
45 years old, Ami lives in Vakpossito . She is the mother of two children, and prepares and sells soup made from corn at the side of the road near her home.
Ami buys her supplies from a local wholesaler. She is requesting this loan to order sacks of corn; this will allow her to make more profit and to help her husband with paying the children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of corn.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Mère de cinq enfants, Abra est une femme âgée de 37 ans habitant à Vakpossito . Abra travaille activement pour gagner sa vie. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins, Abra vend des chaussures  dans son quartier et s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois. Abra demande ce crédit pour acheter des chaussures tapettes en vue d’en  tirer profit pour l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
A mother of five children, Abra is a 37 year old woman living in Vakpossito. Abra works hard to earn a living. In order to meet her needs, she sells shoes in her neighbourhood, and buys her supplies in the market twice a month.
Abra is requesting this loan to buy open-toed shoes with a view to making a profit to help her family.

loans.use: to buy four boxes of open-toed shoes.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Ayaba est une femme mariée sans enfant. Agée de 31 ans, Ayaba habite à Tokoin où elle exerce ses activités. Ayaba est une revendeuse de friperies de quartier en quartier qui s’approvisionne au marché une fois dans le mois. Ayaba sollicite ce crédit pour commander des friperies. Grâce à la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Ayaba compte accroitre son commerce et de répondre favorablement  aux attentes de ses clients.
texts.en: Ayaba is a married woman who has no children. She is 31 years old and lives in Tokoin where she carries out her business. She sells second-hand clothing from one district to the next and gets her supplies once a month from the market. Ayaba is requesting this loan so she can order some second-hand clothing. Thanks to the profit she makes, Ayaba is expecting to grow her business and to be able to meet her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy a bale of blouses, a bale of skirts and a bale of women's underwear.

loans.name: Urunani Group

texts.fr:
Roger fait partie du groupe  Urunani  et  habite à  Gitega. Il  a 32 ans et est marié à Catherine, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants dont 1 étudie.

Il fait le commerce du riz, du haricot, du sel,…dans sa boutique  depuis  7 ans. 

Il  est à son sixième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de haricot et de riz  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait être un importateur.
texts.en:
Roger belongs to the Urunani group and lives in Gitega. He is 32 years old and married to Catherine, who is a trader. They have three children together, one of whom is studying.

Roger has been selling rice, beans, salt... in his shop for the past seven years, and he is on his sixth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is granted he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of beans and rice to resell, so he can make more money.

In the coming years he would like to become an importer.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of beans and rice to resell, so he can earn more.

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr: Ayawavi est une femme mariée âgée de 55 ans résidant à Baguida. Ayant cinq enfants à charge, Ayawavi  est une commerçante des céréales  et des chaussures en plastiques qu’elle achète au marché quatre fois par mois et le revendent  à domicile ou dans les quartiers environnant. Ayawavi demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de riz et de maïs en vue de faire des bénéfices et aider son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Ayawavi is a 55-year old married woman, who lives in Baguida and has five children in her care. She sells cereals and plastic shoes, which she buys from the market four times a month and then sells from home and in the surrounding districts. Ayawavi is requesting this loan to order sacks of rice and corn and make some profit so she can help her husband to take good care of their children.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice and one sack of corn.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.fr: Mariée et mère d’un enfant, Déborah est une femme qui habite à Baguida. Agée de 30 ans, Déborah est une couturière qui confectionne  des habits et les revendent  de quartier en quartier. Désirant commander des pièces de pagnes et des fermetures, Déborah fait sa provision au marché  une fois par mois. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Déborah compte investir dans la scolarisation de son enfant.
texts.en: Déborah, who is married with one child, is a 30-year old woman who lives in Baguida. She is a seamstress who makes up clothes and sells them from one district to the next. She would like to order some "pagne" fabric and zippers and she gets her supplies once a month from the market. Déborah is planning to invest the profit she makes from this activity in her child's education.

loans.use: to buy four pairs of "pagne" fabric.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: Veuve femme de 86 ans, Fatima habite à Baguida et a neuf enfants à charge. Malgré son âge avancé, Fatima se bat énormément dans son commerce de poissons fumée pour subvenir  à ses propres besoins ceux de ses enfants. Fatima fait recourt à ce crédit pour commander des paniers de poissons fumées en vue d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Fatima is an 86-year old widow who lives in Baguida and has nine children in her care. Despite her advanced years, she battles on in her business of selling smoked fish so that she can provide for her own needs, as well as those of her children. She is requesting this loan to order baskets of smoked fish so that she will have a significant stock and be able to maximise her profit and help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy 14 baskets of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To be able to pay for the ACE cook stove which will improve his life in terms of health, cost of fuel and the time he spends collecting firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy medicines.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Agée de 46 ans et mère de trois enfants, Ayawa est une femme divorcée habitant  à Baguida. Ayawa prépare et vend de la pâte bandée accompagné des poulets et des poissons frits  dans son quartier. Dans le souci d’accroitre son commerce et de maximiser son profit, Ayawa sollicite ce crédit pour commander du maïs, des poulets et des poissons afin de faire usage du bénéfice qui en résultera pour inscrire tous ses enfants dans des écoles de haut niveau.
texts.en:
46 years old and the mother of three children, Ayawa is a divorced woman living in Baguida. She prepares and sells "pâte bandée" with chicken and fried fish, in her local neighbourhood.
With a view to growing her business, and maximising her profit, Ayawa is requesting this loan to order corn, chickens and fish. She will use the resulting profit to register all her children in top quality schools.

loans.use: to buy one sack of corn, fifteen chickens and fifteen fish.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Akouvi est une femme mariée résidant à Baguida. Akouvi est âgée de 36 ans et est une revendeuse de pâtes dentifrices  et de brosses à dents qu’elle s’approvisionne au marché six fois par mois et le revend en se promenant de quartier en quartier. Akouvi nécessite ce crédit pour commander des pâtes dentifrices  et des brosses à dents afin de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The mother of three children, Akouvi is a married woman living in Baguida. Akouvi is 36 years old and is a reseller of toothpaste and toothbrushes, which she buys at the market six times a month and resells on a mobile basis from neighbourhood to neighbourhood.
Akouvi needs this loan to order toothpaste and toothbrushes, in order to make a profit to help with the school education of her children.

loans.use: to buy ten packets of toothpaste and three toothbrushes.

loans.name: Singnessigui Group

texts.fr:
Amadou est  un cultivateur âgé de 52 ans, il vit au Mali avec sa femme et ses trois enfants âgés  de 03 à 13 ans non scolarisés. Il fait l’élevage de mouton depuis trois ans .C’est lui qui est s’accroupié sur la photo.
Il s’approvisionne et vend ses produits dans les villages environnants  de sa localité. Il sollicite un prêt auprès du RMCR pour acheter beaucoup de moutons  à élever  , et même les bœufs  en vue de gagner beaucoup de revenus pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille : scolariser ses enfants, construire un habitat en dure pour ses enfants
texts.en:
Amadou is a 52 year old farmer. He lives in Mali with his wife and three children aged between three and 13 years who do not attend school. He has been a sheep farmer for three years. He is the person who is crouching in the photo.
He buys his stock and sells his goods in the villages neighbouring his home, he requests this loan from RMCR to buy many sheep for raising, and even some bullocks in order to earn a good income to provide for his family: send his children to school, and build a permanent house for his children.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes, cosmetics etc.

loans.name: Reina Bertila

texts.es: Doña Reina, tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y reside en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Hace dos años tiene una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, pan, harina, azúcar, maíz, churros, productos de aseo,  condimentos etc. El prestamo que solicita es por 15,000 lempiras para comprar maíz, frijol, refrescos, azúcar, pan, harina, manteca, huevos y productos de limpieza. Este prestamo le ayudara a poder comprar más productos para surtir y aumentar las ventas. Tiene como meta tener siempre el negocio como su fuente de ingresos y salir adelante.
texts.en: Reina is 60 years old. She is a single mother and has three children. She lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. She has had a grocery store for two years where she sells basic family products such as rice, beans, butter, eggs, bread, flour, sugar, corn, churros, toiletries, condiments, etc. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 lempiras to buy corn, beans, soft drinks, sugar, bread, flour, butter, eggs and cleaning products. This loan will help her to be able to buy more products to stock up and increase her sales. She aims to always have her business as her source of income and to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, soft drinks, sugar, bread, flour, butter, eggs and cleaning products to stock up her business.

loans.name: Tres Marias Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda ella es soltera y tiene 36 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de libreria, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “TRES MARIAS”. This bank is located in Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member, Hilda, is single and is 36 years old and has one child. She works in her business selling cereals. She sells corn, wheat and quinoa. She works from 8am to 5pm. She is an entrepreneurial woman who sells cereals through this business. She is asking for a loan to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

The other members earn a living with a book shop business, a business selling vegetables, a grocery shop business and a restaurant business. 

This member thanks those of form part of her dream through this and she is committed to making the repayments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo varios años, una ciudad muy comercial y productiva, conocida en el país por ser el puente terrestre que une a la sierra de la costa. 
Gustavo es cliente fiel de la fundación desde hace 5 años, fidelizado ya que gracias a estos créditos él ha podido ir fortaleciendo su negocio. En el centro de la ciudad cuenta con un local donde confecciona ropa, es sastre muchos años; le ha ido muy bien incluso ha podido incrementar máquinas de coser, además gracias a sus ingresos ha podido realizar mejoras en su vivienda.
Ahora este crédito lo invertirá en materia prima como telas, hilos, cierres y demás para seguir confeccionando más ropa y poder mantenerse en su negocio; agradece mucho a la Fundación y al proyecto Kiva por hacer posible que los microempresarios puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gustavo has been living in the city of Santo Domingo for a number of years. The city has a lot of trade and manufacturing, and is known in the country as being a bridge between the coastal and highland regions.

Gustavo has been a faithful customer at Fundación Alternativa for five years. He is loyal as, thanks to loans, he has been able to continue to strengthen his business. Gustavo has premises in the centre of the city where he makes clothes. He has been a tailor for many years; the work has gone well, and he has even been able to increase the number of sewing machines he has. In addition, thanks to his income, he has been able to make improvements to his home.

Now, Gustavo will invest this loan in basic supplies such as threads, materials, zips and more in order to continue producing clothes and to be able to keep his business going. Gustavo is very grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for making it possible for small-time entrepreneurs to move forward.

loans.use: to purchase thread, fabric, and clasps in order to continue working toward his goal of owning a small business.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y dos hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud de crédito , y es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Humberto is an enterprising man aged 38. He is married and lives with his wife and two children. He is requesting a loan because he wants to buy inputs such as compost and fumigants to look after his coffee plants, so that they are in good condition during their development and so that he obtains a high-quality product.

The only thing limiting this man is that he does not have enough money to continue growing. They depend on this economic activity to move forwards. This is why he is requesting a loan, which will be his first from FUDECOSUR. He does not have other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has made it easier for him to get the loan with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to look after his coffee plants.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo es una ama de casa residente en un barrio del municipio de Cartagena de Indias, ella inició su proyecto de negocio apoyada por una fundación y en la actualidad cuenta con quince años de estar vinculada a la comercialización de cervezas y alquiler de lavadoras.  Todos los días ella está dispuesta a ofrecer de sus servicios a partir de las 8 a.m. desde su residencia a sus vecinos y residentes del sector, hoy en día está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar cerveza al por mayor y dos lavadoras para su alquiler. Con esta inversión podrá responder a las demandas de sus clientes y así mismo sus ingresos se elevarán al obtener descuentos por compras al por mayor. Su meta a futuro es continuar creciendo en sus negocios.
texts.en: Consuelo is a housewife in a neighbourhood in the municipality of Cartagena de Indias. She started her business project supported by a foundation and now she has 15 years of being involved in selling beer and renting washing machines. Every day she is available to offer her services from 8am from her home to her neighbours and people who live in the area. Now she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy beer in bulk and two washing machines to rent. With this investment she will be able to meet the demands of her customers and also her income will increase when she gets discount on buying in bulk. Her future aim is to continue growing with her businesses.

loans.use: to buy beer in bulk and two washing machines to rent.

loans.name: Thabitha

texts.en: Thabitha is a 47-year-old mother with a total willingness to work. She hails from the Nandihills area of Kenya, an area that has good rainfall patterns and is known for tea farming. Thabitha has six children whom she adores and cherishes, and a handsome husband who always paints a smile on Thabitha's face. Thabitha has been practicing mixed farming for the past three years, and is making great strides. She has been able to earn a decent and honest living through milk and egg selling, and personal business. These ventures have enabled her to send her children to school and feed her family. Thabitha has planted many trees on her compound, and also has Napier grass, which has high protein and is used to feed her dairy cow, thereby enhancing her milk-selling profits. Because of increased demand, Thabitha is kindly requesting a loan to buy a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is a very profitable venture, and she wants to take full advantage of the ready market for dairy products. Through the loan, Thabitha is sure of satisfying the demand for milk in her area. Through increased profits, Thabitha is sure that she will repay the loan on time and also be in a position to comfortably take care of her family. Thabitha, with her entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, would like to continue fighting so that she can achieve her dream of owning her own business and empowering society by being a source of employment. Juhudi Kilimo, through its training, has helped Thabitha save more effectively, and through her accumulated profits, she plans to add value to her milk through packaging. She also hopes to one day start manufacturing milk products such as yogurt and cream.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Piedad Del Socorro

texts.es:
Piedad es una mujer con 46 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos ya mayores.

Con el deseo de colaborarle a su esposo económicamente en las necesidades de su hogar, Piedad, desde su casa vende mercancía como de uso personal.

Es una actividad que viene realizando desde hace 6 años y con la cual ha podido lograr una mediana independencia financiera.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de desodorantes, cremas de manos, lociones y todo tipo de productos que le permitirán aumentar y mejorar su inventario.
texts.en:
Piedad is 46 years old, married and a mother to two children, now adults.

With a desire to help her husband with household costs, Piedad sells personal products from her home. She has been doing this work for six years and through it she has gained some financial independence.

Piedad is applying for a loan in order to buy stock, including deodorants, hand creams, lotions, and all sorts of products that will allow her to increase and improve her inventory.

loans.use: to buy stock, including deodorants, hand creams, lotions, and all sorts of products that will allow her to increase and improve her inventory.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 60 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Florencia has a general sore business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Florencia has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Florencia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Srouy

texts.en: Srouy, 52, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village in the Prey Prorsorb district of Kratie province, Cambodia. She has struggled to feed and care for her children by growing soybeans and cassava, which she has been doing for 34 years. Together, they can earn her about 45,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 30,000 KHR each day for the future. The main challenge for her business is the dropping of cassava’s price at the market. Srouy is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her crops. She hopes to grow her cassava and soybeans healthily and raise more healthy crops to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her crops

loans.name: Justo Leocadio

texts.es:
Justo es un productor de una pequeña comunidad en el norte de Nicaragua. Junto a su esposa e hijos se ha dedicado a la caficultura desde hace 25 años. Produce alrededor de 90 quintales de café pergamino por ciclo. Sus metas son tecnificar su finca y aumentar los rendimientos de su producción a través del buen manejo, mantenimiento y administración que ha comenzado a implementar en su pequeña finca.

Como parte de este proceso de mejoramiento, Justo solicita un financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos; con los que mejorará la nutrición de las plantas de café con que cuenta y aumentará su cosecha. Su sueño es mejorar la condición económica de su familia por lo que se ha propuesto reinvertir parte de sus utilidades para aumentar las áreas establecidas.
texts.en:
Justo is a producer from a small community in the north of Nicaragua. Alongside his wife and children, he has dedicated himself to coffee farming for 25 years. He produces around 90 quintals of parchment coffee (dry coffee) per cycle. His goals are to introduce technology to his farm and expand his production yields through good management and administration that he has started to implement on his small farm.

As part of this improvement process, Justo is requesting a loan to buy chemical and organic fertilizers with which he will improve the nutrition of the coffee plants and increase his harvest. His dream is to improve the economic condition of his family so he has proposed to reinvest part of his profits in increasing established areas.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers that will improve the nutrition of his coffee crop and generate a better yield.

loans.name: Diala

texts.en:
Diala is a Palestinian entrepreneur who lives in Ramallah where the unemployment is very high. A year ago, Diala graduated from the university where she studied Media & Press and, unfortunately, did not find a job.

Diala decided to go to Palestine for credit and development (FATEN) to take a USD loan that will enable her to buy a camera and work it out. Diala dreams of being a professional, owning her own business, helping her family and serving her country

Diala appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a camera

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Día a día, Jorge recorre las calles de la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias en su triciclo, ofreciendo a sus habitantes bebidas aromática, café y golosinas. Cuenta con diez años de experiencia en esta actividad y es muy reconocido por los sectores que habitualmente transita; cuando se inició en esta labor no tenía ni la más menor idea sobre este negocio pero con la ayuda de un amigo pudo instruirse y llevar a cabo su negocio.  Jorge sale a vender sus bebidas y golosinas a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. todos los días de la semana, su compromiso y dedicación le han permitido mantenerse en el negocio para el cual está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en café y azúcar para la preparación de su producto estrella.  Su meta a futuro es tener varios triciclos y poder ofrecer empleo a otras personas, así mismo continuar ofreciéndole educación a sus dos hijos menores de edad.
texts.en: Day after day, Jorge travels the streets of the city of Cartagena de Indias on his tricycle offering aromatic drinks, coffee and candies to its residents. He has ten years experience with this work and is well known in the areas where he travels regularly. When he began this work, he didn't have a clue about this business but with the help of a friend who was able to teach him and conduct his business. Jorge sells his drinks and candies from 8AM until 6PM every day of the week. His commitment and dedication have allowed him to stay in business for which he is applying for his first crediKiva from the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo which he will invest in coffee and sugar to make his star product. His goal in the future is to have many tricycles and be able to offer employment to other people, as well as keep offering education to his two young children.

loans.use: to invest in coffee and sugar to make his star product.

loans.name: Aura Delia

texts.es:
Aura es una señora de 59 años, vive junto a su esposo en la ciudad de Santo Domingo. Cuentan con casa propia en donde tienen su negocio hace años atrás. La señora Aura se dedica a la venta de víveres, una pequeña tienda que gracias a ella ha podido salir adelante e incluso apoyar a su esposo que ya no puede conseguir un trabajo.
Es clienta de la institución desde hace dos años atrás, con un buen comportamiento de pagos, Aura solicita crédito para seguir fortaleciendo e incrementando su negocio, podrá comprar arroz, aceite, azúcar, legumbres y víveres en general, con ello podrá seguir mejorando poco a poco su negocio que es la fuente principal de ingresos en su hogar.
Agradece a la institución y al proyecto Kiva por permitir que pequeños microempresarios sigan superándose.
texts.en:
Aura is 59 years old, and she lives with her husband in the city of Santo Domingo. They have their own home, where they have had their business for years. Aura makes a living selling groceries in a small store. Thanks to this, she has been able to move forwards and even support her husband, who is no longer able to find work.
