She has been a client of the institution for two years, and has a good payment history. Aura is requesting a loan to continue strengthening and growing her business. She will use it to buy rice, oil, sugar, vegetables and general provisions so that she can continue to improve her business, which is the main source of income in her household.

She is grateful to the institution and the Kiva project for enabling small microentrepreneurs to continue bettering themselves.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, vegetables and general groceries so that she can continue to improve her business, which is the main source of household income.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en: Marianita is a 54-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has no children. Her husband is a barber while she runs a small eatery in their place. They work hard together to earn a living. She has been doing this business since then. Marianita is requesting a loan to buy meat, vegetables, spices, milled rice and some utensils like a kettle and pan. She wants, in the future, to be successful in her business as well as in her means of living.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, spices, milled rice, a kettle and pan.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 34 años, soltero, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la escuela primaria y luego la falta de recursos económicos lo llevó a trabajar desde muy chico para poder sustentar sus necesidades. A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, él no se negó buscar cualquier medio para salir adelante y superarse, su madre ha sido para él un gran apoyo tanto moral como económico y juntos han podido salir adelante, su casa queda ubicada en la ciudad de Latacunga, de la provincia de Cotopaxi perteneciente a la República del Ecuador.
Juan se dedica a la albañilería desde hace varios años y hoy en día desea emprender su propio negocio, el mismo que se trata de la crianza y venta de pollos, Juan heredó de su madre la habilidad para trabajar en esta actividad y cuenta con experiencia.
Con la experiencia que ha adquirido a través de los años y experimentando el crecimiento que puede tener con este negocio, Juan  se siente preparado para dar un paso de crecimiento para lo cual solicita un crédito que lo utilizará en el emprendimiento del mismo, esto ayudará a mejorar sus estilo de vida y el de su familia.
Juan y su familia agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Juan is 34 years old and single. Thanks to his parents' hard work, he managed to finish primary school. Later, the lack of money brought him to work from a young age in order to pay for necessities. In spite having a very time-consuming job, Juan did not turn his back on any method that would allow him to move onwards and upwards. Juan's mother has been a great support to him, both financially and morally. Together they have moved forward. They have a house in the city of Latacunga, in Cotopaxi province in Ecuador.

Juan has been a builder for a number of years. Now he wants to start his own business raising and selling chickens. Juan learned the skills for this work from his mother, and he has experience in the trade.

With the experience that he has gained over the years, and with the potential for growth at this business, Juan feels prepared to move forward. He is therefore applying for a loan in order to start this business. This will help him to improve his and his family's lifestyle.

Juan and his family are grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making growth in their professional and personal lives possible.

loans.use: to start up his chicken-raising business; this will help her to improve his and his family's lifestyle.

loans.name: Jose Danilo

texts.es:
José Danilo es un productor que vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. A sus 38 años y con el apoyo de su compañera de vida e hijos, ha logrado en la caficultura los ingresos económicos necesarios para salir adelante como agricultor.

Este pequeño productor está integrado al proceso de certificación de Comercio Justo, y con 2 manzanas de café, logró producir en el último ciclo 60 quintales pergamino. Para este ciclo, José está solicitando un crédito para asegurar la compra de fertilizantes y abonos que le permita asegurar la demanda de nutrición de sus plantaciones, y con ello obtener mejores rendimientos. 

El incremento de su producción, así como el de la calidad de su café son las metas que este productor se ha propuesto para mejorar la productividad de su finca y con ello las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
José Danilo is a producer who lives in a community in the north of Nicaragua. At 38 years of age and with the support of his partner and their children, he has managed, through coffee farming, to earn the necessary economic income to succeed as a farmer.

This small producer is a member of the Fair Trade certification process and with two plots of coffee he has managed to produce 60 quintals of parchment coffee in the last cycle. For this cycle, Jose is requesting a loan to ensure the purchase of chemical and organic fertilizers that will allow him to ensure the nutritional demands of his plants and with this obtain better profits.

The increase in his production, as well as the quality of his coffee, are the goals that this producer has proposed to improve the productivity of his farm and, with this, the conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizers that will help achieve better coffee production.

loans.name: Yahuar Maqui Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonieta continua con su negocio de restaurant, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua  preparando  diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a  este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia que está  pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidió permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia solicito el credito para la compra de carnes,aceite,arroz entre otros.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Yahuar Maqui communal bank, located in the district, province and department of Cuzco. 

Antonieta,continues to work in her restaurant. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She continues to prepare different dishes such as chicken and potatoes, soups and meat stir fry. She has been doing this work for years and it’s going well thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. This is how she supports her family. 

The member photograph that is inserted with the group photo was taken after the meeting as she requested permission to be absent due to work commitments.

Antonieta is grateful to those who are part of her dream in this way and is committed to making her repayments within the agreed period. She is requesting the loan to buy meat, oil, rice and other items.

loans.use: to buy meat, oil, rice and other items.

loans.name: Uurtsaikh

texts.en:
Mrs. Uurtsaikh, 43 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a nurse at a hospital for 23 years. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Their children study at university. 

The house her family lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs urgent repair. So she is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. 

By doing so her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating during winter and which releases less pollution into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Mercedes works hard to support her family.

She has a rice milling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Mercedes is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her rice milling business.

Mercedes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her rice milling.

loans.name: Ma. Gemma

texts.en:
Ma. Gemma is 34 years old, married and has five children. Four of her children are in school.

Ma. Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Gemma has borrowed and paid back 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing.

Ma. Gemma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cerapio Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cerapio del Carmen es un productor del norte de Nicaragua. Es padre de 6 hijos a quienes  ha criado junto a su esposa con los ingresos obtenidos de la producción de café. En el ciclo anterior su cosecha de café fue de 180 quintales pergamino lo cual es un buen rendimiento, producto del manejo que ha venido implementando en su finca.

Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos que le permita asegurar el mantenimiento de 3.5 manzanas de café; con los que aumentará la productividad y rentabilidad en la próxima cosecha. Su meta es aumentar las áreas de siembra para mejorar la condición económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Cerapaio del Carmen is a producer in the north of Nicaragua. He is a father of six children who he has brought up with his wife with the income from his coffee production. In his last cycle his coffee harvest was of 180 units of 100lbs of pergamino coffee which is a good yield and was the product of the management that he has carried out on his farm.

For this cycle, he is asking for funding to buy supplies that will allow him to ensure the maintenance of 3.5 blocks of coffee, with which he will increase the productivity and profitability of the next harvest. His aim is to increase the area where he plants coffee in order to improve the financial situation of his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies that he will apply to his coffee plantation and to increase the productivity of his farm.

loans.name: Twifatanye Sub Group A

texts.en: Chakira, 32 years old, is a group leader She is married with four children between 5 and 15 years old. The group is called TWIFATANYE, which means “Come together” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their future for the better. She has a shop and has been running a business for 13 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more meat for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more meat for sale.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang, 22, is a widow living with her child in a rural village of the Keo Seima district of Mondulkiri province, Cambodia. She earns a living through growing cassava and working for others for a fee. She has been in this business for five years, earning about 50,000 KHR per day and is able to save about 30,000 KHR each day after expenses for the future needs. Her cassava has been destroyed by insects and this is the main challenge for her business.  

Neang has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and she completely repaid the past loan, which has helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and support her business. Now she is forming a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland to produce good yields.  She hopes to timely grow her cassava in order to sell them for a good price so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland to produce good yields.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es: Verónica tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos pequeños. Verónica vive en el Estado de México. Ella estudió diseño de modas de alta costura, antes tenía un empleo en ese ramo diseñando y haciendo vestidos sin embargo cuando nacieron sus hijos quiso pasar más tiempo con ellos. Desde hace 3 años ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catálogo, es un negocio muy redituable para ella porque conoce a muchas personas y tiene muchos clientes, ella con su negocio quiere poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, una mejor escuela y actividades extraescolares, desde luego sus hijos son su principal motivación para poder alcanzar esto. Con un préstamo de MXN 5,000 ella podrá invertir en nuevos modelos de zapatos y poder ofrecerles a sus clientes los zapatos más modernos y actuales. Se define como emprendedora por las ganas que le pone a su trabajo y por las cosas nuevas que le gusta aprender a diario. Ella agradece mucho a todas las personas que le apoyaran con su negocio ofreciendo a sus clientes los zapatos más actuales y también porque a través de su negocio podrá ofrecerles una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Verónica is 27 years old, married and has 3 small children. Verónica lives in México State. She studied high fashion design and used to have a job in this field, designing and making dresses. However, when her children were born, she wanted to spend more time with them. 

For 3 years now, she has dedicated her time to selling shoes by catalog. It is a very profitable business for her because she knows a lot of people and has a lot of customers. With her business, she hopes to provide her children with a better quality of life, a better school and extracurricular activities. Of course, her children are her primary motivation to be able to reach this goal. 

With a loan of MXN 5,000, she will be able to invest in new shoe designs and offer her customers the most modern, up-to-date shoes. She defines herself as an entrepreneur because of the enthusiasm that she brings to her work and because she likes to learn something new every day. She appreciates everyone who supported her business so she can offer her customers the latest shoe styles and also because, through her business, she will be able to provide a better life to her children.

loans.use: To invest in new shoe styles

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is from Camarin Caloocan City, Philippines. She’s already 47 years old and her source of income is selling onions, garlic as well as a manicure/pedicure business. She’s been doing this for 8 years now. Each month, her monthly earnings from the two businesses she has are approximately PHP 12,000. She’s importing garlic and onions then selling those at the market. After a long day of work outside then she does her manicure/pedicure business either at home or as an on-call service.

Though the whole day of work is tiring, since these are her only sources of income, diligence and perseverance should always be her standpoint. Her utmost dreams are to have her own investments - they could be properties or saving for their future and support for her children’s education. For this reason, she applied for a PHP 35,000 loan so that she can buy 15 sacks of garlic and 20 sacks of onions. She plans to buy materials for the manicure/pedicure business as well.

Agripina believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from member’s life-changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays Micro Finance loans and  hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: To buy 15 sacks of garlic and 20 sacks of onions for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in primary materials for the preparation of buns and also to purchase food to raise pigs.

loans.name: Judy Betty

texts.es:
Judy tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su conyuge e hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Judy se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la mejora en la infraestructura de su corral y compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Judy espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Judy is 43 years old, is in a common law marriage and lives with her spouse and children in a rural section of the Oyotún district that is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. The population in this district primarily works in agriculture, cattle and commerce. 

Judy raises and sells small animals, such as chicks, roosters, hens, ducks, turkeys, etc. Her business is located at her residence. She has 5 years of experience in this field and has very good personal and professional references in the region. The loan she is requesting will be used to improve the infrastructure of her corral and buy more animals, such as hens, ducks, turkeys, chicks, etc., as well as to buy the balanced feed for them. 

Judy hopes to offer a better end product to her customers, which will allow her to earn more and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To improve the infrastructure of her corral and buy more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cold meats, bread, potatoes, and tables and chairs.

loans.name: Dante Joel

texts.es:
Dante es un joven estudiante de SENATI que proviene de la ciudad de Puno, ubicada en el Altiplano de nuestra Sierra Peruana.

Él emigró junto a su familia a Lima, en busca de un mejor futuro profesional, por lo que decidió estudiar la carrera de Mecánica de Mantenimiento de Maquinaria de Confección Textil en SENATI, carrera que le gusta mucho porque tiene familiares en Puno que desde mucho antes se dedican a esa actividad.

Dante está cursando el I Semestre de la carrera, y le parece muy interesante por todo lo que está aprendiendo. Desea mucho el apoyo de KIVA porque su familia se encuentra en una situación económica muy difícil y pone en riesgo la continuidad de la carrera que recién está iniciando y tanto le gusta.

Él se siente muy agradecido desde ya por el apoyo que KIVA le pueda brindar para que pueda continuar estudiando y no trunque sus sueños de llegar a formar su propia empresa para poder apoyar a su familia.
texts.en: Dante is a young student at SENATI who comes from the city of Puno located in the high plains of the Peruvian Sierras. Together with his family, he emigrated to Lima in search of a better professional future through which he decided to study for a degree in Textile Clothing Manufacturing Mechanical Machinery Maintenance at SENATI. This is a degree that he likes very much because he has family in Puno who worked in this career a long time ago. Dante is completing the first semester of of the degree and he seems very interested in everything that he is learning. He desires the support from Kiva because his family is in a very difficult situation economically and it puts his ability to continue the degree he recently started and likes so much at risk. Dante is very grateful for the support that Kiva is providing so that he can continue to study and not truncate his dreams of being able to start his own business to be able to support his family.

loans.use: to cancel debt from Textile Clothing Mechanical Machinery Maintenance school.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene’s business of selling dry goods is continuously growing. She considered Center for Community Transformation (CCT) as God’s medium of blessing to her. She’s delighted of having CCT since the prior loan of PHP 10, 000 was granted. And the amount has been a supplementary capital for her business’ growth. She was able to buy necessary items for the business to become more appealing to customers since it should have items on stock and complete as per consumer’s needs and demands.

Competition in this line of business is what challenges her. Proper marketing strategy and good treatment to customers are the qualities that she has, that’s why for the past seven years she has had the business and it’s still growing. She’s able to support her children’s education because of her diligence and determination.

However, she’s not satisfied about the recent status of the business since, as an entrepreneur, you should always think of ways to step up. She applied for another loan of PHP 10, 000 for she wants her business to be a one-stop shop of dry goods. She’s hoping that her request will be granted.

On a weekly basis, Arlene meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, her experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and religion. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social relationship with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional meat products and fruit staples she needs to increase her product inventory and provide more for her family.

loans.name: Gulniso

texts.ru: Гулнисо 47 летняя женщина. Она жительница города Куляб. Гулнисо в городе живет вместе двумя дочерями. Дочкам 22 и 15  лет. Младшая дочка учится в средней школе. Гулнисо активная и талантливая женщина. 5 лет назад после развода она решила заниматься пошивом женской одежды у себя дома, чтобы прокормить детей. Гулнисо тяжело одному зарабатывать и обеспечить семью. Но она старается ради детей. Гулнисо и ее дети живут в старом безремонтном доме. Гулнисо берет кредит, чтобы улучшить жилищные условия. Она решила купить стройматериалы и отремонтировать дом. Гулнисо надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulniso is a 47-year-old woman, a resident of Kulob town. She lives together with her two daughters who are 22 and 15 year old. The younger daughter is a secondary school student. Gulniso is an active and talented woman. After her divorce five years ago, she decided to take up sewing from home to earn a living and provide for her kids. 

As a single mom, Gulniso finds it difficult to make enough money to provide for her family, still she is doing her best for her daughters' sake. Gulniso and her kids live in an old house in need of renovations. Gulniso requested a loan to improve their living conditions. She is going to buy construction materials and renovate the house. She is hoping for your support!

loans.use: to buy construction materials for repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, chips, biscuits, candies, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, spices, vinegar, powdered milk, juice and chocolate drink.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
In the first year of managing the variety store business, Lorna thought that it would be difficult, considering the market competition and customer demands. However, she’s grateful that the prior loan of PHP 10, 000 was approved and became a great help for her business to step up. Lorna once again wants to express her gratitude.

She considers the business to be growing each year, despite the competition. Approximately PHP 31, 200 is her monthly earnings, and that is one of the sources for their day-to-day expenses and support for her family. She’s managing the business with her husband, Joey, who is a foreman. Every time Joey is available, he’s helping Lorna in running the business.

They decided to apply for another loan of PHP 15, 000 to add products for their variety store business like grocery items and bottled drinks. Complete product lines will indeed increase sales and profit.

Despite being busy managing the business, Lorna still spares time for attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hears testimonies from other CCT partners, studies religion, builds social relationships with other partners, and pays microfinance loans.

loans.use: to add products for her variety store business like grocery items and bottled drinks.

loans.name: Buuzainap

texts.ru: Буузайнап, 62 года, замужем, есть 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, занимается животноводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Буузайнап есть корова, 10 овец, плодоносящий сад. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 15,800 сомов (KGS). Буузайнап обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит скот для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита позволят Буузайнап увеличить ее хозяйство.
texts.en: Buuzainap is 62 years old, married, with four kids. She has completed secondary education. She breeds livestock for a living. Currently, Buuzainap owns a cow, 10 sheep, and a fruitful garden. Her monthly income is 15,800 som (KGS). She turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS), which she is going to use to buy more livestock to increase the herd's headcount. The borrowed money will help Buuzainap expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Smart 2 Group

texts.en:
Estelita is the featured borrower of Smart 2 group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their home town in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon with a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Estelita, age 69 and a widowed mother of three, supports her family by cooking and selling traditional Filipino food. She hopes eventually to help improve the family's overall living conditions. She will use her loan funds to develop her business by purchasing ingredients that will help her provide her customers with new, special meals. Estelita is the first lady on the right.

With respect to the other group members, Lea is the second lady on the right, Ida is the second lady on the left, and Jenny is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients that will help her provide her customers with new, special meals.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda es una mujer de 22 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 8 meses y 2 hijas de 3 y 5 años, y su negocio es la confección de blusas.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, constante, dedicada, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Sacaba’ ubicado a la salida de la ciudad, actualmente se constituye en una zona en crecimiento por su potencial en el comercio. De clima templado con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 6-21 grados centígrados.
Nilda es de tez morena, ojos negros, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia en construcción hecha de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. Su trabajo es la confección de blusas, actividad que aprendió de su madre y actualmente trabaja sola. Durante toda su vida nunca tuvo agua potable en su casa porque el servicio es nuevo en el lugar, actualmente recoge agua de un pozo manualmente con un balde atado a una cuerda, “el agua que usamos no es limpia, la sacamos con tierra y no es potable…” comenta. la ventaja de su vivienda es que ya cuenta con el servicio de agua potable en la zona, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la conexión de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería. Su sueño es terminar la construcción de su casa, ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para darle a su familia una vida saludable. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que construye su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Nilda solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su casa y brindarle salud a su familia.
texts.en:
Nilda is 22 years old and lives with her partner, She has an eight-month-old son and two daughters aged 3 and 5. She has a business making blouses. She is a good mother, and is independent, stable, dedicated, responsible and very hard working. She works in the district of Sacaba on the outskirts of the city. This area is currently experiencing growth due to its commercial potential. The climate is temperate, and daytime temperatures vary between 6 and 21 degrees centigrade.

Nilda has olive skin, dark eyes and long black hair. She is short and slim. Her mother tongue is Quechua, which she speaks at home. She also speaks Spanish, especially in her business. She shares her life with her partner, who works in construction, and her children, who are not yet old enough to go to school. They live in their own home, which is under construction. It is made of bricks and cement, with a corrugated iron roof and cement floors. It has electricity and well water.

Nilda works making blouses, a skill she learned from her mother, and currently works alone. She has never lived in a house with drinking water, a service which is new in her area. She currently collects water from a well manually using a bucket and rope. She says that "the water we use is not clean, it's full of soil and it is not drinkable". The advantage of her home is that the area already has a drinking water supply. However, she does not have enough money to connect the supply to her kitchen, bathroom and washroom.

Her dream is to finish building her home. She wants to install drinking water in her kitchen, bathroom and washroom so that her family can live a healthy life. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the two years she has been building her home. For these reasons, Nilda is requesting a loan to install drinking water in her home and improve her family's health.

loans.use: to install drinking water in her home and improve her family's health.

loans.name: Turdugul

texts.ru: Турдугул успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в своем хозяйстве Турдугул имеет 14 коров, 10 овцы. На 1,20 Га собственного и 1,0 Га арендованного земельного надела выращивает фасоль и клевер для реализации. Ее ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 33,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Турдугул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически-чистого картофеля. Доходы от кредита Турдугул планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса и обучение дочери в университете.
texts.en:
Turdugul has successfully repaid her previous loan having used it accordingly. She is grateful to Kiva and everyone who has helped her to raise funds. Currently she owns 14 cows and 10 sheep. On a 1,20 ha land lot she owns and an addition rented 1,0 ha lot, Turdugul cultivates beans and clover for sale. Her total monthly income amounts to 33,000 som (KGS). 

To further develop her business, Turdugul requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy fertilizers to apply it for land in order to cultivate environmentally friendly potatoes. Turdugul is planning to invest the borrowed money to expand her business, as well as to pay her daughter's university tuition.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for land cultivation and growing organic potato

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en:
Ibtissam is a 44-year-old single lady who started twenty-six years ago tailoring from her house to cover her needs and expenses. She is an independent lady who took her responsibilities long ago. 

She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is trying desperately to develop her business. Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy an updated tailoring machine which will facilitate her business and allow her to provide her customers with better service. 

Ibtissam hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own shop to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an updated tailoring machine which will facilitate her business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 48 years old, married and has six children. She is involved in a direct-selling business. She sells products such as soap, laundry soap and fabric conditioner.

She hopes to improve her sales, and that is why she wants to buy more products to resell. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy soap, detergents and fabric conditioner to sell. This additional merchandise will help her purchase more products and gain good profits. She will save additional funds as the family's emergency funds.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergents, fabric conditioner to sell.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is 53 years old, married and has seven children, three of whom are in school.

Edina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Edina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Edina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 53 years old and married. She has two children who are both in school. Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years.

Evelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 42 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school.

Milagros is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Milagros requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 43 years old, married, and has three children, who are all in school.

Geraldine is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now, and she has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Geraldine requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Geraldine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jeralyn is 22 years old and has one child in school.

Jeralyn has a basket making business in the Philippines. Jeralyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like threads, bamboo sticks etc..

Jeralyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Jeralyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo sticks.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Charito works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Charito is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

Charito has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Rocilda

texts.en:
Rocilda is 40 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Rocilda works very hard to provide for them.

Rocilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, cigarettes, home product care items and other groceries.

Rocilda has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Rocilda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, cigarettes, home product care items and other groceries.

loans.name: Zhuzumkan

texts.ru: Жузумкан, 47 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей, самому младшему сыну 16 лет. Образование у нее высшее, бухгалтер по специальности, Жузумкан работала во многих местах. Начала она свою трудовую деятельность с должности хозрасчетного бухгалтера, позже была диспетчером, сейчас не работает, занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 8 коров, 15 овец. На 2,0 Га земли выращивает фасоль.  Жузумкан решила развить свою деятельность и обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически-чистого молока. Прибыль от кредита позволит развивать бизнес и построить сарай для скота.
texts.en:
Zhuzumkan is 47 years old, married, with four kids. Her youngest son 16 years old. She has completed higher education in accounting. In this field Zhuzumkan has worked in a number of places. She started as an accountant for a self-supporting business, then became a supervisor. Right now she is unemployed, taking up agriculture for a living. 

Her household includes 8 cows and 15 sheep. On a 2,0 ha land lot she cultivated beans. Zhuzumkan decided to expand her business and turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan. She requested a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy a milking cow to increase the sales of her eco-friendly milk. The borrowed money will enable her to develop her business and build a barn for livestock.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase the volume of organic milk sales

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малике 45 лет. Она жительница прекрасного города Турсунзаде. Малика мать 4-х очаровательных детей. По волей судьбы муж Малики уехал на заработки в Россию.  Несмотря на сложные условия, двоя сыновей, Малики работают и помогают маме по хозяйству. Сама Малика также занимается предпринимательством. Она на рынке имеет свою торговую точку и продает детские вещи. Малика очень хочет расширить свою торговую точку и закупить детские товары нового сезона. Но для этого ей необходимо финансирование. Именно с этой целью она обратилась за кредитом и верит в вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Malika is 45 years old, she resides in the beautiful town of Tursun-zoda. Malika is a mother of four adorable children. As the fate willed, Malika's husband had to go to Russia to work. Despite the difficult financial state, her two sons work and help Malika around the house. 

Malika herself is an entrepreneur. She has a selling unit in the local market and sells children's clothes. She would like to expand her shop and buy more clothes for the upcoming season. For this, she needs additional funds, which is why she requested a loan. Malika relies on your help!

loans.use: Чтобы расширить свою торговую точку и закупить детские товары.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a 50-year-old, married mother of three children. She has been working in arranging and selling artificial flowers and gifts, for fourteen years. Her husband is a farmer, and their combined, low income isn't enough to cover their additional, unexpected needs.

She is a hard worker and sacrifing mother who is trying desperately to improve her family's living conditions. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to help her son to build his own house. 

Aziza hopes to expand her own business in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her children with better life.

loans.use: to help her son to build his own house.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina de 50 años, es una emprendedora ama de casa habitante del municipio de Arjona en el Departamento de Bolívar, lugar donde día tras día vende sus pasteles y deditos a sus vecinos y transeúntes del sector.  Al considerar su talento para la culinaria palpó la oportunidad de generar ingresos a través de esta labor.  Todos los días al amanecer sus productos los exhibe y sus clientes se acercan a consumirlos y cancelan de contado, ella aplicó a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de materia prima como harina, huevos, leche, queso, carnes, arroz, verduras y maíz.  Como su propósito es ampliar su gama de productos, contará con víveres necesarios para la elaboración de bollos de maíz y así podrá tener éxito en su nuevo producto. Su meta a futuro es tener un negocio más próspero para así poder mejorar sus condiciones actuales y poder realizar adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cristina is 50 years old. She is an enterprising homemaker, living in the municipality of Arjona in the Department of Bolívar, where she sells cakes and pastries everyday to neighbours and passers-by. Given her talent for cooking, she felt there was an opportunity to generate income this way. Everyday at dawn she displays her products; her customers come to eat them and pay for them in cash.

Cristina applied for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and will invest it in buying ingredients such as flour, eggs, milk, cheese, meats, rice, vegetables and maize. Her aim is to increase the range of products she sells and, this way, she will have the necessary supplies to make "bollos de maíz" (rolls of boiled corn dough) and her new product will be successful. Her goal for the future is to have a more prosperous business, so that she can improve her current conditions and make adjustments to her house.

loans.use: to invest in buying ingredients, such as flour, eggs, milk, cheese, meats, rice, vegetables and maize

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old, single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, a few years ago, Ahmad started his own business. He manages a store selling clothes.

This is the only source of income for the family. Ahmad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new collection of children's clothing for his store for Eid season. This will increase his sales and also his income. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of children's clothing for his store for Eid season.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma, who is in his late 50's, is married with six children. Four are still in school and two have finished schooling. He has been selling charcoal for four years now. He works from 06am to 06pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Juma's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase the charcoal stock and has paid back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, bought a TV set, a radio, beds, mattresses, bought a plot of land and covered household expenses. 

He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell. He dreams of building his own house.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Alba Roxmeri

texts.es: Alba  de 35 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos  hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad. Alba es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, golosinas, granos básicos y también de uso personal como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación desde hace tres años por lo que ha adquirido una buena experiencia y mucha clientela. Alba solicita un crédito a FUSAI por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda con pastas, aceite de cocina, salsa de tomates, granos básicos, verduras, etc. de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes brindando una mayor variedad de productos y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
Alba is 35 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and her two children, who are 9 and 2 years old. Alba is a very responsible and hard-working mother who has managed to support her family. She owns a grocery store with bread, soft drinks, oils, sweets, basic grains, and also personal care items such as soap and shampoo, among other items. She has had her business in her house for 3 years, and has gained good experience and many customers. 

Alba is asking for a loan from FUSAI through which she can supply the store with pastries, cooking oil, tomato sauce, basic grains, vegetables, etc., so she can look after her customers better, giving them a larger variety of products and thus improving her sales, which is her priority for supporting her home.

loans.use: to buy pastries, cooking oil, tomato sauce, basic grains, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is a hard working woman from Mityana town - a neighbouring town to the branch's location. She’s aged 40 years. She has a stall of vegetables at Nalibulungi, a popular fruit-selling area. 

Her business was previously struggling because of limited capital and as a result of the dry season the prices of fruits have gone up. She realised the best way to keep in business will be to borrow in order to keep the supply going for her customers. 

She’s now requested a loan of two million so that she can increase her working capital by buying more fruits to sell. This will help her overcome the challenge of the dry season. She’s a hard working person. 

Pictured is Safina and the UGAFODE Credit Officer at her stall (right to left).

loans.use: To boost her fruit trading business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 56-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has three adult children. Her husband is a business man while Lucia runs a sari-sari store business. She has been doing this business for twenty years and earns about PHP 6,000 per month. 

Aside from the sari-sari store business, Lucia is engaged in a hog raising business. With this, she is asking for a loan to buy piglets, some grocery items like canned goods, noodles, spices, sugar, laundry soap, chips, biscuits, powdered milk and chocolate drinks. She also plans to pay labourers to repair her billiard table. 

In the future, Lucia wants to improve her business so they could have a better life.

loans.use: to buy piglets, canned goods, noodles, spices, sugar, laundry soap, chips, biscuits, powdered milk and chocolate drinks. and to pay labor for billiard repair

loans.name: Gulbonu

texts.ru: Гулбону из городка Куляб. Она семейная женщина. Гулбону мать двоих детей. Дочкам 19 и16 лет. Старшая дочка учиться в университете. Младшая школьница. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Гулбону трудолюбивая и талантлива мать и жена. У нее все хорошо получается. Она хорошая домохозяйка. Гулбону занимается поваром. Она любить готовить и по той причине выбрала эту деятельность. У Гулбонц золотые руки, и она вкусно готовить, клиентам нравится ее блюда. У Гулбону маленькая проблема, она хочет поменять крышу своего дома, но для купли стройматериалы у него нет денежных средств. Гулбону решила обратиться за кредитом, и поменять крышу. Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulbonu lives in the town of Kulob. She is a family woman, a mother of two. Her daughters are 19 and 16 years old. The elder studies in the university, the younger is a school student. Gulbonu's husband is working in Russia. Gulbonu is a hard-working and talented mother and wife. She as good at everything. She takes good care of the household.

Gulbonu is a cook. She loves cooking, which is why she chose this profession. Gulbonu is said to have "golden hands", she cooks very well and customers enjoy her dishes very much. She has a small problem. She wants to repair the roof in her house, but she doesn't have enough money to buy construction materials. That's why Gulbonu decided to request a loan to renew the roof cover. She believes in you and hopes for your help!

loans.use: Для купли стройматериалы и ремонт крыши.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 48-year-old single lady who started twenty years ago selling toys to cover the needs and expenses of her family that consists of five members. She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her customers.

Najah is trying hard to develop her business. Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of toys to satisfy her customers' requests in this summer season. 

Najah hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of toys.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 44-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and four children who are attending school. She is a housewife. Her husband works as a butcher and works very hard to help the family live in good conditions. 

Today, given that her children will enter school very soon, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to register them at school. The parents’ only target is to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation and help them become able to get good jobs that will give them a good income.

loans.use: to register her children at school.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su conyuge y sus 5 hijos en una zona rural del caserío Frayle, distrito de Santo Tomás, que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Jaime se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Jaime espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is 38 years old, lives his spouse and their 5 children in a rural zone of Frayle village, Santo Tomás district, which is located in Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. The people in this district work primarily in agriculture, raising animals, and in sales. 

Jaime works raising and selling small animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, and more. His business is located at his home. He has 5 years of experience in the business and very good personal and work references in the zone. The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase a larger quantity of animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, chicks, and more, and also to purchase balanced feed for them. With this, Jaime hopes to offer a better product to his customers, which will allow him to generate more income and, in the end, will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of animals, and to purchase balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Raiza Alejandra

texts.es: Raiza, inició su vida comercial al cumplir su mayoría de edad, ella es una joven de 20 años residente en el municipio de Cartagena de Indias en donde está consolidada su clientela a quienes ofrece productos para el cuidado personal por intermedio de catálogos especializados.  Su madre fue su motivadora para iniciar su negocio, ella le sugirió vender prendas de vestir, calzado, accesorios de la oferta de catálogos.  En la actualidad ella aplicó a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,   para responder a sus clientes con encargos de perfumes, ropa, calzado y joyas.  Con esta inversión pretende incrementar su stock de productos que clientes le solicitan para eventualidades que se les presentan.  Su meta a futuro es convertirse en una mayorista y líder de revista, así mismo formalizar una familia.
texts.en: Raiza began her commercial life upon reaching the age of majority. She is a 20-year-old young woman, living in the municipality of Cartagena de Indias where she is strengthening her customer base to whom she sells personal care products from specialized catalogs. Her mother was her motivator to begin this business. She suggested that she sell clothing, footwear, and accessories offered in the catalogs. Currently, she applied for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo as an intermediary, to respond to her customers with deliveries of perfumes, clothing, footwear and jewelry. With this investment, she plans to increase her stock of products that her customers ask for on occasions that come up. Her goal for the future is to become a wholesaler and catalog leader, and also to form a family.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, clothing, footwear and jewelry.

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru: Рохат успешно погасила свой предыдущий кредит, который использовала для увеличения своего дохода. Так как её возраст уже не позволяет ей продавать горючее на дороге и из-за сильного переутомления, она начала заниматься шитьем. Рохат очень трудолюбивая женщина, она не может сидеть без дела. Она справляется с шитьем очень хорошо. Рохат как и каждая мать мечтает дать  достойную жизнь своим детям. Для этого она должна зарабатывать хорошо, однако её старая швейная машинка, которая досталась ей в наследство  от матери очень старая и ей необходимо купить новую швейную машинку. Рохат надеется, что и на этот раз Вы сможете  её поддержать.
texts.en: Rohat successfully repaid her previous loan which helped her increase her income. She started sewing for a living since she is old and can no longer sell fuel on the side of a road. She is hard-working, though, and cannot stay at home doing nothing. Her sewing is going very well. Like other mothers, Rohat dreams of providing a decent living for her children. For this, she needs to earn enough money, but her sewing machine inherited from her mother is very old. Rohat needs to buy a new sewing machine. Rohat hopes that you will help her once again this time!

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 33-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child. She doesn’t work and her husband is the main income source in the family. He works as a taxi driver and has a good reputation in his town, but he earns barely enough income.

Today, she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l. to pay her child's educational fees.

She tends to provide him with a good education and ensure he has a secure future.

loans.use: to pay her child's educational fees.

loans.name: Rosabella

texts.en:
This 63-year-old hardworking entrepreneur is Rosabella from Calumpang, General Santos City, South Cotabato. She has been working as a dressmaker since she was 16 years old. Her continuous livelihood supported herself, her parents and her siblings when she was still single.

When she got married, it supplemented her husband’s income in providing for their usual expenditures and the children’s education. Now that both of them are already in their retirement age, she would like to concentrate on her alternative livelihood, which is a variety store that sells mainly fruits and vegetables. Because her eyes blur and her back aches when she’s working on her sewing machine, it’s more convenient for her to look after her store. She has not depended on others since she was 16 years old, and now she would like to earn enough for her and her husband and extend help to her grandchildren. Really, her responsibilities never cease.

She wants to enhance her store by adding more grocery items, dry goods and beverages to her inventory. A loan worth PHP 22,000 will help her a lot. May you be God’s channel of blessings to her.

Rosabella consistently meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items, dry goods and beverages for her store inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes for tailoring.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Widows like Avelina may be considered exceptional because they perform the tasks and carry the responsibilities of both father and mother. She’s a 53 year old who provides for the needs of her children through her variety store business. She buys the usual commodities like toiletries, snack items, canned goods and beverages at wholesale prices then she sells it per piece to her neighbors in Calumpang, General Santos City, South Cotabato.

A big portion of her income is utilized for their everyday needs such as food, and the meager school allowances of her children. She can hardly provide for their tuition and school fees. Their financial insufficiency fuels her to improve her business and increase her profit simultaneously.

She seeks your kindness to lend her an amount of PHP 10,000 that she will use to buy more stock for her variety store. If her business will prosper in due time, it will ease her financial burden for the college expenses of her children. She wants to see them finish their studies and have better living conditions someday.

Avelina meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her variety store.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 52-year-old Lebanese married woman with six children. Her husband represents the main income provider in his family; he has worked in the construction field for many years. His income is barely sufficient.

That’s why she is currently requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees, with the aim to insure them a good education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is a 53-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has three adult children. Her husband is a fisherman and is also a carpenter while Paterna is engaged in selling food. She also buys and sells fish. She has been doing this selling business for six years. 

She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients like pork, vegetables, spices and cooking oil. In the future, Paterna wishes to improve her business for her family. She wishes to have better earnings to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy pork, vegetables, spices and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mohi

texts.ru: На фотографии Мохи и ее супруг. Мохи с мужем и сыном, невесткой живут в городке Худжанд. Мохи работает в страховой компании, а ее муж по состоянию здоровья не работает. Мохи очень заботится о здоровье мужа и хочет ему помочь. Супруг нуждается в реабилитации. Обследования, процедуры и медикаменты стоят дорого. Мохи молится за здоровье своего мужа. Она так же надеется, что она сможет получить кредит и в скором времени лечебные процедуры начнутся.
texts.en: In the photo you can see Mohi and her husband. Mohi with her husband and son live together in the town of Khujand. Mohi works for an insurance company, her husband is out of work because of his health condition. Mohi is very worried about him and wants to help him. Her spouse needs a rehabilitation course. Medical tests, treatment and prescription drugs are very costly. Mohi is praying for her husband's recovery. She is hoping that she will be able to get the loan and pay for the first course of treatment to begin.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's medical treatment

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es: Gabriel, joven emprendedor y responsable, tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja y su hijo actualmente, él solicita un préstamo con el fin de comprar semilla de chile dulce y materiales para la producción de este cultivo, es la única actividad que Gabriel efectúa por lo tanto para  el bienestar de su familia es muy importante tener un buen cultivo, situación que solo podrán conseguir con este préstamo, para Gabriel la única delimitación que tiene es la falta de dinero que le impide continuar creciendo,   es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gabriel, an enterprising and responsible young man, is 26 years old. He currently lives with his partner and his son. He is requesting a loan in order to buy  sweet chilli seeds and materials for the production of this crop. As this is Gabriel's only business, a good crop is very important for the family's wellbeing and that is only achievable with this loan. 

For Gabriel, his only limitation is lack of money, which prevents him from continuing to expand. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR and he doesn't have any loans with state banks; FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow sweet chilli

loans.name: Mari Cris

texts.en:
Mari Cris is 29 years old, married with four children.

Mari Cris works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mari Cris has borrowed and paid back 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Mari Cris aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motor oils, lubricants, repair parts and all necessary shop supplies to offer his customers great service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a spray painting machine, a grinding machine, and other tools to use in his workshop.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Your help can improve the lives of others!

Here is Rosana, 36 years old, a resident of Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. She is currently running a store which offers usual commodities that are needed in an individual’s daily life. Her income from the business helps sustain the everyday necessities of her family. With her husband, Rogel, who is a carpenter, they willingly provide for the basic needs of their two children. One is studying in college, while the other is still in elementary school.

However, running a store like this is not as easy as others usually think. Income varies every day depending on how many customers will avail the products. Their profit in each day seems to be insufficient. In this situation, Rosana wants to ask help from you. She is requesting for a PHP 20,000 loan that she will use to buy more groceries, toiletries and canned goods for her store. She is truly hopeful that this amount will help her attract more customers and will then lead to a higher profit.

She dreams of growing her business and have a better living condition someday. She would love to see her children finish their studies and gain stable careers. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, toiletries and canned goods for her store

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Luzviminda is 62 years old and has one child who is in school.

Luzviminda has a general store business in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 32 years. In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed, preventive medicine for laying hens, vitamins, chickens, etc.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
The stiff competition in the variety store business forces many store owners to find alternative sources of income. Jessie, 36, from Calumpang, General Santos City, South Cotabato runs a variety store that sells toiletries, repacked condiments, snack items, canned goods, eggs, and many other items. 

Jessie earns extra income from load retailing or e-loading for cellphones. This business is very popular now in the Philippines because most cellphone owners use a prepaid plan and only a few subscribe to a postpaid plan. In a prepaid arrangement, a person can budget his load usage because he can buy as little as a 10-peso load. It is indeed a good business to combine with a variety store. 

Basically Jessie’s income helps provide for his family’s daily needs. But his forward-looking mindset drives him to improve his business in order to save more for his children’s education. 

Jessie would like to obtain additional capital worth PHP 20,000 that he can use to buy more products for his store and load wallets for cellphone e-loading. The earnings that he can derive from this will add to the regular wage of his wife, Maritess, a government employee. They can continually provide for the needs of their family and schooling of their two children. Both of them want to see their children finish their college degrees and acquire stable jobs someday. 

Jessie gains inspiration from his co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their lives and businesses and draw strength from the Word of God. *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products for his store and to load wallets for cellphone e-loading

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
It’s not impossible to have a better living condition someday. This is Annie’s wish. She runs a variety store and also retails rice per kilo. She works hard and saves little by little in order to expand her business.

The people in Annie's community in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo, are quite familiar with each other. When her neighbors ask for credit for her goods, she cannot refuse them. Sometimes it depletes her capital.

As of now, she needs additional capital of PHP 8,000 for her business. She will use it to buy additional items for her inventory. It will improve her profit, and she can extend the blessings to her parents and siblings. She's single, but her responsibilities in the family cannot be discounted. She helps provide their daily food sustenance and helps pay the monthly bills for electricity and water. She is praying that you would be one of God’s instruments to grant her needed capital. She would really appreciate your kind support.

Annie is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty, and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her inventory.

loans.name: Banco Mujer De Paraiso Group

texts.es: Fabiana tiene 24 años de edad, esta soltera, vive con sus papás, los cuales le han inculcado el hecho de trabajar para poder generar ingresos al hogar, en la zona donde viven no existen suficientes fuentes de empleo, por lo que cuentan con actividades productivas a nivel familiar. Desde muy joven colabora con la crianza de animales como cerdos y vacas, es ahí donde surge su interés con el ganado, su papá le heredo un novillo para que tuviera sus ingresos propios, logro engordarlo correctamente y venderlo para pagar parte de los útiles escolares, ya que desea terminar sus estudios. Actualmente esta en cuarto nivel del colegio nocturno, desea terminarlo para estudiar en la universidad algo referente a lo que realiza y le gusta, con el fin de lograr mejoras. Solicita este crédito para comprar dos novillos y continuar ahorrando para pagar sus gastos personales y de estudio. Ya que cuenta con el espacio adecuado para que los novillos se desarrollen correctamente. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés y acompañamiento técnico en las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Fabiana is 24 years old, is single, and lives with her parents, who instilled in her the desire to work in order to earn money for her household. In the zone where they live, there are not enough jobs, so they count on productive activities at the household level. From a young age, Fabiana has raised animals like pigs and cows, and she developed an interest in cattle. Her father gave her a heifer so that she could earn her own money. She was able to fatten it correctly and sold it in order to pay school fees because she would like to finish her studies.

She is currently in the fourth level of high school, which she attends at night. She would like to finish in order to study something that she is interested in at university so she can make improvements. She requests this loan in order to purchase two heifers and continue saving money to pay for personal and school expenses. Because she has adequate space for the heifers, they will develop correctly.

She chose to work with Fundacion Mujer due to their low interest rate and technical assistance with work-related activities.

loans.use: to purchase heifers.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 56 years old, and he lives with his wife in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. They have a son, but he is in the Russian Federation now and is working there and transferring money for his family from there.

Samvel used to work at different workshops and did different jobs, but now he is farmer. He takes care of his farm cattle, cows, bull, piglets, sheep and chickens. He also has a rich vegetable garden where he cultivates potato, cucumber, tomato, cabbage, onion, greens and garlic. All his farm products such as milk, meat, macun (national dairy product), cheese, eggs and all the vegetable assortment Samvel sells at the city’s wholesale market during the week.

Now with the help of this loan, Samvel wants to buy a cow and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Sharlyn Mae is 19 years old and the only child in the family. Her mother, Nelia, supports the family through her food-vending business in the Philippines.

Sharlyn Mae is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Human Resources and is currently in the first year of this four-year course.

Nelia is borrowing PHP 20,000 to pay the tuition fees of her daughter, Sharlyn Mae, for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When she graduates, Sharlyn Mae plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Hidenia

texts.en:
Filipinos are known to be resilient and tough. Comparable to bamboo trees, they are bent but not broken. They also gather strength through togetherness and camaraderie. This is the exact description of how Hidenia was able to rise above distressing situations in her life. Her husband died several years ago, and from then on, she alone has shouldered the responsibility for her children.

Hidenia provides their daily needs through selling of seafood in a public market located in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. She offers crabs, clams and snails, which are very saleable in the market. But Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013 devastated their area and resulted in the dwindling of her business. She gradually restored it with the unwavering support of her children. Her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative also contributed a lot through their inspiring stories and Bible reflections.

As Hidenia continues to develop her business, she needs additional capital of PHP 18,000 to obtain more seafood and increase her buying power this rainy season when seafood is scarce and expensive. Your generous assistance will surely help her business prosper.

Hidenia dreams of a little comfort in life as she ages. She wants that all her children will live happily and peacefully. She gains inspiration and strength from her co-fellowship members who meet every week to share stories about their lives and businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more seafood, such as crabs, clams and snails.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married and 48 years old. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Erlinda has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted vegetables to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Manale

texts.en:
Manale is a 47-year-old married woman. She is living with her husband and two children, who are still attending school. She is a housewife dedicated only for her family, and her husband works in order to satisfy their needs.

Due to a hard financial situation, today Manale is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to pay her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take new Kiva loans and keep on covering their study fees.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 25-year-old single man who started two years ago selling vegetables and fruits to cover his needs and expenses. He is well-known in his region for his good quality of vegetables and fruits.

Hasan is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his business. Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with new vegetable and fruit items to satisfy his customers' requests.

Hasan hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with new vegetable and fruit items to satisfy his customers' requests.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, 47 years old, is a fish vendor, while her husband, Benito, is a fisherman from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. They both work diligently to support their children, who are studying in college and high school.

The rainy season gives them difficulty to earn enough for their family. It’s dangerous for her husband to go fishing because their boat is small. Only big fishing boats can endure those not-so-heavy rains in the midst of the sea. The scarcity of fish makes its price higher, and fish vendors like Mercy can hardly afford it. This is the reason why Mercy wants to avail of additional capital worth PHP 16,000 to augment her buying power for volumes and different varieties of fish. It can keep her business running even during rainy days.

Her income from this will continuously sustain their daily needs and their children’s education. Eventually her goals are to make her business prosper, acquire sturdy fishing boats and nets, complete her children’s education, and enjoy a better living condition someday.

Mercy is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy volumes and different varieties of fish.

loans.name: Sabriye

texts.en:
