Sabriye is a 27-year-old single woman from Lebanon living with her parents. Her parents are the main income source in the family, and they work very hard to always be able to fulfill the family's needs and to live a good lifestyle.

In order to pay her university fees, Sabriye is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She said that her target is to achieve higher positions.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Robella

texts.en:
Have you tried any native delicacies in the Philippines? One, which is called “Kakanin,” is a sweet delicacy made from rice flour and added flavorings. Filipinos really love to eat. That’s why you can find varieties of foods there. Sinukmani, bibingka, puto, kutsinta and suman are some examples of it. Kakanin can be found in most parts of the country since it’s easy to make, affordable yet delicious. It is an export quality Filipino-made product.

Robella, is a forty-nine-year-old business woman who knows how to cook almost any type of kakanin. She has been on the business for 10 years now and enjoys doing it. Robella needs to wake up early every day to cook varieties of kakanin that she’ll sell every morning. She is persistent every day to make a living and earn profit. 

Robella needs added capital to buy ingredients and necessities for the business. With this, Robella applied for a PHP 12,000 loan. She works hard every day to have savings for her future and have her own property.

Robella is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay microfinance loans and hear God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and necessities for her food business.

loans.name: Bersabe

texts.es: Bersabe, tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, tiene 6 hijos con su esposa y reside en una aldea de San Sebastián, Lempira. Hace mas de 10 años se dedica a la agricultura con maíz, frijoles y últimamente con el cultivo de café el cual le genera mayor ingreso, esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona, ofreciéndolo en húmedo y seco. El prestamo que solicita es por 15,000 lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para aplicarle a la finca de café. Considera que fertilizando su finca le generará mayor producción. Su meta es aumentar la finca cada año para obtener mas ingresos para la familia.
texts.en: Bersabe, 40 years old, is married, he and his wife have six children and live in a community in San Sebastian, Lempira. For ten years he has grown corn, beans, and most recently coffee, which has generated the most income; he sells it in the area's local market, offering it wet or dry. The loan he is requesting for 15,000 lempiras will be invested in purchasing fertilizers to use in his coffee fields. He believes fertilizing his fields will result in better production. His goal is to expand his farm every year to obtain higher earnings for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee plants

loans.name: Lera

texts.en:
Lera is a loving wife to her husband Rolando, a fish vendor, and a caring mother to their three children. She complements her husband’s hard work by earning additional income for the family through her business. 

Lera operates a variety store that sells commodities such as toiletries, snacks, and beverages. She dreams of improving her business and making it prosperous. In this way, she can contribute better to improving their living conditions. In order to attain this, she needs additional capital of PHP 14,000. She will use this to buy more items for her inventory. 

Variety stores in the Philippines are more attractive to buyers if there are more items to choose from. She is knocking at your generous hearts to help her. She already availed loans from CCT before and she’s been faithful in repaying them. 

Lera dreams that her three children (two of whom are already in college and the youngest is still in elementary) will finish their studies and gain a stable job.

As a zealous member of CCT Credit Cooperative for almost six years, Lera gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their lives and businesses. She herself has also encouraged her group, her family and her community in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo by being warm and supportive to her colleagues. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items for her inventory

loans.name: Fe Y Alegria De Huancalle Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal FE Y ALEGRIA DE HUANCALLE.
La socia Maria Luz, alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  a su negocio de agricultura, la socia siembra lo que son lechugas, zanahorias entre otros parta luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The loan seeker belongs to the communal bank Fe y Alegria de Huancalle. 
Maria Luz spends time every day cultivating her crops; she grows lettuce, carrots and others to then sell to her customers. She would like to continue working in this way to help support her family. 
She is applying for a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers among other things. 
Maria Luz is grateful for the credit and is committed to meeting the repayment requirements.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers among other things.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: Doña Vicenta, tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de las Flores, Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio y a la agricultura. Ella cuanta con una pulpería que lleva varios años vendiendo productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, azúcar, manteca, café, pan, huevos, churros, refrescos,  etc. con el fin de seguir trabajando solicita el séptimo ciclo de prestamo a la institucion que es por 25,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar más producto como harina, frijoles, maíz, pan, manteca, arroz, azúcar, refrescos, golosinas y productos de limpieza para ofrecer variedad de productos y aumentar las ventas. Su plan es seguir trabajando, ampliar más su negocio y mantener su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Vicenta, age 60, is a single mother with two children. She lives in a village in the Flores municipality in Lempira. She has always devoted herself to commerce and agriculture. She has a grocery store, and she has been selling basic needs products like rice, sugar, shortening, coffee, bread, eggs, churros, and soft drinks, etc. for years.

In order to continue working she is requesting her seventh loan, which is for 25,000 lempiras, from the institution. She will use the loan to buy more products like flour, beans, corn, bread, shortening, rice, sugar, soft drinks, candy, and cleaning products. She will do this in order to offer a variety of products and to increase sales. Her plan is to continue working, to expand her business, and to maintain her source of income.

loans.use: to buy more products like flour, beans, corn, bread, shortening, rice, sugar, soft drinks, candy, and cleaning products in order to offer a variety and to increase sales.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 39-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and four school-aged children. 

Due to bad financial conditions, Salam and her husband cooperate together to fulfill their family needs and being able to live in a good way. She decided to start her own business in 2010 from her home where she offers a great variety of used clothes at good prices. 

Today, Salam is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a new collection of clothes so that she can improve her business operations. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales and therefore her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Bassima

texts.en:
Bassima is a 29-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and three siblings. She’s really proud of her family and ready to do her best to be able to offer them a respectable life. 

Since Bassima noticed that her father’s income does not satisfy their needs, she decided to open her own clothing shop. To better develop her work, she’s requesting today a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to enlarge her business merchandise and to renovate the clothing shop. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to enlarge her business merchandise and to renovate the clothing shop

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline de 35 años, inició su negocio de refresquería  apoyada por su expareja quien le aportó parte del capital semilla y la otra parte la tomó prestada a un paga diario.  En su rol de madre cabeza de hogar, esta mujer responsable de sus dos hijos menores de edad, se ha destacado por su compromiso y dedicación en la labor que diariamente realiza para conseguir el sustento de su familia y cuenta con cinco años de experiencia en esta actividad, ofreciendo desde su vivienda a  sus vecinos y  transeúntes del barrio ubicado en la ciudad de Cartagena, bebidas gaseosas, jugos naturales, bolis y cervezas.  En la actualidad ella aplicó a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para surtir su refrigerador con gaseosas, cervezas y frutas para la elaboración de sus jugos naturales.  Para ella es muy importante tener un stock de productos y tener siempre disponibilidad de productos para no perder ventas.  Su meta a futuro es adquirir cinco congeladores y con las utilidades educar a sus hijos profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Jackeline is 35 years old. She started her business of a refreshment stall with the help of her ex-partner, who provided her with a part of the seed capital. For the other part she took out a short-term loan.

She is responsible for her two minor children. She is outstanding in her role as mother and head of the household because of her commitment and dedication in her daily work to obtain the means of living for her family. 

She has been doing this kind of work for five years. From her house, located in a neighborhood in the city of Cartagena, she is selling sodas, natural juices, ice pops, and beers to her neighbors and pedestrians.

Now she is requesting her first Kiva loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo to stock up her refrigerator with sodas, beers, and fruit for making her natural juices. It is very important to her to be well stocked and always have supplies available to not miss out on any sales. 

Her goal is to purchase five freezers and to offer her children a professional education with the profit.

loans.use: to stock up her refrigerator with sodas, beer, and fruit for making her natural juices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools like a drill, a sander, and a jig saw.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt:
A senhora Luísa de 57 anos de idade, casada, comerciante, mãe de 6 filhos estes já maiores e independentes é responsável por 4 netos que vive com eles na casa própria.
A cliente tem uma casa tipo 3 pretende com o valor do empréstimo comprar cimento, chapas de zinco, ferros, portas e pagar a mão-de-obra para dar continuidade da sua obra.
Tem como sonho o cliente concluir a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família e futuramente comprar uma viatura para lhe facilitar no seu negócio.
Os principais desafios são financeiros tem recorrido ao trabalho e pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Luísa, 57, is married. She works as a businesswoman and is the mother of six adult and independent children. She takes care of four grandchildren and lives with them in a house she owns.

She has a three-bedroom house and is planning to use the loan to buy cement, zinc sheets, iron and doors, and pay for the labor needed to continue with the construction works.

Her dream is to finish building her house in order to offer her family a better home. In the future, she would like to buy a vehicle, which would be useful for her business.

Her main challenges are of a financial nature, but she has been working and is planning to apply for more loans in order to overcome the difficulties and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy cement, zinc sheets, iron and doors, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Doña Olga, tiene 58 años de edad, reside en el municipio de nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara, junto a su esposo,sus hijos son independientes. La señora tiene varios años de haber establecido el negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como arroz, pan, manteca, frijoles, abarrotes, harina, refrescos, lácteos, etc. ademas vende cosmeticos y otra mercaderia. Para mantener estable su negocio quiere invertir otro préstamo, para eso solicita este préstamo de 5,000 Lempiras para comprar arroz, frijoles, manteca, azucar y jabon que le hace falta y tener siempre surtido para ofrecer variedad de productos alimenticios que demandan sus clientes. Su meta es tener un local en un buen lugar y con buena clientela.
texts.en:
Olga is 58 years old. She lives in the town of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara, together with her husband.  Her children live independently.  

For a number of years she has run a small grocery store business where she sells basic staples such as rice, bread, shortening, beans, groceries, flour, soda, dairy products, etc.  She also sells cosmetics and other merchandise.  

In order to keep her business stable, she would like to invest in another loan.  Because of this, she is asking for this loan of 5,000 Lempiras in order to buy rice, beans, shortening, sugar, and soap.  She is lacking these items, and she wants to always have her store stocked in order to offer the variety of products that her customers need.  Her goal is to have a shop in a good location with a good customer base.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, shortening, sugar, and soap to stock her store.

loans.name: Laurentina

texts.en:
Laurentina built her house a long time ago, so now it is destroyed. She does not have enough money to buy more materials to repair her house, but she does have a plan to repair her house. So she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin to complete the purchase of her materials. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more materials such as sand, cement, wood and other things to use in the house repair.

She hopes with this loan she can repair her house in a short time.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, wood and other materials to use in repairing her house.

loans.name: Banco Comunal En Dios Confiamos Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL EN DIOS CONFIAMOS ESTA CONFORMADA POR ONCE INTEGRANTES NUEVE MUJERES Y DOS HOMBRES, MADRES Y PADRES DE FAMILIA RESPONSABLES DE VEINTE HIJOS  TODOS MENORES  DE EDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DE  MALPAISILLO, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADOR, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, TODOS TIENE DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONOMICA S, LOS CUALES HAN  SIDO SU MEDIO DE SUSTENTO Y EL DE SU FAMILIAS, LUCHAN DÍA A DÍA PARA SALIR ADELANTE CON SU FAMILIAS, Y CUMPLIR SUS OBJETIVOS Y METAS ESTABLECIDOS COMO PODER BRINDARLES MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA MATERIAL  Y EMOCIONAL A SUS HIJOS, Y HACER CRECER SUS NEGOCIOS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONA LA CORDINADORA ES  MARÍA MATILDE Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA ELABORACIÓN Y VENTA DE TORTILLAS EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN Y POR ENCARGO A CLIENTES FIJOS, CLIENTES QUE VENDE COMIDA EN LOS MERCADOS Y SOLICITAN SUS TORTILLAS DIARIAMENTE. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS  DOCE  HORAS DIARIAS, SU RUTINA ES LEVANTARSE A LAS 4: AM PARA EMPRESA LA PREPARACIÓN DE LA TORTILLAS HASTA LAS  4 O 5: PM LA CUAL DISTRIBUYE SU PRODUCTO. TIENE DIES AÑOS DE DESEMPEÑARSE EN DICHA ACTIVIDAD, LA CUAL REALIZA CON MUCHO GUSTOS YA QUE HA SIDO EL SUSTENTO DE SU FAMILIA. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN  MATERIA PRIMA Y COMPRAR UN QUINTAL DE MAÍZ, LEÑA, BOLSAS PLÁSTICAS, GAS, ETC, PARA LA ELABORACIÓN DEL PRODUCTO, Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. EN DIOS CONFIAMOS AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The En Dios Confiamos communal bank is comprised of 11 members. There are nine women and two men, who are mothers and fathers responsible for 20 children, all of whom are minors. They are from Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the northern part of the region. They are known for being hard-working and responsible with the desire for personal improvement. They all have different business activities, which have been the means of support for them and for their families. They struggle day to day in order to get ahead with their families and to meet their objectives and established goals. These include being able to provide better living and emotional conditions for their children and making their businesses grow.

Thanks to her desire for personal improvement, María Matilde is the coordinator. Her business activity is making and selling tortillas at her house and by order for her fixed customers, who sell food at the markets and request her tortillas daily. She works in her business for 12 hours a day. Her routine is to get up at 4:00 a.m. to prepare the tortillas, and she works until 4:00 or 5:00 p.m. distributing her product. She has been engaged in this business activity for ten years. She does it with much pleasure because it has been the support of her family.

The objective of the loan is to invest in raw material and to buy a ‘quintal’ [100 pounds] of corn, firewood, plastic bags, and gas, etc. to make the product and to be able to get better earnings in the near future.

The En Dios Confiamos communal bank is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provides to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they have decent work.

loans.use: to buy raw material like corn, firewood, gas, plastic bags, and matches, etc.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 41 year old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Eight years ago, her husband started his own business selling welding materials.

Shazia is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of welding products including iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods and welding rods, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns.

Shazia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more welding products including iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods and welding rods for her husband's business selling welding products.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 49 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family of six people. Her daughter is well trained in clothing stitching. She provides sewing services to people from her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials, including threads, needles, clothing etc. This is very important for her to be able to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money she finds it difficult.

Therefore Shamim is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan so that her daughter would be able to buy a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan as per her requirement. Shamim is very thankful to K|iva partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her daughter's stitching work.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.pt:
O senhor Marcos de 38 anos de idade, casado, trabalha como segurança, pai de 5 filhos dos quais 3 frequentam o ensino secundário e 2 ainda sem idade escolar, vive na casa própria.
O cliente tem uma casa tipo 1 pretende com o valor do empréstimo comprar cimento, chapas de zinco, ferros, portas, Varrão, areia, para dar continuidade da sua obra.
Tem como sonho o cliente concluir a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família e futuramente abrir um negócio para sua esposa em casa como forma de  aumentar a renda familiar.
Os principais desafios são financeiros pelo que tem recorrido ao trabalho para supri-los e pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Marcos, 38, is married and works as a security guard. He is the father of five children; three of them go to secondary school and two to primary school. He owns the house where they live.

He has a one-bedroom house and is planning to use the loan to buy cement, zinc sheets, iron, doors, iron rods, and sand to continue with the construction works.

His dream is to finish building his house in order to offer his family a better home and in the future open a business at home for his wife, and in this way increase the family’s income.

His main challenges are of a financial nature, which is why he has been working to face them. He plans to apply for more loans in order to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy cement, zinc sheets, iron, doors, iron rods and sand.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia shows her pump boat, a vessel used to catch crabs using panggals (crab traps). Crab traps are connected to each other with a rope usually one meter apart. Fishermen leave these traps submerged in the sea for several hours, then they come back to pull them up with captured crabs inside. Nemia makes panggals to sell, while her husband, Mauro, catches crabs himself using panggals and the pump boat. Together they work hard to provide the needs of their children.   

This season is favorable for Nemia and her husband, because crabs are very abundant during the months of July to October. Although crabs can be caught all year round, they are more abundant these days. Nemia wants to seize the opportunity to earn more income, so she plans to make more panggals to sell. She also desires to repair their pump boat so her husband can efficiently use it to catch crabs. She needs 14,000 PHP to buy more nets and ropes to make panggals, as well as wood, nails and paint to repair their pump boat. The loan will bring her more earnings that she can utilize for her family’s everyday needs. She can also save some money for her children’s education. It’s Nemia’s desire to see her children finish their studies and have a brighter future. 

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more nets and ropes to make crab traps and to pay for the repair of her pump boat

loans.name: Quefasse

texts.pt:
O senhor Quefasse de 56 anos de idade, casado, trabalha como segurança, casado, pai de 5 filhos dos quais 2 já são maiores de idade e independentes, 3 frequentam o ensino primário, vive na casa própria.
Possui uma casa tipo 2 pretende com o valor do empréstimo comprar cimento, portas, tubos e pagar o contracto de agua para dar continuidade da sua obra.
Tem como sonho concluir sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família e futuramente abrir um negócio para sua esposa em casa como forma de incrementar a renda familiar.
Os principais desafios são financeiros tem recorrido ao trabalho e pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Quefasse is 56 years old and married. He works as a security guard and is the father of five children; two of them are independent adults and the remaining three go to primary school. He owns the house where he lives with his family.

He has a two-bedroom house and is planning to use the loan to buy cement, doors and pipes, and pay for water to continue with the construction works.

His dream is to finish building his house in order to offer his family a better home, and in the future, open a business at home for his wife, and in this way increase the family’s income.

His main challenges are of a financial nature. He has been working to face them and is planning to apply for more loans in order to overcome the difficulties and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy cement, doors and pipes, and pay for water to continue with the construction works.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

As a housewife, Melinda wants to earn income while at home.  She is grateful that CCT helped her in terms of monetary since the previous loan that she applied aided her to sustain her family’s needs, for her children’s education and business as well. While at home, she tried to make rugs and sell to her neighbors for added income. Indeed, any business needs capital to flourish. This year, Merlinda decided to apply for a P15, 000 loan to buy materials for rug making i.e. cloth, thread, pattern, sewing materials.

loans.use: To buy materials for rug making i.e. cloth, thread, pattern, sewing materials.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a consistent member of Center for Community Transformation for nine years now. Dress making is her source of living. She’s been in the business for 15 years already. Alma can’t even count if how many dresses she made for long years as a tailor. She’s grateful that CCT granted her request for the previous loan of P15, 000 that helped her buy materials for her tailoring business like different types of cloths, threads and other materials.

Since she’s forty nine years old until now, her sewing machine is her best friend however the sewing machine that she’s using needs to be replaced. Some of its parts are not working properly that causes delay of work.  With this, Alma decided to apply for a P20, 000 loan to buy new and reliable sewing machine that will help her with the business.

Alma is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: To pay for a new sewing machine, with fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her dress-making business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: As a married mother of five children, Elena works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Elena is borrowing 16,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Virgenita

texts.en:
Virgenita is 51 years old and has eleven children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Virgenita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virgenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Hrachik

texts.en:
Hrachik lives and works in Vanador city of Lori region and having higher pedagogical education now he works as a director of the school, where many years he worked as a teacher. Hrachik is married and he has two daughters and both of them are students. The elder daughter studies at the State Pedagogical University in Vanadzor city and like her father she is future pedagogue. She studies at the paid division and despite of her parents every day hard work, her education costs are a very great hardship for their family. 

Now this loan of 130.000 Armenian drams Hrachik needs in order to pay his elder daughter’s tuition fee for the coming first semester.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's university fees

loans.name: Darwing Francisco

texts.es: Darwing es un empresario independiente de 53 años de edad, que decidió dejar de laborara en un granero de la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, para iniciar su sueño de prosperidad; motivado por su hijo quien le planteo independizarse y le otorgo el capital semilla con el que pudo iniciar su idea de negocio y alcanzar el éxito en su venta de frutas y tubérculos al por mayor y al detal. Al haberles ofrecido un excelente servicio a los clientes en su anterior empleo, le permitió contar con ellos nuevamente en su negocio y son un grupo muy significativo que realizan sus compras de frutas y tubérculos.  En la actualidad ella aplicó a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en la compra de plátanos y aguacates.  Es la primera vez que Darwing solicita un crédito y pudo acceder a la vida financiera, el considera que con esta inversión su negocio crecerá aún más porque incorporará una nueva línea de producto.  Su meta a futuro es realizarle mejoras locativas y adecuar un cuarto frio para preservar fresas y otras frutas que necesiten refrigeración para su conservación.
texts.en:
Darwing is an independent business owner, 53 years old, who decided to leave work in a granary in the city of Cartagena de Indias in order to start his dream of prosperity; motivated by his son who encouraged him to become independent and gave him the seed capital with which he could begin his business idea and achieve success in his sale of fruit and tubers, wholesale and retail. Having offered excellent service to the customers of his previous job, allowed him to rely on them again in his new business and they are a significant group that buys fruit and tubers. 
Today, he applied for his first credikiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in the purchase of bananas and avocados. It is the first time that Darwing is requesting a loan and is able to access financial life. He believes that with this investment his business will grow even more because he will incorporate a new product line. His future goal is to improve his stores and secure a cold room to preserve strawberries and other fruit that need refrigeration for their conservation.

loans.use: to buy bananas and avocados.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cement, iron sheets and nails for selling.

loans.name: Lisseth Estefanie

texts.es:
Lisseth es una joven estudiante de SENATI que se encuentra estudiando el II Semestre de Diseño Industrial, carrera que le interesa mucho porque le gusta diseñar herramientas y planos. 

Aún le falta 2 años para poder concluir sus estudios. Ella sueña con trabajar en una empresa que se dedique específicamente a Diseño Industrial para luego formar su propia empresa.

Ella está solicitando el Crédito Educativo para que pueda continuar sus estudios, debido a que sus padres están atravesando por una situación muy crítica y no cuentan con los medios para seguir apoyándola en sus estudios. Es por tal motivo, que recurre a KIVA para que puedan apoyarla y así no trunque sus sueños de ser una excelente profesional.

Ella se siente feliz al saber que existen personas trabajando en instituciones como KIVA y les quiere expresar lo siguiente: "Muchas gracias por este préstamos, porque gracias a ustedes podré pagar mis estudios y terminar mi carrera exitosamente".
texts.en:
Lisseth is a young student at SENATI. She is in her second semester of Industrial Design, a major that really interests her because she likes to design tools and plans. 

She still has two years to go to be able to finish her education. She dreams of working with a company that is dedicated exclusively to Industrial Design so she can later start her own company. 

She is asking for the student loan so she can continue with her education, because her parents are going through a very difficult situation and they don't have the means to keep supporting her in her education. That is why she has turned to KIVA so they can help her and that way she won't have to abandon her dream os being excellent in her profession.

She feels happy knowing that people exist who work in institutions like KIVA and she wants to tell them the following: "Thank you very much for the loans, because thanks to you all, I'll be able to pay for my education and finish my major successfully."

loans.use: to pay of a Industrial Design student loan so she can grow and be excellent at her profession.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 42 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of one son and one daughter.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for many years. For many days now, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular usage. He feels that most of its parts are out of order, and so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore Farhat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Farhat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Nejmeh

texts.en:
Nejmeh is a 29-year-old single lady who started seven years ago tutoring to cover the needs and expenses of herself and her mother. 
She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying desperately to improve her family's living conditions despite her limited income. 

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a new salon for her house and furnace for her mother. Nejmeh hopes to stay capable of providing her family with better life.

loans.use: to buy a new salon for her house and furnace for her mother

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service his bodaboda and to increase on the genge stock.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en:
Safiya is a 31-year-old single lady who started three years ago working as a private nurse to cover the needs and expenses of her family that consists of three members. Safiya is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying hard to improve her family's living conditions. 

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house's roof for the safety of her family. She hopes to stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house's roof for the safety of her family

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 52 years old. He is married and he has two children. He operates a taxi and also grows maize and beans as well as rearing cows. 

He has been in the business for 25 years. This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to service his taxi and buy animal feeds.

Kennedy will use profits from the expanded business to purchase food for the family and expand his businesses. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a financially stable business.

loans.use: to service his taxi and buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Urukundo Sub Group A

texts.en:
URUKUNDO a group led by Leonie who is 48 years old. The group name means “LOVE” in English. She is married with two children aged 17_20. She owns a mini market and has been doing in a business for the past 4 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more bread, soda, milk and yoghurt for sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bread, soda, milk and yoghurt for sell.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo se levanta muy temprano todos los días para comenzar su trabajo junto a sus dos hijos los cuales le ayudan en el cultivo de café, actividad a la que   se dedica desde hace 28 años, en la comunidad de Intibucá, Honduras.
Su hermana vive con él  y  le ayuda en las labores del hogar desde que su esposa falleció. El trabaja muy duro día a día para que sus hijos tengan un buen patrimonio y una mejor calidad de vida; es por eso que está solicitando a Soluz Honduras un crédito para la compra de un Sistema Solar con lo cual eliminara el uso de  velas o querosene y podrá recargar su teléfono celular lo cual será de gran beneficio para su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo gets up very early to start his work with two of his children. They help with the coffee farming, an activity he has done for 28 years in the community of Intibucá, Honduras.

His sister lives with him and she has helped with the household work since his wife died. He works very hard day to day so that his children will have a good inheritance and a better quality of life. That is why he is asking Soluz Honduras for a loan to buy a solar power system which will eliminate the use of candles or kerosene. He will also be able to recharge his cell phone, which will be a great benefit for his family.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system which will be very beneficial for his family and help to improve their quality of life.

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year old Rasheedan is a married woman. She has run a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has five children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation.  Now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales

loans.name: Jlg-007-Panikkampatti Group

texts.en:
Chinnamal is a mother of two children and lives with her family in Kulithalai, in the rural part of Karur in Tamil Nadu. She spends Rs. 500 per month out of the hard earned earnings of Rs. 8500. She lives in a tiled house that has no toilet.

Chinnammal has formed a self-help group with her friends Muthurani, Muthulakshmi and Rajamani. All 4 group members work hard to support their families and save diligently. However, their finances are not adequate for them to access basic necessities like toilets in their homes. They have to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, their families are at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in their families are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Chinnammal and family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 56000 to build a toilet at home. Your loan will help these 4 hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: To improve sanitation facilities in their homes by installing toilets

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 62-year-old married Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low financial and social situation of her husband who works in a scrap metal business, she decided fifteen years ago to start working in selling lingerie and special occasion dresses to help cover the expenses and needs of her family.

Today, Alia is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with newly released fashionable clothes especially for this summer season. She hopes to increase her income in order to open her own special occasion dress shop.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with newly released fashionable clothes for this summer season

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 31-year-old single man and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live inside the camp, he got employed twelve years ago in the construction field and specialized in glass installations to cover his needs and expenses. 

Jihad is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying hard to improve his living conditions. Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his wedding expenses. This loan will help Jihad achieve his dream and build his own future family with his beloved partner.
Jihad hopes to open his own business in the future to increase his income and provide his future family with better life.

loans.use: to pay his wedding expenses

loans.name: Rosabella

texts.en:
For four years, Rosabella has shown her dedication as a member of CCT Credit Cooperative in Tigbauan, Iloilo. She receives tips on how to manage her variety store and retailing of charcoal. Her store sells various commodities such as rice, canned goods, snack items, toiletries, condiments, and many others. Simultaneously she buys sacks of charcoal, repacks it per kilo, then sells it by customer order or as part of her store inventory. She really works hard in order to supplement her financial resources. Her husband, Margarito, is a farmer whose income doesn’t suffice for the growing expenses of her family with two children, one of whom is studying in high school while the other is still in elementary level.

She aims to expand her variety store and charcoal vending. She requests 20,000 PHP for this purpose. She hopes that your help will bring positive steps towards her dream of having a successful business. In due time, she plans to buy a piece of land for her family because she considers it as a good investment that increases in value as time passes by. She also dreams that her children will gain a stable job after finishing their college education. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods, grocery items and sacks of charcoal for her store

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is a 31-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and three siblings. She has spent two years working as a female hairdresser and beautician. 

She opened a beauty salon in her town where she greets her customers with a great smile. She started her career at a young age with the intention of increasing the family’s revenues. Currently, she wants to get a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l so as to purchase a beauty products to satisfy her clients’ needs.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo is 55 years old and is from the town of Bien Unido.  He has two dependents, ages 8 and 11. He owns and operates a fishing business, and he also grows seaweeds for an income. This has been his livelihood for 38 years now. He is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat and new fishing nets. His income will provide food for his family and school fees for his grandchildren. In the future, he will continue to expand his business and he hopes to see his grandchildren successful.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Inas

texts.en:
Inas is an 18 year old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and three siblings. She has spent three years working as a female hairdresser and beautician at her domicile where she greets her customers with a great smile. She started her career at a young age with the intention of increasing the family’s revenues. 

Currently, she wants to get a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l so as to purchase hairdressing and beauty tools. She feels like she is meant to work in such a business and states that she is very happy and looks forward to opening her own beauty salon as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing and beauty tools

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 50-year old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. 

Bashiran  is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors

loans.name: Ruqaya

texts.en:
Ruqaya is shown in the photo with her husband. She is 53 years old. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.  Currently she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales

loans.name: Dhanalakshmi And Group

texts.en:
Dhanalaksmi is a 30-year-old daily wage labourer in Kulithalai, in the rural part of Karur in Tamil Nadu. She works hard to run a household of 6 members. Even though her family makes do with the meagre income of Rs. 12,000, they face major difficulties without a toilet in their home.

Dhanalakshmi has formed a self-help group with her friends. All 3 group members work hard to support their families, and save diligently. However, their finances are not adequate for them to access basic necessities like toilets in their homes. They have to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse.

 So, taking advantage of the awareness initiatives and opportunities offered, they now seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to build toilets in their homes. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all 3 families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: To build toilets in their homes

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is a 50-year-old married woman with four children who are mostly adults. However, she still supports the youngest, who is 18 years old. Saturnina and her husband are both farmers who earn a living farming rice. She is asking for a loan of PHP 4000 to buy fertilizer for her farm and pay for school fees. She works hard to help support her family and her loan will greatly impact her farm which is her source of livelihood.

In the future, she hopes to have another source of income, other than farming. It is her dream to live a comfortable and prosperous life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and pay for school fees

loans.name: Kattia

texts.es: Katia tiene la edad  de 30 años, está en unión libre y vive con el esposo  y dos hijos actualmente. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de telas para cocer y ropa para revender. Con estas compras espera poder ganar más clientes y así obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Es el segundo   préstamo que he recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado los  préstamos con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Katia is 30 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has two children. With this loan, she plans to buy fabrics to sew and clothes for resale. With these purchases, she hopes to attract more customers and in this way increase her profits and improve her family’s living conditions.

This is her second loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with easy terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Barrios Altos Group

texts.es: La Sra. Idolia tiene 31 años de edad casada, tiene tres hijos menores de edad que aun cursan estudios primarios. Ella forma parte del grupo “Barrios Altos”, formado por seis socias, vecinas de la zona donde vive. Hace 10 años ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en un pequeño local de su propia vivienda con el propósito de salir adelante y así poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. Uno de los sueños de Idolia es ver a sus hijos sean profesionales. Solicito el préstamo para comprar mercadería de abarrotes así poder aumentar su stock. Esta muy agradecida con los inversionistas Kiva por confiar en ella. Idolia es la segunda persona que esta parada a lado izquierdo de la foto viste polo de color rosado y lenings turquesa.
texts.en: Idolia is 31 years old, married, and has three small children that are still in elementary school. She is part of the group “Barrios Altos”, consisting of six members, neighbors from the zone where she lives. 10 years ago she began selling groceries from a small area in her own home with the goal of getting ahead and supporting her husband with the household expenses. One of Idolia´s dreams is to see her children become professionals. She requested this loan to buy merchandise and increase her stock. She is very grateful to the Kiva investors to trust her. Idolia is the second person on the left wearing a pink shirt and turquoise leggings.

loans.use: to buy grocery merchandise.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem  is 36 years old and is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products.  They make enough to meet the expenses of their five children. 

Currently, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items, including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to meet the needs of a maximum number of customers to generate a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is forty three years old. He is married and a father of three.His youngest child is six years and is in lower primary. The second one is twelve years and is in the Upper Primary and his eldest daughter is fifteen years old and is in Junior High School. Samuel is sachet and bottled water vendor.

As the head of his family, he wants to increase his income and be able to take proper care of his family. He will use this loan to buy more sachet and bottled water to sell. He is hopeful that in the future he will move into a bigger shop, where he will sell the water.

loans.use: To buy bottled and sachet water and resell

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra  is a 28 year-old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband (also shown in the photo). She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Sidra’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. They also sell animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. 

However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Sidra has requested 50,000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo

loans.name: Edem

texts.en:
Edem lives at Nima west, a suburb of Accra. She is forty years of age and has one child. Edem is a petty trader. She sells vegetables in front of her house. She lives in a family house with her extended family and child.There is no household toilet, so they all use the commercial toilet in the community. However, the place is not neat and some people get infections from using it. 

With this loan, Edem will build a modern toilet for her household.She will repay the loan through the rent she receives and also with the income from her petty trading.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home for her family.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a married woman and she deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40000  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales to expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is one of the average Pakistani female villagers as she has been working from a very tender age. She is a 33 years old, married woman. She is a mother of 4 children. From an early age she has been involved in the cattle business and looking after livestock. 

Due to her low purchasing power she has requested a loan of 45000 so that she can buy new cattle and expand her earnings which will lead to a better standard of life. Currently, she hardly manages to provide two meals on a daily basis in addition to be able to fulfill their basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy more cattle and expand her earnings which will lead to a better standard of life.

loans.name: St. Mary's Ssanje School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Peter. He is the Head teacher of St. Mary's SS Ssanje School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kyotera with 1360 students. St. Mary's Ssanje School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Mary's Ssanje School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Peter ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jlg-020(A)-Kulithalai Group

texts.en:
Susila leads a group of 3 in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. They come from similar backgrounds, working hard to sustain their families. They have no access to toilets, and their therefore have to resort to open defecation using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. These families, especially their women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites. Susila is 53 years old and spends Rs 300 every month just on medical expenses. Susila and her family too have no access to toilets. 

 Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Susila and family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to build a toilet at home. Your loan will provide these 3 families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: To improve sanitation facilities in their homes by installing toilets

loans.name: Jlg-004-Melapatti Group

texts.en:
Banumathi, a mother of three lives in Karupathur village in Tamil Nadu. She is 40 years old and works in fields earning daily wages to support her six member household. She has formed a self-help group with her friends in Kulithalai, in the rural part of Karur, in Tamil Nadu. These women work hard to support their families, and save diligently. However, their finances are not adequate for them to access basic necessities like toilets in their homes. They have to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse. 

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Banumathi and family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to build a toilet at home. Your loan will provide these 3 families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: To fund the construction of toilets in their homes

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is married with one child. Together with his father, Edgar has been involved in shoe selling business for 10 years. In the rented store located in Vanadzor town's center, Edgar and his father sell large variety of shoe for women.  Edgar describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He works hard to support his business and earn income for the family, but because of different problems and hard economic situation, Edgar faces some difficulties. 

Edgar applied for this loan to purchase  stock of shoe to sell in his store. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Edgar and his father hope to receive lenders' support and develop their retail business so their business will be continued.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of shoes to sell in his store

loans.name: Jenifer Milagros

texts.es: Jenifer tiene 20 años de edad es soltera. Ella se encuentra en el tercer ciclo de su  carrera profesional de técnica en farmacia.  Y a la vez trabaja en una farmacia. Años atrás estudio técnica en farmacia.  Su mayor deseo es implementar su propia farmacia. El crédito lo invertirá en el pago de las pensiones de sus estudios. Ella agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.
texts.en: Jenifer is 20 years old, is single, and she is in the third year of her professional career in pharmacy technique. She is working in a pharmacy, and years ago she studied the art of pharmacy. Her greatest desire is to implement her own pharmacy. She will invest the loan in the payment of pensions for her studies. She is thankful to the investors of Kiva for the given loan.

loans.use: to pay pensions for her studies.

loans.name: Jlg-003(A)-Melathaliyampatti Group

texts.en:
Rajeshwari is 27 years old and works as a daily wage labourer to supplement her meager household monthly income of Rs.10,000.  She wants to build a toilet so that she and her family do not have to travel great distances at odd times of the day or night to relieve themselves and so that they are protected from diseases that spread through open defecation.

Rajeshwari leads a group of three in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. They come from similar backgrounds, working hard to sustain their families. They have no access to toilets, and they, therefore, have to resort to open defecation using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. These families, especially their women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

This is why they have come together to apply for a loan of Rs 42,000 to build toilets in their homes. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: To construct toilets and improve sanitation facilities in their homes

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia has successfully established her business stitching clothes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. 

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time.  She hopes to get a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on providing a good quality of life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors

loans.name: Rukaya

texts.en:
Rukaya is the sister of Joseph, a fifty-four years old man and a landlord at Nima, a suburb of Accra. They have no toilet facility in their house so they use the public toilet in the community. This is not very convenient to them because Rukaya's youngest child nearly fell into the commercial toilet sometime ago. As a landlord, he consulted his sister to help to access this loan to construct a modern toilet facility (KVIP) for the household. 

With this loan, they will be able to build a household toilet facility which will be secured and would not pose any danger to their younger  ones. Rukaya will repay the loan through income from her work as petty trader and also the rent her brother receives.

loans.use: To construct a morden toilet facility for her household

loans.name: Tabassum

texts.en:
Tabassum  is 21 years old and is a married woman. She has two children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Tabassum  expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en: This man is Anvar. Anvar has three children, and is a master of sports. Anvar and his wife do not lead an easy life. Their youngest daughter, who is two years old, is ill. They have spent a lot of funds and money on her health. Their whole family is struggling for her life. Anvar is now appealing for help. He needs to pay for his daughter's treatment. Medication and the doctor's checkup costs a lot of money. Anvar's only hope is to rely on a loan. Support him in his time of difficulty!

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's treatment.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is 38 years old, a married woman and a mother of four children.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She had been doing it for many years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 70,000 PKR to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 30 years old, married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo). She has buffaloes for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 5 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 55000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children

loans.name: G.s. Dios Es Amor Santa Elena Group

texts.es:
EL G.S. DIOS ES AMOR SANTA ELENA ESTA CONFORMADO POR  TRES INTEGRANTES DOS HOMBRES Y UNA MUJER, PERSONAS RESPONSABLES CON SEIS HIJO BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADOR, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL TODOS TIENEN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONÓMICAS, LAS CUALES LUCHAN DÍA A  DÍA PARA SALIR ADELANTE Y SUPERARSE AL IGUAL QUE BRINDARLES ESTABILIDAD ECONOMICA Y EMOCIONAL A SUS HIJOS, Y PODER CUMPLIR CON METAS Y OBJETIVOS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, LA CORDINADORA ES ESCARLETH  TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE CERDOS EN PIE, ACTIVIDAD QUE LA DESEMPEÑA EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO  Y COMPRA UN PEQUEÑO LOTE DE CERDOS PARA LA CRIANZA. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN, DESDE HACE SIETE AÑOS QUE LO DESEMPEÑA, ACTIVIDAD QUE LA REALIZA CON MUCHO GUSTO YA QUE ES EL MEDIO DE VIDA DE SU FAMILIA. G.S. DIOS ES AMOR SANTA ELENA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The group G.S. Dios Es Amor Santa Elena is formed of three members, two men and one woman, who are responsible people with six children in their responsibility. They are from Sauce, a place that is located in the northern part of the region and are known for being hardworking, responsible, and with personal success. They all have different economic activities, which they struggle for day after day to succeed and overcome as well as give their children economic and emotional stability, and to meet their goal and objectives.

Thanks to their desire for self-improvement, the coordinator is Scarleth who raises and sells pigs by foot for a living, an activity that she does from her home. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital to support her business and buy a small batch of pigs for breeding. The business that she has is located in her home, for the last seven years, an activity that she gladly performs as it is the way of life for her family. The group G.S. Dios Es Amor Santa Elena is thankful for the help that the investors of Kiva have brought to people of little resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to be able to have a dignified way of working.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a batch of live pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees  is 38 years old.  She is a married woman who for many years has been doing a business of animal purchase and sales with the help of her husband. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of three children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves

loans.name: Jlg-003-Karuppathur Group

texts.en:
45-year-old Saraswathi from Kulithalai, in rural Tamil Nadu has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Saraswathi, her husband and her three children are one among the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Joining hands with three others whose families also face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Saraswathi has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. Without access to a toilet, their families walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and even insect or animal bites.

With a toilet in their homes, they will be able to lead a healthier life and save the time they spent on walking long distances to relieve themselves. They seek a loan of INR. 42,000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to improve sanitation facilities in her home by installing a toilet.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
MARIANO DE CUARENTA Y DOS AÑOS DE EDAD, CASADO CON DOS HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, ES ORIGINARIO DE  MALPAISILLO, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN, Y SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADOR, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDO CURSAR UNA CARRERA Y SE VIO OBLIGADA A TRABAJAR DESDE TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR, EN LA ACTUALIDAD  LUCHA, PARA SACAR ADELANTE SU NEGOCIO. 
GRACIA A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE MARIANO TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA FABRICACIÓN  Y VENTA DE ARTESANIA COMO ALCANCILLAS, OLLAS DE BARROS, JARRONES, CENICEROS. ETC. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN, DESDE HACE CINCO AÑOS QUE DESEMPEÑA DICHA ACTIVIDAD. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO. MARIANO AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Mariano is forty two years old. He is married and has two small children. He is from a place located in the north of the region called Malpaisillo. He is known for being hardworking and responsible with the energy to get ahead in the world. Unfortunately, due to a lack of money, he was unable to study at university and was instead forced to work from a very young age in order to support his family with the household expenses. He is now fighting to move his business in the right direction.   

Thanks to his energy and desire to get ahead, Mariano now makes and sells artisan crafts such as piggy banks, clay pots, jugs, ashtray, etc. He set this business up five years ago in his home and has been running it since. The purpose of the loan is to invest money into his work and stock his business. Mariano is thankful for all the help the Kiva lenders provide people with limited resources and people from poor countries such as Nicaragua as this support allows these people have decent jobs.

loans.use: to buy artisan crafts such as jugs, vases and ashtrays to later sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 19-year-old single lady who started selling cosmetics and giving tutorials three years ago to cover her needs and expenses due to the low financial situation of her family. She is an ambitious lady who is continuing her studies while running her business. 

Today, Nancy is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business by increasing her merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics to satisfy her customers' special requests in this summer season, as she wants to pay her university tuition fees. 

Nancy hopes to graduate from her university and open her own educational institute to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics and pay her university tuition fees

loans.name: Noura

texts.en:
Noura is a 30 year old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. Despite the bad circumstances, she is making a great effort in cooperation with her husband to be able to satisfy the family’s demands. She owns a grocery store since 2010, when she opened a small room in her house where she equipped it with the needed items. 

Today, she is taking a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase food provisions to increase her business sales as well as her income. She is an optimistic person always aiming for the best and plans to receive more Kiva loans with the coming years to keep on improving her family’s standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase food provisions for her store

loans.name: Assia

texts.en: Assia is 41-year-old, widowed woman. She has two children. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchasing and selling business. She buys cloth in various fabrics in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Now, she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Assia expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 41 year old, married woman. She is involved in the clothing trade business. She purchases a variety of clothes at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base.

Shabana has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of clothes in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of clothes in different colors for her business in order to boost her earnings.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is thirty two years old. She is married and has no children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Francisca is an insurance agent and owns a shop where she sells water sachets. She has done the water sachet business for three years. 

She wants to expand her water sachet business by adding bottled water to meet the demands of her clients. She is hopeful that, in five years time, she will own a wholesale outlet where she will sell the water in larger quantities.

loans.use: to expand her water sachet business.

loans.name: Angel Gabriel

texts.es:
Angel es un estudiante de SENATI, que vive en Lima junto a su familia. Él actualmente está cursando la carrera de Diseño Industrial, la cual le gusta mucho porque le parece que es una carrera con proyección al futuro. 

Recién está iniciando su carrera por lo que aún le falta 2 años y medio para poder culminarla. Él se siente muy entusiasmado con su carrera.

Él está solicitando el apoyo de KIVA porque su familia está atravesando por una difícil situación económica y teme perder sus estudios a causa de eso. Este préstamo le ayudará a terminar sus estudios y convertirse en un excelente profesional con una visión distinta de la vida.

Su mayor sueño es ser un profesional exitoso, ayudar a sus padres y formar su propia empresa. Él se siente muy feliz y agradecido con este apoyo que KIVA le está brindando porque le quitará una gran preocupación a sus padres para solventar sus estudios.
