Angel, les quiere expresar lo siguiente: "Me siento muy agradecido y me da gusto que en el mundo existan personas tan buenas como los integrantes de KIVA que apoyan a chicos con problemas económicos. Gracias!! y valoro mucho el apoyo que le dan a estudiantes como yo.
texts.en:
Angel lives in Lima with his family and is currently a student at SENATI. He is studying for a degree in industrial design, and he really likes it because he sees this as a career with great prospects. He is very excited about it.

He's just beginning the program and needs an additional two and a half years to obtain his degree. He is asking Kiva for support because his family is passing through a difficult financial situation, and he fears losing his studies. This loan will help him to complete the degree and become an excellent  professional with a new outlook on life.

His greatest dream is to be a successful professional, to start his own business, and to help his parents. Angel is very happy and grateful for  this support from Kiva, because it will alleviate his parents' concern about financing his education.

Angel would like to share this with you:
"I am so grateful, and so happy to know that in the world there are compassionate people such as the Kiva lenders, willing to support kids with financial needs. Thank you! I greatly value the support you give to students like me."

loans.use: to pay for his degree program in industrial design.

loans.name: Sulemana

texts.en:
Sulemana is a thirty-six year old man who lives in a family house at Nima, a suburb of Accra. He and his family use the commercial toilet facility because the government of Ghana has abolished the use of palm latrines because of the danger it poses for those who use it. 

As the head of his family and a landlord, he is requesting this loan to enable him to build the toilet facility for his family members.  He can be able to repay the loan through income from his business as a trader.

loans.use: To construct a mordern toilet facility for the benefit of his entire family

loans.name: Rukaya

texts.en:
Rukaya lives in a house at Nima, a suburb of Accra. She is 44 years of age.  There is no toilet facility in the house where she lives, so she and her family use the commercial toilet in the community, which is quite far from her house. As a tenant, she consulted the other tenants about the need for them to have their toilet facility and they all agreed to that effect. Rukaya informed her landlord who lives elsewhere about it and he did not protest against it, but offered his consent. 

Rukaya, as the eldest among the tenants in the house, is requesting this loan to enable them to build a modern toilet facility for the entire house. They can repay the loan through contributions from the tenants.

loans.use: To put up a two seater toilet facility in her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, seeds,. fertilizer, herbicides, etc. to continue to grow garden produce.

loans.name: Seniwe Group

texts.fr: Moutian est âgé de 35 ans ; cultivateur et éleveur. C’est lui qui tient la corne du bélier. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants de 5 à 1 an. Sa femme est ménagère. Son rêve est de faire une bonne famille et préparer l’avenir de ses enfants et construire une maison en dure pour sa famille avec  le revenu de son activité d’élevage. N’ayant pas été à l’école Moutian fait recourt au RMCR pour avoir de l’aide financière pour augmenter le nombre des moutons à élevage. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de son village et revend dans les mêmes marchés. Son bénéfice prévisionnel mensuel est de 82000 FCFA. Il exerce cette activité d’élevage depuis 4 ans. Il se réjouit dans cette activité car  c’est bénéfique pour lui. Les obstacles auxquels il se heurte sont les maladies et décès de moutons  mais il fait un bon traitement des moutons pour diminuer le risque.
texts.en: Moutian is 35 years old. He earns a living through farming and raising livestock. He is the man holding the ram by the horns in the photo. He is a married father to four children aged between one and five years old. His wife is a housewife. His dream is to have a good family, to prepare for his children's futures and to build a permanent house for his family with the revenue from his livestock business. Because he never went to school, Moutian turned to RMCR for financial aid so he could increase the number of sheep he keeps as livestock. He gets his supplies from the local village markets and resells his livestock at these same markets. His projected monthly profit stands at 82,000 FCFA. He has been raising livestock for four years. He enjoys carrying out this activity because it is profitable to him. He is faced with many difficulties, such as his sheep dying or getting sick, but he treats his livestock well in order to avoid this risk.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Jlg-015-(A)-Kulithalai Group

texts.en:
Mahalakshmi is 32 years old, and lives with her husband in the rural part of Karur. She has formed a self-help group with two other women, Chandra and Parasakthi. These women work hard to support their families, and save diligently. However, their finances are not adequate for them to access basic necessities like toilets in their homes. They have to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, their families are at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in their families are exposed to the additional risk of molestation. 

Taking matters into their own hands, Mahalakshmi and her group want to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of Rs.42,000 to cover the cost of raw materials and labor for constructing these toilets. Your loan will help these three hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: To improve sanitation facilities in their homes by installing toilets

loans.name: St. Paul Seminary Kasese School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Fr. Felix. He is the Head teacher of St. Pauls' Seminary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kabale, with 330 students. St. Pauls' Seminary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Pauls' Seminary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Fr. Felix ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice, Irish potatoes and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 49-year-old married father of one daughter. Five years ago, he got employed in a restaurant as a chef to cover his family's needs and expenses. As his daughter is growing up, his limited salary is not enough anymore to cover her increasing needs. Thus, today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his daughter's school tuition fees. This loan is very important to him for he believes that education is a priority. He hopes to stay capable of providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's school tuition fees.

loans.name: G.s. Los Lirios Group

texts.es:
EL G.S. LOS LIRIOS ESTA CONFORMADA POR TRES MUJERES, MADRES SOLTERAS CON CUATRO HIJOS  BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIAS DE LA PAZ CENTRO, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE OCCIDENTE DEL PAÍS, SE  CARACTERIZA POR SER UN LUGAR QUE SE DESTACA POR SU COMIDA Y BEBIDA TÍPICA COMO EL QUESILLO Y PINOL. ESTAS MADRES SOLTERAS SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL. TODAS TIENEN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONOMICA, PERO SE APOYAN ENTRE SI PARA SACAR ADELANTE SUS NEGOCIOS Y  CUMPLIR METAS Y OBJETIVOS COMO, BRINDARLES ESTUDIOS A SUS HIJOS, Y HACER CRECER SUS NEGOCIOS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES TERESA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA UNA MINI LIBRERÍA UBICADA EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN, TIENE CINCO AÑOS DE DEDICARSE A DICHA ACTIVIDAD, LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO ES DE UNAS OCHO HORAS DIARIAS, OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE LIBRERÍA COMO:  CUADERNOS, LAPICEROS, BORRADORES,  HOJAS, PAPEL CREPE, PAPEL LUSTRILLO, BORRADORES, PEGA, LENTEJUELAS, HOJAS DE COLORES ETC. PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. LOS LIRIOS AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
G.S. Los Lirios is made up of 3 women who are single mothers with four children to care for.  They are from La Paz Centro, located in the western part of the country.  It is a place known for its typical food and drink, such as  el quesillo (a dish made from a thick corn tortilla wrapped around soft cheese, pickled onions, and a sauce of sour cream or liquid cheese and vinegar) and pinol (a drink made from toasted, ground, white corn).  

These single mothers are hard working and responsible, with a drive to improve themselves.  Each has a different economic pursuit, but they support each other in moving their businesses forward, and accomplishing goals and objectives such as providing schooling to their children and growing their businesses.

Due to her desire to succeed, the coordinator is Teresa who runs a small stationery store in her home.  She has run this business for five years.  She works eight hours a day selling her products.  The purpose of the loan is to invest in work capital and to stock her store for the purchase and sale of stationery products such as: notebooks, pens, erasers, sheets of paper, crepe paper, tissue paper, glue, sequins, construction paper, etc. so that in the not too distant future she can increase her earnings.

Los Lirios are grateful for the help that the Kiva investors provide to people with limited resources, and to poor countries such as Nicaragua, allowing a means of work with dignity.

loans.use: to purchase stationery products such as: notebooks, pens, erasers, sheets of paper, crepe paper, tissue paper, glue, sequins, construction paper, etc.

loans.name: Glenda Yesenia

texts.es: Glenda, tiene 40 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de San Luis Comayagua. Anteriormente trabajaba en una tienda de la comunidad. Luego decidió mejor poner su propio negocio donde vende productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, churros, azúcar, pan, huevos, refrescos, carnes, también vende ropa y tiene una fotocopiadora donde recibe otros ingresos. Esta solicitando un prestamo por 30,000 lempiras para surtir el negocio de pulpería con productos de azucar, arroz, productos enlatados, churros, variedad de dulces, refrescos, verduras,etc, compra de ropa y materiales para la fotocopiadora. Tiene como plan hacer crecer el negocio hasta convertirlo en un  mercadito.
texts.en:
Glenda is 40 years old. She lives with in a common-law realtionship with her husband with whom she has two children. They live in the municipality of.San Luis Comayagua. Previously she worked in a store in the community. Later she decided it was better to open her own business where she sells food products like rice, beans, chips, sugar, bread, eggs, soft drinks and also sells clothing and has a photocopier which brings other revenues.

She is requesting a loan for 30,000 HNL to stock her small store with products like sugar, rice, canned products, snack food, a variety of sweets. soft drinks, vegetables, etc. plus buy clothing and photocopy materials. She has a plan to expand her business to make it become a small supermarket.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, canned products, snack food, a variety of sweets. soft drinks, vegetables, etc plus buy clothing and photocopy materials.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a fifty-nine year-old woman, a widow and a mother of four. She lives at La in the Greater Accra Region. She is a sachet and bottled water vendor as well as a food vendor at La.  Charity has been selling sachet water for seven years and has two sales girls who take the water to bus terminals to sell. She also sells the water to support the food she has been selling.

Charity will like to expand her sachet water business because she has realized that it moves faster than the food. With this loan, she will be able to buy more water to sell. She believes that in five years time she will focus on the water business and get a bigger shop to sell it.

loans.use: To expand her sachet and bottled water business

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat, age 35, is a married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband who has been running a business manufacturing footballs for many years. He makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. He earns enough to meet the expenses of her family members. For the improvement of her husband's business, she has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads and needles in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads and needles in a large quantity to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur lives with his nice family in Artashat town. He has been involved in providing welding service for four years. He renovates gates, doors and roofs and receives a number of orders during the month. Artur has now applied for this loan to purchase a portable welding machine that will enable him to organize welding works at any place where there is no electricity. 

Artur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will be a big support for Artur to develop his business activity and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for portable welding machine

loans.name: Kigezi Cleverland School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Francis. He is the head teacher of Kigezi Cleverland High School, a mixed school with 700 students in the rural area of Kabale. 

Kigezi Cleverland School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school currently does not have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750-litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kigezi Cleverland School will repay the loan from school fees, which they collect each term. Francis hopes that having access to safe drinking water will ultimately improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sewesse Group

texts.fr: Fianlo  est  un cultivateur d’arachide âge de 34 ans. IL vie au mali avec sa femme et ses 04 enfants âge de 21 à 3 ans . IL exerce la culture d’arachide depuis 14 ans, fianlo  porte entre ses mains la daba devant les autres membres du groupe sur la photo. La culture d’arachide lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille. IL achète ses semences d’arachide dans les marchés environnant de son village. Il souhaiterait d’acheter des bœufs de l’labour et de charrette  pour améliorer sa culture d’arachide dans les jours à venir. En dehors de cela il expert biturer une maison en toile pour sa famille.  Il gagne par mois une somme de 143 000 FCFA comme bénéfice.  les difficultés qui lui arrivent souvent  dans l’agriculture est le manque de la pluviométrie et aussi la chute du prix d’arachide dans le marché.
texts.en: Fianlo is a 34-year-old peanut farmer. He lives in Mali with his wife and four children, aged between three and 21 years old. He has been growing peanuts for 14 years. Fianlo is the man holding the "daba", an axe-like hand tool, in front of the other group members in the photo. Growing peanuts allows him to meet his family's needs. He purchases peanut seeds from the markets local to his village. He would like to purchase cows to pull equipment and a cart so he can improve his peanut-growing venture for the future. In addition to this, he would like to build a house for his family. He earns a monthly profit of 143,000 FCFA. He is often faced with difficulties when growing his crops, such as a lack of rainfall and also the falling price of peanuts at market.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to sow in their fields

loans.name: Rudy William

texts.es: Rudy de 20 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus padres y su hermano. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se desempeña como jornalero, además buscando mejorar un poco la calidad de vida de su familia siembra diferentes hortalizas, como: mora, chipilín, güisquil, entre otros de las cuales deja cierta cantidad para el consumo y la otra la vende de forma ambulante en el mercado principal de su municipio, logrando así un ingreso extra que le permite ayudar a mantener la economía de su hogar. Rudy desea incrementar la siembra de sus cultivos ya que es un negocio rentable el que posee y además ha logrado crear muchos clientes los cuales solicitan con frecuencias sus productos. Por lo anterior Rudy está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar los insumos necesarios como: insecticidas, abobos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc.
texts.en:
Rudy is 20 years old. He lives in his own house with his parents and his brother. He is an enterprising man that works as a labourer. But he is also aiming to improve the quality of life of his family and is therefore also planting different vegetables and fruits such as blackberries, chipilín [a plant used as a herb in soups, etc.] and chayote amongst others. He sets some of his produce aside to consume and the rest he sells at a stall at the town's main market. From this he earns a little extra money that allows him to help maintain his household's finances. 

Rudy wants to increase the number of plants that he grows as it is a profitable business. He has also obtained many clients who frequently ask for his products. For the aforementioned reasons, Rudy is asking FUSAI for a loan so that he can buy necessary supplies such as: insecticides, manure, seeds and fertiliser, etc.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, manure, seeds and fertiliser, etc.

loans.name: Rabiha

texts.en:
Rabiha is a 39-year-old engaged lady who started twelve years ago working as a hairdresser to cover her needs and expenses. She learned this profession from an institute, as she worked in a few beauty salons before she decided to open her own business. 

Rabiha has a good reputation in her area for her professional skills. She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business.  Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to buy the necessary updated tools to facilitate her business as she wants to redecorate her salon to attract more customers. 

Rabiha hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary updated tools and redecorate her salon

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna is 58 years old and married. She has run a milk-selling business with the help of her husband for many years. She has buffalos for milking purpose and sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. 

Amna has seven children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her them. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, and now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo. This will help her increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is forty one years old. He is a widower and has five children who are between the ages of four and fourteen years. All his children are in school. Michael sells waste bins and has done this business for two years. He is also a carpenter by profession. He has employed one person who helps him to manage the waste bins shop.

Michael is requesting this loan to buy more waste bins of different sizes to meet the demands of his customers.He believes that this will help him to manage his home.

loans.use: to buy different types of plastic waste bins to sell and increase his income.

loans.name: Light Mixed School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Charles. He is the Deputy Head teacher of Light Mixed Primary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Nauyo in Mbale with 800 students. Light Mixed School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Light Mixed School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Charles ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is 39 years old and married. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Zakia is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested for a loan of 150,000 PKR  to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently and thus boost her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio  Cesar  tiene la edad de 43 años, esta casado y vive con la esposa  actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo y abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el segundo  préstamo que  he recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado los  préstamos  con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 43 years old, married and lives with his wife. The loan he’s requesting will be used to buy coffee seedlings, manure and to assist in a coffee plantation that they want to start. 

He wishes to give the crops the proper care with the objective of having a better production and increasing his incomes. 

He hopes that in the future he can provide his family with a better quality of life and give them greater financial stability. He also expects to grow as a person and as a producer. 

This is the second loan that he receives from FUDECOSUR. He hadn’t had any other credit from state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him the loans with payment facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings and supplies.

loans.name: Noe

texts.es: Noe, tiene 40 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 4 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de San Sebastián, Lempira.  El siempre se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz y frijoles y hace 9 años que decidió cultivar café para vender y que sea la mayor fuente de ingresos. En el cultivo de cafe tambien siembra banano el cual sirve de sombra y cosecha tambien. El café lo vende en pergamino húmedo y seco en la misma zona. El prestamo que ha solicitado es por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para darle asistencia a su finca de café  y mejorar la producción. Su meta es tener una finca más grande y salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en: Noe is 40 years old. He lives in a common-law realtionship with his spouse with whom he has four children. They live in a village in the municipality of San Sebastián, Lempira. He has always grown corn and beans and nine years ago decided to grow coffee to sell, as it is a better source of income. In his coffee fields he also grows bananas which serve as shade and he harvests them too. He sells the coffee as both wet and dried parchment coffee in his area. The loan he has requested is for 15,000 HNL to buy fertilizer and pay for labor to care for his coffee plantation and improve production. His goal is to have a larger farm and get ahead with his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor to care for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is 44 years old and a married mother of three children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals on seasonal basis to earn an extra amount of income. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Wend Konta Group

texts.fr: Rihanata est âgée de 35 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants dont 2 scolarisés. Elle exerce son activité depuis 10 ans. Ce fait marcher son activité ce sont : le respect de la clientèle, et le travail bien fait. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter du tissus à 300 000 f ; d’accessoire de couture (boutons, fils, fermeture) à 100 000. L’utilité du prêt c’est d’approvisionner son commerce en quantité suffisante afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt plusieurs fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Rihanata is a 35-year-old married mother of four children, two of whom are in school. She has been working in her business for 10 years. What makes her business successful is her respect for the customers and work well done. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase 300,000 francs worth of fabric and 100,000 francs worth of sewing accessories (buttons, thread, zippers.) The loan will be used to supply her business in order to be able to satisfy her customers. She has already received many loans and has repaid them on time.

loans.use: to purchase 300,000 francs worth of fabric and 100,000 francs worth of sewing accessories (buttons, thread, zippers)

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is thirty-six years of age and a mother of three. She lives at La in the Greater Accra Region where she sells sachet and bottled water. She has done this business for two years. Beatrice would like to expand her business and increase sales.

With this loan, Beatrice will buy more sachet water and bottled water for resale. She is hopeful that in five year's time, her business will expand with many branches in the Greater Accra region.

loans.use: To buy more sachet water for resale

loans.name: Parissin Group

texts.fr: Damy a 34 ans marié et père de 2 enfants de 3 à 1 an.Damy est l' homme par devant a cote du bélier sur la photo. Sa femme exerce le petit commerce de fonio. Son rêve pour l’avenir c’est d’avoir de bénéfice et  assurer l’avenir de sa famille et aussi la scolarité de ses enfants. IL fait recourt au RMCR pour  avoir d’autres races de moutons pour son activité d’élevage. Il s’approvisionne  dans les marchés environnants et vend dans les mêmes marchés où il peut faire un bénéfice prévisionnel  mensuel de 80 000FCFA. Il se réjouit dans l’ élevage des moutons qu’il exerce plus de 5 ans. Les problèmes qu’il  rencontre sont approvisionnement en aliment bétails et de bons vétérinaires.
texts.en:
Damy, age 34, is married with two children ages 1 and 3. In the group photo, he is the one standing in the front row by the ram. His wife sells fonio. Damy’s long-term ambition is to earn the profits necessary to provide for his family’s future and to support his children’s education.  

He partnered with RMCR to acquire other breeds of sheep for his activity. He buys them at nearby markets and sells them at the same locations where he typically expects to make a monthly profit of 80,000FCFA. 

Damy enjoys breeding sheep, an activity that he has been practicing for over 5 years. Some of his challenges have to do with the supply of animal feed and the access to good veterinarians.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise and sell.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana  is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of tailoring at home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Rukhsana  is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. 

However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 40000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to make more dresses on time.  She hopes to get increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to make more dresses on time

loans.name: Elibeth

texts.es: Elibeth tiene la edad  de 29 años, está casada, vive con el esposo y dos hijos. Con su crédito pretende comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el segundo   préstamo que he recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado los  préstamos con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Elibeth is 29 years old, married and lives with her husband and her two children. With this loan she pretends to buy some coffee seedlings to re-sow at the start of the rainy season and increase the density of plants per area. 

With these improvements in the crops she hopes to have more earnings, improve her living conditions and accomplish some of her goals. This is the second loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. 

She had never had other loans with state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her loans with payment facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers and fumigants.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
Celina es una joven mujer de 23 años de ead, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de pollo frito.
Ella es inteligente, emprendedora, constante, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Sacaba’ área rural que se encuentra situada en el centro del país en medio de la Cordillera de los Andes. sobre una tierra fértil y productiva a 2570 metros sobre el nivel del mar, rodeada por campos de cultivos y valiosos vestigios preincaicos, conserva su semblante colonial y las costumbres que heredó de sus antepasados indígenas.
Celina es de tez morena, ojos negros, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su padre que se dedica a la construcción y con su hermano que trabaja independientemente, viven en una casa propia en media construcción hecha de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, no existe el alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de pollo frito en las afueras de su domicilio todos los días de la semana por las tardes y noches. Todo el pueblo está acostumbrado a la falta de agua, esta se obtiene de pozos o del río, el agua de pozo es turbia y el agua de rio no sirve para alimentarse porque es utilizada para todo tipo de actividades, recientemente el gobierno realizó la conexión de agua potable en el lugar, “esta instalación de agua potable nos mejorará la calidad de vida, también influirá en mi negocio y hasta podemos agregar la venta de refrescos hervidos…” comenta. La ventaja de su zona es que ya cuenta con el servicio de agua potable en el lugar, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la conexión de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería. Su sueño es ver instalada la conexión de agua potable en su hogar, ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para mejorar su calidad de vida y su negocio. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que construye su casa y vende comida.
Es por esos motivos que Celina solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Celina is a 23 year old single woman with no children. Her business is selling fried chicken.

She is intelligent, enterprising, consistent, patient, responsible and very hard-working. Her business takes place in ‘Sacaba’ a rural area which is located in the center of the country in the Andes mountains on fertile and productive land 2570 meters above sea level. It is surrounded by fields of crops and valuable Pre-Incan ruins. It has preserved it's colonial appearance and the customs that they inherited from their indigenous ancestors.

Celina is dark-skinned, with dark eyes, long black hair, short and of robust build. Her native language is Quechua which she speaks at home and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her father who works in construction and her brother who works independently. They live in their own house make of bricks and cement with a metal roof and cement floor. It has electricity and well water from a pump and has no sewage.

Her business is selling fried chicken outside of her house every day of the week in the afternoon and evening. The whole village is used to the lack of water which is obtained from wells or from the river. The water from the well is muddy and the river water is not used in foods as it is used for all kinds of activities. Recently the government connected the community with potable water. "This installation of potable water improves our quality of living. It also has an influence on my business and we can also add the sale of boiled drinks" she commented. The advantage of the area is it now has potable water in the area, her disadvantage is the lack of capital to connect water to her kitchen bathroom and laundry.

Her dream is to see the installation of potable water to her house. She wants to install potable water to her kitchen bathroom and laundry to improve her quality of living and her business. This is her first loan with the institution in the year since they built the house and she has sold food.

For these reasons Celina is requesting a loan to install running water in her kitchen, bathroom and wash basin to improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to install running water in her kitchen, bathroom and wash basin to improve her quality of living.

loans.name: Seniwe Group

texts.fr: Clément est un agriculteur âgé de 40 ans. Il vit dans un  petit village au Mali. Il est marié et père de 9 enfants âgés de 20 à 3 ans dont 3 sont à l’école. C’est lui qui tient la daba en bas de la photo. Clément fait la culture des arachides depuis quatre ans. Il se réjouit avec la culture des arachides car c’est bénéfique pour lui.  Son rêve est d’avoir plus d’argent pour cultiver beaucoup d’arachides et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Ainsi il espère construire une nouvelle maison pour sa famille et subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille. Il s’approvisionne dans son village et environnants et vend ses arachides dans les marchés locaux de sa zone. Son bénéfice prévisionnel s’estime à 75 000F. Les difficultés qu’il rencontre sont généralement l’insuffisance de pluie et le manque de moyens agricoles.
texts.en: Clément is a 40-year-old farmer. He lives in a small village in Mali. He is a married father to nine children, aged between three and 20 years; three of his children are currently attending school. He is the man holding the "daba", an axe-like hand tool, in the photo. Clément has been growing peanuts for four years. He enjoys carrying out this activity because it is profitable to him. His dream is to have more money for growing lots of peanuts and to be able to improve his family's standard of living. He also hopes to be able to build a new house for his family and to be able to meet their daily needs. He gets his supplies from his village and the surrounding area. He sells his peanuts at the local markets in his area. His predicted profit is estimated to be 75,000 FCFA. He is often met with difficulties such as a lack of rainfall and a lack of farming tools.

loans.use: to farm their peanut fields and sell the crops

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 36 year-old Lebanese married woman mother for two children living with her husband who is the income provider. She works also as an employee in a company and she states that living costs are becoming very expensive. 

This is the reason why she is in real need today of borrowing a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, which funds will be paid at once to cover her children study fees. Her first goal is to insure a good educational level to them.

loans.use: to cover her children study fees

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es: Marta, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y reside en el municipio de San Luis, Comayagua junto a un hijo y una hermana. En busca de generar sus propios ingresos decidió poner su propio negocio el cual lleva 11 meses de funcionar y ha visto que va en crecimiento. En su negocio vende productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, manteca, café, sal, harina, huevos, productos de aseo, churros, dulces y otros abarrotes. Con el fin de ofrecer al cliente variedad y nuevos productos esta solicitando un prestamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar carnes, refrescos, granos básicos, productos de aseo, golosinas y otros. Su meta propuesta es seguir mejorando su negocio para darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marta is 44 years old. She is a single mother of three and lives in San Luis, Comayagua with her sister and one of her children. In order to make her own income, she decided to start her own business. It has been running for eleven months and she is seeing it grow. She runs a store where she sells groceries like rice, beans, lard, coffee, salt, flour, eggs, churros, and sweets, as well as toiletries and other products. 

In order to offer her customers a wider variety of products, she is requesting a 10,000 lempira loan to buy meat, soft drinks, basic grains, sweets, toiletries, and other products. Her set goal is to continue improving her business in order to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meat, soft drinks, basic grains, sweets, toiletries, and other products.

loans.name: Abel Amauris

texts.es:
Abel Amauris es un joven estudiante de Ingenieria Industrial, él solicita un pretamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Hola mi nombre es Abel Amauris, tengo 17 años de edad, vivo con mi madre y hermana de 5 años de edad en una humilde casa en el sector Cristo Rey, ubicada en la ciudad de santo domingo. Actualmente mi madre trabaja como conserje y no tengo ningún contacto con mi padre desde pequeño.
Tengo deseos de seguir estudiando la carrera de ingeniería industrial, finalice mi primer trimestre, pero por los pocos recursos económicos se me dificultad continuar, debido a que los ingresos que recibe mi madre no son suficientes para costear la universidad y sustentar los gastos del hogar y mi pequeña hermana. Deseo devolver a mi madre todo el apoyo que me da cada día y poder llenarla de orgullo.
Es mi anhelo graduarme y ser un gran profesional útil a la sociedad y poder ayudar a mi madre y hermana en un futuro con los gastos que se presenten en el hogar. Espero ser favorecido con esta solicitud y que de no recibir este préstamo no podría salir adelante como en verdad deseo, lo que me provocaría un estancamiento y la pérdida de oportunidades que si tengo la ayuda de ustedes la puedo aprovechar.
texts.en:
Abel Amauris is a young Industrial Engineering student. He is requesting a loan to pay for his educational expenses, and this is his story: 

Hi, my name is Abel Amauris, I’m 17 years old and I live with my mom and my 5-year-old sister in a humble house in the sector Cristo Rey, located at the city of Santo Domingo. My mom currently works as a janitor and I haven’t had any contact with my father since I was a little boy. 

I want to keep studying Industrial Engineering. I’ve finished my first semester but due to the lack of economic resources I find it hard to continue. My mom’s incomes are not enough to pay for college, household expenses and support my little sister. 

I wish to give her back all of the support that she has given me and make her proud of me. It is my desire to graduate and become a useful professional for the society, and help my mom and my sister in the future with the household expenses. 

I hope to receive this help, without which I wouldn’t be able to get ahead as I intend to do, my development would be stalled and opportunities would be lost. However, with your help I could make the most of such opportunities.

loans.use: to pay for higher education expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, compost, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Dios Me Fortalece Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL DIOS ME FORTALECE  ESTA CONFORMADA POR  NUEVE INTEGRANTES SIETE MUJERES Y DOS HOMBRES, PADRES Y MADRES RESPONSABLES CON  QUINCE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, LOS CUALES ESTÁN ESTUDIANDO,  EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA SACAR ADELANTE SU NEGOCIOS, EL CUAL ES SU MEDIO DE INGRESOS PARA SUS FAMILIAS, LUCHAN DÍA A DÍA PARA SACAR ADELANTE  A SUS HIJOS Y BRINDARLES MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES DE VIDA.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES MARGARITA MARÍA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE ARTESANIA LA CUAL DISTRIBUYE POR ENCARGO Y EN UN LUGAR FIJO DE LA LOCALIDAD.  ELLA TIENE OCHO AÑOS DE DEDICARSE A DICHA ACTIVIDAD.  ELLA DEDICA UNAS OCHOS HORAS DIARIAS  A DICHO NEGOCIO Y CONSISTE EN VENDER ARTESANIA COMO: JARRONES, FLOREROS, CENICEROS, ALCALCILLAS, ROPA TÍPICA, PORTA LAPIZ, BOLSOS TÍPICOS ETC. EL OBJETIVO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. DIOS ME FORTALECE AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The communal bank Dios Me Fortalece comprises nine members, seven women and two men. They are the responsible parents of fifteen total children, who are all in school. They are currently working hard for their businesses to succeed. Their work allows them to make a living for their families. They are striving every day in order to provide for their children so that they can have better opportunities in life.

Margarita Maria is very driven to get ahead, which is why she is the group coordinator. Her business sells crafts by order, as well as at her local store. She has been in business for eight years. She works around eight hours a day and some of the items she sells are artisanal vases, ashtrays, pencil holders, traditional clothing and bags, etc. Her goal is to invest in working capital and stock up on merchandise in order to make a better income in the near future. 

Dios Me Fortalece wants to thank Kiva lenders for the help they offer people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy crafts like vases, ashtrays, pencil holders, traditional clothing and bags, etc.

loans.name: Royal Academy School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Leo. He is the head teacher of Royal Academy School, a mixed school in the rural area of Lira with 500 students. Royal Academy School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750-liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Royal Academy School will repay its loan from its school fees, which they collect each term. Leo ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, aged 46, is a mother of five. She has a 16-year-old son who has recently completed junior high school. For the past twelve years, to earn a living, Mary has operated a business that sells sachet water. She has salesgirls who take the water to bus terminals and houses to sell for a daily wage. 

Mary wants to expand the business as it is thriving. However, as a result of financial constraints, she is unable to do this. With this loan, she will be able to sell bottled water as well as sachet water and thus sell more to earn additional income.

loans.use: To expand her sachet and bottled water business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 25 years old. She is married and has three children. She grows passion fruit, maize, beans, and kale and has been farming for six years. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. She will use the profit from her business to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself as loving. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more beauty products. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es: María, tiene  40 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y vive con ellos en el municipio de San Juan, Intibucá, cerca al municipio de Lempira. Ella anteriormente ayudaba a las labores agrícolas a sus padres y hace 11 años se dedica al cultivo de café. Cuenta con una manzana de terreno donde realiza sus cultivos. La producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 16,000 Lempiras y es el sexto ciclo con ODEF, el cual  va invertir  en la compra de fertilizantes para aplicarle a su finca de cafe. El préstamo le ayudará a mejorar la cosecha y produccion. Su meta es  mejorar la finca y sembrar mas área de café.
texts.en:
María is forty years old and a single mother. She has four children and lives with them in San Juan, Intibucá, near the town of Lempira. She used to help her parents work farming, and for the past eleven years she has been growing coffee. She has a plot of land where she works. She sells her harvest at the local market in her area. 

She is requesting a 16,000 lempira loan and this is her sixth cycle with ODEF. She will invest it in purchasing fertilizer for her coffee plantation. This loan will help her improve production and harvest. Her goal is to improve her plantation and start growing coffee in a larger area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Puleng

texts.en:
Puleng, 49, is a single mother struggling to sustain her four children. She rents out two tin shacks in her backyard and uses that money to pay school fees as well as upkeep costs for her family. However, the rental income is not enough to sustain her family, especially now that her oldest child, 22, wants to pursue further studies.

She is requesting a loan to build a cement and plaster structure. "I will have better rooms so I can charge higher rent," says Puleng. The loan will purchase blocks, cement, plaster and window frames amongst other material required to build the room. She will also pay the contractor who is building the room.

Puleng hopes to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy construction material and pay the contractor.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is 45 years old and a mother of two. She lives at La in the Greater Accra Region where she sells sachet (drinking) water in polythene bags for a living. She has done this business for 20 years and that has been her only source of income.

Selina will use this loan, when granted, to buy more sachet water and sell it to her clients in order to increase her income. She will use the profit she makes from the sale of sachet water to pay her children's school fees and her rent advance, which will expire next year.

loans.use: To buy bags of sachet drinking water and bottled water for resale

loans.name: Molvine

texts.en:
Molvine is a married woman with six children. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for six years.

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient capital.

This is Molvine's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more beauty products for her salon stock.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her salon stock.

loans.name: Wilfrida

texts.en: Wilfrida is a married woman. She has five children. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to have a big grocery within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Luz Araceli

texts.en:
Luz Araceli is a 56-year-old woman who owns and runs a stationery store. She makes a living out of it.

She is asking for a MXN 16,000 (pesos) loan to fill her stock and make a temporary stand in which she will sell her products in the last week of scholar vacations.

loans.use: to fill her stationery stock.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with two children who are 5 and 10 years old. She describes herself as intelligent.

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, soap, cooking fat and other items. Her primary customers are locals.

This is Ruth's fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

Ruth will use this KES 85,000 loan to buy more sugar, flour, salt, soap and other items to sell in her store. She will use the anticipated profits to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, flour, salt, soap and other items to sell in her store

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo tiene 63 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge sin hijos a su cargo en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de San Felipe que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Leonardo se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de lima, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de varios años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de lima así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Leonardo espera ofrecer una lima de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 63 years old, and lives with his partner.  He has no children to care for.  They live in a house they own, made of rustic material, in the district of San Felipe, in the province of Jaén, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Perú. Life in this district is peaceful.  The inhabitants work primarily in agriculture, business and cattle raising.

Leonardo works in agriculture, specifically growing limes.  He has several years experience in this field, and has very good personal and work references in the area. The loan he seeks will be used to buy manure and fertilizers to adequately maintain his lime crop, and to hire labor for the harvest season.  As a result, Leonardo hopes to offer a higher quality lime to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income level, allowing him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to adequately maintain his lime crop, and to hire labor for the harvest season.

loans.name: Adjoa Lydia

texts.fr: Agée de 51 ans et mère de trois enfants, Adjoa est une femme mariée habitant à Baguida. Adjoa est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qu’elle achète au marché et le revend à la devanture de sa maison. Pour s’approvisionner, Adjoa demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue  d’épargner et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants .
texts.en: 51 years old and mother of three children, Adjoa is a married woman living in Baguida. Adjoa is a charcoal resaler. She buys her supply at the market for retail in front of her house. For resupplying, Adjoa is requesting this loan to order sacks of charcoal with the aim of saving up and supporting her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 3 large bags of charcoal and 6 small bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto is ecstatic with the work he has done on his house with the help of his first credit. He is more excited to have access to a new credit to continue the work on his house. 

This time he wants to finish the work he did by installing the doors and windows needed. He looks forward to have this opportunity and continue working on his house to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to finish windows and door on his new house

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a married woman. She describes herself as dynamic. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, soap, cooking fat and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years.

Her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds.

This is Magdaline's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the KES 10,000 to buy more sugar, flour, salt, soap and other items to sell in her store. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, flour, salt, soap and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to resupply with 5 sacks of beans.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha de 30 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañero de vida y sus hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad.  Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años, cultivando hortalizas como: moras, espinacas, güisquil y ejotes. Dicha actividad la repite año con año ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos y la forma  como se gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar. El sueño de Martha es mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia por lo que esto la motiva a trabajar con más entusiasmo y mantener a flote sus cultivos ya que está segura que  solo con el trabajo logrará dar a su familia lo que tanto anhela, estas son algunas razones por las que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar a FUSAI un crédito que le permita invertir en los insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, semillas, abonos, insecticidas y otros los cuales le permitan incrementar su producción y abastecer las necesidades de sus clientes que son muchos  y siempre buscan adquirió sus productos. Espera lograr su objetivo y así dar a su familia lo que se merece y poder aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha is 30 years old. She lives in a house that she owns together with her life companion and her 7 and 9 year old children. She has worked in agriculture for many years, growing garden produce like: blackberries, spinach, chayote and green beans. She repeats this activity year after year as it is her main source of income and the way she makes her living and puts food on the table each day for her household.

Martha's dream is to improve her quality of living and that of her family which is her motivation for working with more enthusiasm and keeping up her crops. She is certain that the only way she can provide her family with what she wants is by working.

These are some of the reasons she has made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI. The loan will allow her to invest in agricultural inputs like: fertilizers, seeds, manure, insecticides and others. This will allow her to increase her production and supply the needs of her many clients who always look to acquire her product. She hopes to achieve her objective and give her family what they deserve and be able to aspire to a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, manure, insecticides and others which will allow her to increase her market garden production.

loans.name: Mahmood

texts.en:
Mahmood is a weaver from India who specializes in hand-loomed rugs. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of cotton, wool and jute yarn and bring on additional weavers at his workshop.

Mahmood has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

"My mother won a national award for the 'Panjadari' style of dhurries featuring embroidery. But in those days only the trader made money and the real artisans hardly earned any. I helped my father until I got married in 1994, then I started my own workshop."

"Thank you for supporting me. With your help, I will be able to grow my business and keep crafting rugs like my forefathers."

Use the link below to view Mahmood's hand-loomed rugs on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/4805">http://www.novica.com/kiva/4805

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of cotton, wool and jute yarn

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She runs a fishing business in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and she is now applying for a new loan to continue building her business. Leah dreams that, one day, she will be able to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to supply herself with two sacks of fish.

loans.name: Wayan

texts.en:
Wayan is an artisan from Indonesia who specializes in wood sculptures. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood and bring on additional carvers at his workshop. Wayan has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story: Wayan's father began teaching him to sculpt when he was a boy. "Balinese woodcarving touches me very deeply. I have learned a variety of arts in Bali, such as gamelan dance, but carving a piece of wood gives me an incomparable sensation," he says. "After I finished school, I studied further because I needed more experience, and the tools and material I needed were beyond my financial reach. Exploring the abstract world refreshes my mind in creating new carvings." "I currently need capital to build up my inventory and bring on more carvers to help me. No words can express how thankful I am for your support to me and my fellow carvers."

Use the link below to view Wayan's wood sculptures on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/878

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood and bring on additional carvers at his workshop

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en: Haseena is a 51-year-old married woman. She runs a business selling milk, with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Haseena’s job is to look after the buffalos and collect the milk from them. Together, the husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income to apply to their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Haseena has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo, to serve more customers and provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo so she can serve  more customers and provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Shabbiran

texts.en: Shabbiran is a 36-year-old married woman, the mother of 5 children. In order to help her husband take care of the family’s needs, she started a business selling milk. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income she generates. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy another buffalo, in order to increase her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo to increase her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Sabastian

texts.en:
Sabastian is a hardworking married man with 4 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a metal workshop which he supplements with a local bar that enables him to look after his family. His goal is to expand his business and open up a business for his wife so she can join hands in supporting their family, but he faces a challenge of price changes in the products he sells.

He is requesting a loan to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Sogjougua Group

texts.fr: C’est Salimata qui tient la corne du bélier dans la photo du groupe , elle est Malienne âgée de 42 ans , mariée   et mère d’une fille non scolarisée. C’est une éleveuse d’ovin depuis  15 ans et elle rêve  d’acheter   un terrain , l’or et de l’argent pour l’avenir de sa fille. Elle achète ses bétails au marché de son village et revend après quelques mois aux marchés public  avec beaucoup d’intérêts et ces intérêts  seront uniquement pour sa fille dans le cadre de son habillement et son soin médical .Elle fait recourt auprès de l’IMF pour agrandir le volume de son élevage d’ovin et afin de réaliser ses rêves.
texts.en: Salimata is the one in the group photo holding the ram’s horn. She is Malian, 42 years old, and a married mother of a girl, who is not in school. Salimata has been raising sheep for fifteen years, and she dreams of purchasing a plot of land and some gold and silver for her daughter’s future. She buys her animals at her village’s market and resells them after a few months at the public market with great benefit. And these benefits will be only for her daughter’s clothing and medical care. Salimata turned to the microfinance institution to expand the volume of her sheep-raising business, so as to realize her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to sell

loans.name: Boucary's Group

texts.fr: Celui qui tient la corne du bélier dans le groupe  sur la photo est Mamadou.C’est un commerçant d’ovin de nationalité Malienne âgée de 47 ans marié et père de 7 enfants 2 garçons scolarisés. Il exerce cette activité de commerce d’ovin depuis 8 ans, son activité consiste à acheter les bétails au marché de sa localité et faire le tour du marché en les revendant à des autres personnes avec un peu d’intérêt qui sera consacré pour ses enfants en leurs achetant des vêtements et chaussures et payer les frais de scolarisations.Le prêt lui servira de développer son activité,et son principal rêve est de construire en dur pour ses enfants et leurs acheter des motos.
texts.en:
The one holding the goat's horns in the photo is Mamadou. He is 47 years old, married, and from Mali. He is the father of seven children. Two of his sons go to school. 

Mamadou works buying and selling livestock, and he has done this for eight years. He buys sheep at a local market and then goes around to other markets reselling them to other people for a little profit.

Profits are dedicated to his children and are used to buy clothing and shoes, and to pay school fees.

This loan will serve to develop his business. His main dream is to build a permanent house for his children and buy them motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy sheep to resell

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 25-year-old single lady who got employed two years ago with limited salary to cover her needs and expenses. She is a hard worker who is nowadays preparing for her wedding. 

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary stuff in the preparation of her upcoming wedding. This loan is very important to Randa for it will make her dream comes true and build her own family.

loans.use: to buy necessary stuff in the preparation for her upcoming wedding

loans.name: Jovid

texts.en:
Jovid is a hardworking man. He was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1988. He is living in big city with his family. He is married and has two children. He is careful father and handsome husband. He tries to be useful and ensure his family with necessary items that they need. 

Unfortunately, he has problems with eyes. He wishes to have an operation on his eyes. However, he has not money to pay medical service he appealed to IMON for a help. He is requested a loan to pay his operation at hospital. He awaits Kiva lenders compassion and support.

loans.use: to pay his operation at a hospital

loans.name: Carminia

texts.es:
La socia Carminia pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
 La socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería  sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia Carminia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, gaseosas entre otros.
 La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Carminia belongs to the communal bank "Cusco Sur" in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She is continuing to earn a living through her grocery store business, and is a reponsible, painstaking worker.  Carminia is still selling her merchandise to customers who seek her out.  She has been in this business for some time, and takes personal satisfaction in her work, since in this way she can help her family get ahead.  Carminia is asking for the loan  to buy cooking oil, soft drinks, etc.   She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is a hard-working woman entrepreneur.

She has an ice candy-making business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her ice candy-making.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like selling natural medicines.

Warlita dreams that, one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice candy-making.

loans.name: Bwirukiro Tukwatanize Group B

texts.en:
Nalis is a hard working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a member of Bwirukiro Tukwatanise Group B where there is member group guarantorship. He is a teacher who also buys and sells produce and practices farming to earn an extra income. This has helped him improve the standard of living of his family. He aims at having a stable income but he is limited by price fluctuation and inadequate capital.
He is requesting a loan to buy more beans and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Nimol's Group

texts.en: The members of Nimol’s Group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. Nimol makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as farm laborer to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of the group members to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme mariée âgée de 45 ans résidant à  Baguida. Mère de trois enfants, Ablavi est une marchande de pagnes et tapettes qui s’approvisionnent au marché quatre fois par mois et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Ablavi désire ce crédit pour commander des pagnes et des tapettes en vue de maximiser son profit et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Ablavi is a married woman, age 45, residing in Baguida. Mother of three children, Ablavi sells traditional cloth (pagne) and flipflops. She resupplies at the market four times per month and resales them in the neighboring areas. Ablavi wants this loan to order pagnes and flipflops with the aim of maximizing her profit, aiding her husband with family expenses, and providing a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy four cuts of pagne (traditional cloth) and two units of flipflop sandals.

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en: The members of Sarim’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. Sarim makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
Savorn’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Savorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sarorn's Group

texts.en:
Sarorn’s Group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sarorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
Adrian is an artisan from Peru who specializes in silver and gemstone jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver, gemstones, and leather.

Adrian has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"In jewelry, I've found a medium of bodily expression. In the School of Fine Arts, I learned to express my ideas with a brush and oils. I can also do so through silver, gold and precious stones. I live in Peru doing what I love most, being passionate about jewelry. For me, each piece of jewelry is a work of art, and I'm a perfectionist as I create them. I hope all will enjoy the quality and design of my art."

"Many thanks to all of you. With this microcredit, I will be able to increase my inventory and design new pieces that hopefully will delight my customers."

Use the link below to view Adrian's silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/7520">http://www.novica.com/kiva/7520

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver, gemstones, and leather

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
SEYDOU est celui qui a la corne du bélier  sur la photo. C’est un commerçant d’ovin qui reside au Mali. Il est agé de 45 ans ,marié et père de 8 enfants dont  4 garçons et 2 filles scolarisés. Il fait cette activité de commerce d’ovin depuis à l’âge de 30 ans et son seul desir est de faire pour ses enfants tous ce qu’il faut pour qu’ils puissent étudier et un jour devenir des ministres, banquiers, ou avocats.
Son activité est d’acheter des bétails au marché  et les revendre parfois le même jour sur le même marché, parfois  l’engraisser pendant une semaine à un mois et revendre avec profit . Le profit de son commerce  lui permet  de payer tous les frais de scolarisation de ces enfants et leur habiller c’est pour cela qu’il sollicite d’  augmenter son capital et accroitre les profits.
texts.en:
Seydou is the one who is holding the ram's horn in the photo. He works selling livestock and lives in Mali. He is 45 years old, married, and the father of eight children. Four of the sons and two of the daughters go to school. 

Seydou has been selling livestock since he was 30 years old. He buys them at a market and then resells them. Sometimes he sells them the same day. Or sometimes he fattens them for between a week and a month and then resells them for a profit. 

Profits from this work allow him to pay his children's school fees and their clothing. It is for this reason that is he seeking to increase his capital and his profits.

loans.use: to buy sheep to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more maize and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy powdered soap, sugar, flour, beauty milk, etc.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Tha makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro is a Peruvian artisan who creates handcrafted sterling silver and gemstone jewelry alongside his family. Pictured here with his sister, Ruth, Teodoro would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones.

Teodoro has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"My artistic formation came from my dad during his work as an archaeologist in pre-Hispanic sites, and later as the curator of a museum. That's when I became inspired to craft jewelry with designs and motifs unique to ancient Peru. One of my most cherished moment was when I had a small workshop and my children, Carlos and Alicia, where with me while I was cutting gems by hand. Then we put them through a little machine to perfect the contours. I love the idea that foreigners can get to share part of our history through my designs, where I try to replicate both metals and gems."

"With this mircrocredit, my goal is to refresh my collection, which I hope will bring increased sales during the holiday season."
