Use the link below to view Teodoro's sterling silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/8651">http://www.novica.com/kiva/8651

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana, a sixty-six year old married woman with two grown children. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells merchandise such as soft drinks, powdered soap, shampoo, biscuits, chips, seasonings, and beverages.  
Aside from running a sari-sari store, she raises and sells hogs. She has been engaged in that kind of business for more than 10 years. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy assorted goods and feed for the pigs. With these resources, she could fill her store and be able to raise healthy hogs as well. It could attract more customers and generate more earnings. Thus, she would be able to pay her obligations and set aside some savings. 

She would like to manage both her businesses to be successful and productive.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Weya

texts.en:
Weya is 31 years old and married with two children, ages three and four years old. In 2012, Weya established her tailor shop, which includes a planting machine and zigzag machine business. She began her business because she learned tailoring when she was 18 years old. As a result, she decided to open a shop to increase her earnings and profits. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business.

Weya would like a SLL 5,000,000 loan to expand her business and purchase more African costumes like Ghana batik, Indian materials, gara materials, etc. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits and improve her business. In the future, Weya still plans to educate her children and build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more African costumes like Ghana batik, Indian materials, gara materials, etc.

loans.name: Lossi

texts.fr: Mère de sept  enfants, Lossi est une femme mariée de 59 ans qui habite à Baguida. Lossi est une commerçante de pagnes et de poissons fumés qui s’approvisionne au marché et le revend en se promenant dans les quartiers. Dans le souci d’élargir son commerce et de répondre aux attentes de ses clients, Lossi demande ce crédit pour commander des pagnes et des poissons afin de gagner plus de bénéfice et pouvoir subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mother of seven children, Lossi is a 59 year old married woman, who lives in Baguida. Lossi sells pagne (traditional cloth) and smoked fish. She resupplies at the market and resales her wares around the neighborhoods.

With the aim of growing her business and responding to her clients' expectations, Lossi is requesting this loan to order traditional cloth and fish in order to make a larger profit and to be able to meet the daily needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of fish and two cuts of pagne (traditional cloth).

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr: Yawavi est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans qui habite à Tokoin. Mère de trois enfants, Yawavi est une revendeuse de fruits qui s’approvisionne au marché deux  fois par mois. Yawavi revend ses marchandises à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Yawavi demande ce crédit pour commander des oranges, bananes et pommes en vue de maximiser son profit et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants grâce au gain qui en résultera.
texts.en:
Yawavi is 39 years old, married, and lives in Tokoin. A mother of three children, she works selling fruits, which she procures from a market twice a month. 

Yawavi resells her fruits from her home and in the surrounding areas.

She is seeking a loan to order oranges, bananas, and apples with the goal of maximizing her profits. Her children will be able to attend school thanks to these earnings.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of oranges, five trays of bananas, and one box of apples

loans.name: Nov's Group

texts.en: Nov’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Nov grows rice and works as a tailor to support her family. Villagers have no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en: Chanthou’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Chanthou grows rice and works as tailor to support her family.  Villagers have no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families,save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

texts.en: Mok’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Mok grows rice and is a tailor to support her family. Villagers have no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
JUANA DE 48 AÑOS DE EDAD, CASADA, ORIGINARIA DE MANAGUA CON DOS HIJOS UN MENOR DE EDAD  Y DOS MAYORES, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE LA COMPAÑÍA DE SUS HIJOS,  LUCHA DIA A DIA PARA MANTENER SU NEGOCIO Y SACAR ADELANTE A SU HIJO.
TIENEN POR  ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE MERCADERIA EN GENERAL COMO: ELETRODOMESTICOS, PLANCHAS, LICUADORAS, TELEVISORES, ABANICOS, TOSTADORAS, MICROHONDAS ETC . ELLA DEDICA UNAS DIE S HORAS DIRIAS A SU NEGOCIO, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN UN LUGAR ESPECIFICO DE UNOS DE LOS MERCADO DE LA LOCALIDAD. TIENE VEINTISIETE AÑOS DE TENER EL NEGOCIO  EL CUAL INICIO DEDES MUY JOVEN POR LA NECESIDAD DE TENER UN INGRESO ECONOMICA POR LA FALTA DE EMPLEOS FIJOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE ELETRODOMESTICOS PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. JUANA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Juana is 48 years old, married, and a Managua native. She has two children, one is a minor and the other is an adult. She is very hardworking, responsible, and has the desire for personal improvement. In her free time she enjoys spending time with her children. She strives everyday to maintain her business and support her son. 

Her economic activity involves selling general merchandise like appliances, irons, blenders, televisions, fans, toasters, microwaves, etc. She spends about ten hours a day on her business. Her shop is in a specific location in her town. She has had the business for 26 years, which she started when she was very young because she needed an income due to the lack of stable jobs.

Her goal for the loan is to invest in labor capital and to stock her shop by purchasing appliances so that in the near future she can obtain a better income. Juana is thankful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to have decent employment.

loans.use: to purchase appliances like: irons, blenders, televisions, fans, toasters, microwaves,  etc.

loans.name: Christine Mary

texts.en:
Christine, is a dedicated member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She considers CCT as God’s extension of blessing since the loan amount of 10,000 PHP that she applied for before was granted. Christine is grateful that the amount helped her buy additional products for her sari-sari store business. Sari-sari store is a Filipino word which means “variety” where customers can select a wide variety of choices for a cheaper price compared to supermarkets and other convenience stores. 

Christine aims to step up every year in the business. In the past six months she considers the business growing with God as her greatest provider. This year she wants to expand the business by adding additional products and stock so that customers will have a variety of choices. She wants the sari-sari store to become a one-stop-shop to customers. With this, Christine applied for another loan of 20,000 PHP to buy stocks of grocery items, sacks of rice, eggs and school supplies. 

Despite being busy managing the business, Christine is still consistent in attending CCT group fellowship that consists of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hears testimonies from other CCT partners and is able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy stocks of grocery items, sacks of rice, eggs and school supplies for her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 43-year-old married woman with two children. Both of her children are in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lorna has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 58 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned good, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future Rosita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
Richie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a natural medicines retail business and requests 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy natural medicines to resell.

She also has a bicycle taxi business.

Richie hopes to save enough money  to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines.

loans.name: Parbati Group

texts.en:
Parbati Self-Help Group was started in the year 2015 at Dengapadar village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. These are 11 active, self-dependent women, with an objective to develop their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the group members are from poor families. All the members of this group have their own professions and businesses.

Gita is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and the group members’ source of revenue improvement. She is standing as the third person from the right hand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 24 years old and living with her small family, her husband and only one son.

Gita has been engaged with vegetable cultivation and selling for the last five years. Her husband is also helping her in promoting the business. Through this business, she earns a monthly income of about 6,500 INR, which is just $100. Her opinion is that, from this small income, it is very difficult to maintain her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So, she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to access a loan for the expansion of her business.

She planned to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. for the vegetable cultivation business, as well as potatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, cauliflower, carrots, radishes, apples, bananas, etc. for her vegetables and fruits business. She hopes it will definitely improve her sales; she will get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for construction of her own house. She wishes to enroll her son in a public school for better education.

The other ten members of the group are also smart at their professions and also are actively engaged in different professions like a grocery shop, daily needs and cosmetics shop, rice business, tailoring business, hotel, cloth store, and milk business. With this loan, they also hope to make their livelihoods better.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. for vegetable cultivation, as well as potatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, cauliflower, carrots, radishes, apples, bananas, etc. for her vegetables and fruits business.

loans.name: Bas's Group

texts.en:
Bas’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Bas makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Alva Maria

texts.es:
ALVA DE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES ORIGINARIA DE MANAGUA, MADRE SOLTERA CON DOS HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, LOS CUALES ESTAN ESTUDIANDO, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER UNA MUJER RRESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, LUCHADORA, QUE NO LE DA MIEDO ENFRENTARSE AL CUALQUIER OBTACULO MATERIAL, SON SUS RETOS Y LUCHA, POR SACAR ADELANTE A  SUS HIJOS, Y BRINDARLES TODOS LAS OPORTUNIDADES QUE ELLOS MERECEN COMO  PERSONAS, AL IGUAL QUE SACAR ADELANTE SUS NEGOCIO HACERLO CRECER DIA A DIA POR LA PERSEVERANCIA QUE UNA DE SUS MAYORES CARACTERISTICAS,   Y DE ESA FORMA CUMPLIR CON SUS OBJETIVOS Y METAS A CORTO PLAZO.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE ROPA NUEVA EN UN LUGAR ESTABLECIDO DE SU COMUNIDAD, EL NEGOCIO LO INICIO DESDE HACE DIESCISIETE AÑOS DE FORMA AMBULANTE, HOY EN DIA A TRAVES DE SU EFUERZO Y SUS GANAS DE SUPERARSE HA PODIDO COMPRAR UN TRAMO EN UNOS DE LOS MERCADO DE LA LOCALIDAD, Y INCREMENTAR SUS MERCADERIA PARA SASTIFACER A SUS CLIENTELA Y LUCHA CON LA COMPETENCIA. SU RUTINA DE TRABAJO ES DE UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS C OMO: PANTALONES, JENS, BLUSAS, CAMISETAS, FALDAS, VESTIDOS, ROPA INTERIOR, ROPA DE CAMA, ROPA DE NIÑO ETC. EL OBJETIVO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES Y APROVECHAR LAS FIESTAS LOCALES, PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. ALVA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Alva is 40 years old and is originally from Managua.  She is a single mother with two younger children who are in school.  She characterizes herself as a responsible woman, with aspirations to better herself, and a fighter who has no fear confronting any material obstacle.  The challenges that she fights for are to provide a better life for her children and provide them the opportunities they deserve as people.  She also fights to move her business forward, and to make it grow every day through her perseverance, one of her strongest characteristics.  In this manner she will achieve her goals and objectives in the short term.

Due to her desire to better herself, she works in new clothes sales in an established venue in her community.  She began the business sixteen years ago as a street vendor.  Through her efforts and desires of succeeding, she was able to buy a stall in one of the markets in town, increase her merchandise to satisfy her customers, and fight the competition.  She works twelve hours every day, offering products such as pants, jeans, blouses, tee shirts, skirts, dresses, underwear, bedding, children's clothes, etc.

Her goal is to invest in work capital and stock her business though purchasing merchandise to meet the demands of her customers and take advantage of the local festivals, so that in the not too distant future she can increase her income.

Alva is grateful to the Kiva investors who offer a means of dignified work to people of scarce resources and from poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants, shorts, dresses, skirts, blouses, tee shirts, bedding, children's clothes and underwear.

loans.name: Juan Alejandro

texts.es:
Juan tiene 66 años de edad, es casado, sin hijos, vive en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidade se dedica mayormente al comercio, la ganaderia y agricultura.

Juan se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería agrícola, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio, solicita préstamo para compra de insumos agrícolas y para mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas de trabajo, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, tiene clientela fija quienes dan muy buenas referencias de él; y piensa mejorar su productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona, aumentando sus ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Alejandro is 66, married, without children. He lives with his family in a rural zone of Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru. His community's economy is based primarily on commerce, cattle, and agriculture. Juan makes his living offering day laboring services, relying on his own tools. He has more than 20 years of experience in this line of work.

He is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies and for the maintenance of equipment and tools. The investment would allow him to keep his tools and equipment in better condition. He has a loyal client base who give him many good references. He is thinking about improving the productivity of his services to be able to better attend the diverse needs of his clients in the area, increasing his income and improving his quality of life.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies and with the maintenance of equipment and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Bold-Erdene

texts.en: Mr. Bold-Erdene is 39 years old and lives with his wife and parents in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2004. Before this, his family used to live in the countryside and raised livestock. His parents have both retired from work and receive state pensions. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home taking care of house chores. He has used his previous loans for various purposes such as opening a grocery store and buying an environmentally friendly car. Now he is requesting a loan of 1600 USD to buy building materials such as cement, planks and fiberglass in order to renovate his house. By doing so, it will enable his family to live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Jenerlita

texts.en:
Jenerlita is 49 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jenerlita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Jenerlita has been raising pigs for twelve years and also earns additional income from manicure services.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.en:
Juan Ramon is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in hand-carved wood sculptures. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood.

Juan Ramon has been selling through NOVICA since 2014. This is his story:

"I've always enjoyed working with wood, as a kid in school it was my favorite craft. This passion continued when I studied architecture, especially when planning the models. Can you guess which one was my favorite? Yes, of course, wood! Why do I tell you all of this? Well, because that's how I came to realize that wood and I have always gotten along really well. I believe it is innate in me. Most of my inspiration comes from the Maya culture and I try to use wood as a medium to convey the greatness of the Maya and their relevance. It's so important for humanity to know about the Mayas, their charm, their discoveries and their mysteries!"

"Many thanks, my friends. This microcredit provides a great incentive to continue investing in my craft, which allows people around the world to come to know and appreciate the beauty of the Mayan culture."

Use the link below to view Juan Ramon's hand-carved wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/9297

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood

texts.en: Florida is a mother of two school-age children. She has worked as a transportation operator with her husband for the past eight years. Her business involves motor transportation or hire or public transport. She does this work to support her children. She asked for a loan to purchase a slightly used motorcycle for her transportation business. Owning another motorcycle will increase her income and would help support the needs of her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Annalie dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leoncia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Leoncia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed like flour, sugar, etc.

Lilia has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

Luisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, condiments, junk food, home care products, and other items.

Luisa has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Luisa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Elenita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Elenita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Elenita has been in this business for 30 years. Elenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Phyyas' Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Pursat province, Phyyas, 32, is married and is blessed with two children who are both in school. To earn an income for her family, she has been growing rice for the past fourteen years. She also fishes to earn extra money.

Drought has impacted Phyyas’ rice crop, and the price for fish has gone down. These two problems have led to her lack of working capital.

Phyyas is now the leader of this three-member group. She has applied for a 4,200,000 KHR loan through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Cambodia, which will be the first time she has taken out a loan. She will use her portion of it to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase her crop yields.

Phyyas hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income so that she can improve the family’s living conditions and make her businesses more robust.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase her crop yields.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed to improve her rice farmland to produce a good yield.

Elina has operated her variety store for almost three years. The generated income from her variety store has been used for her direct selling and farming businesses.

She is happily married with one child.

She is asking for additional capital amounting to PHP 25,000. Elina plans to purchase more stock of shoes, slippers, sandals, gasoline and grocery items to keep her variety store and direct selling businesses profitable and a stable source of income.

She knows that having this loan will enable her to obtain better income and satisfy her customer's demands.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Riza has been in this business for three years. In the future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn is a 38-year-old married mother of eight children, six in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Erlyn has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Erlyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional charcoal to sell.

Erlyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Erlyn would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married, 47 years old and has two children, both in school.

Angelina is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Angelina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Angelina has been farming for 20 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Angelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 53-year-old married mother of four children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. C

Carmelita has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy nipa leaves and other supplies needed for her business.

Carmelita has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves and other supplies needed for her business

loans.name: Bhajanananada

texts.en:
Bhajanananada, 48, is a differently abled person from a small village in the Cuttack district. He is married and is blessed with three beautiful children.

He has owned a grocery shop for the past five years and his wife works as a mason in the locality. The earnings of Bhajanananada and his wife are used to meet the daily expenses as well as to pay the educational expenses of his three children.

He is requesting a loan of 35,000 INR to add more stocks for his grocery store like soaps, shampoos, detergents, food grains, jams, pickles, beverages, sanitizers, etc. Increase in the inventory level will help in boosting his sales and thus increasing the cash flow.

Bhajanananada is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to add more stocks for his grocery store.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun’s group lives in a rural village in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. Oun makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en: Phan, 52, is a resident living in Kampong Cham province and a mother of six children. She earns income to improve her family’s living standard by rice cropping and selling cucumbers to get additional income. The price of rice is lower than before and this is her main challenge. She has been involved in her business for 35 years. She can save from her daily income about 30,700 KHR per day. This is her first micro loan with VisonFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four members, she is the group leader. She will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide to support her rice farming and increase her crop yield. She hopes that she can get more income from her crops to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide to support her rice farming and increase her crop yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Ly’s group is made up of three women who live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Ly makes a living growing rice and also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In the village where she lives, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, and save money on medical expenses and time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es:
ANGELA DE MANAGUA, CASADA, CON TRES HIJOS,  DOS MENORES LOS CUALES ESTAN BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, EL MAYOR TRABAJA, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, PERSEVERANTE, LUCHADORA, TENAS, CON GANAS DE SACAR ADELANTE A SUS NEGOCIO Y FAMILIAS.  EN LA VIDA SE HA PROPUESTO METAS Y OBJETIVOS. 
GRACIAS A SU PERSEVERANCIA SE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UNA PULPERIA DESDE HACE DIES AÑOS QUE SE DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION,  EL CUAL CONSISTE EN VEDER PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZUCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, DETERGENTE, QUESO, FOSFOROS, HIELO, VERDURAS, JUGOS, GALLETAS, ETC.  EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO CONSISTE EN INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. ANGELA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA  PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Angela is from Managua. She is married and has three children, two of whom are young and still live with her. Her oldest works and lives on his own. She is hardworking, persevering, tenacious, and driven to get ahead with her business as well as her family. She has set goals and aims for herself in life.

She has been running a grocery store for ten years. It is located in her home. She sells groceries like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, cheese, matches, ice, vegetables, juice, cookies, etc. She will use this loan to invest in working capital and stock up on groceries for her business in order to be able to increase her income in the near future. 

Angela wants to thank Kiva lenders for the support they give to low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua for them to be able to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergents, juice, etc.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El socio Víctor pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.
 El socio sigue  dedicándose a ejercer su carrera de contabilidad, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio continua trabajando el cual le va bien y le trae satisfacciones personales, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de escritorio entre otros.
El socio Víctor está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor belongs to the "Cusco Sur" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. He still makes a living as an accountant. He is a responsible and hard-working person. He continues to work in his job, which is going very well and makes him feel fulfilled. He wants to be able to keep working so that he can support his family.

Víctor is grateful for the loan and is committed to making his loan repayments on time. He is requesting the loan to buy stationery and other items. He is very grateful to Kiva for allowing him to stay in his occupation supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy stationery and other items.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a dedicated member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She’s blessed that her previous loan of P10, 000 was granted, which was used as added capital for the business. Currently, she’s managing a sari-sari store, a Filipino word which means “variety” where it’s somehow similar to a convenience store, but it has grills instead of walls or glass where the items are being displayed and products are measured by kilos, pieces and volumes.

Dina aims to have a one one-stop-shop where she can offer products on demand and complete items. She also dreams of expanding the business. However, most of her customers are her neighbors, that’s why she can not avoid lending products. To compensate, Dina decided to apply for another loan of P10, 000 this year to add stocks of items such as: bottled drinks, school supplies and grocery items. Dina is hopeful that CCT will once more grant her request for her business to have a wide variety of choices.

Dina is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: To add stocks of items such as: bottled drinks, school supplies and grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en: Aurelio is 78 years old, a widow and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is a retired government employee and has relied on his monthly pension and rice production activity. Aurelio is also a member of Paglaum MPC with no prior records of default payments. This time, he asks for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to purchase maintenance medicine.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicine

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 35 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Rosie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, noodles, home care products, and other items.

Rosie has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, noodles, home care products, and other items

loans.name: Luvizminda

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of ten children, Luvizminda works hard to support her family.

She has a tobacco retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Luvizminda is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy more tobacco to resell.

Luvizminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco to resell.

loans.name: Ma.rhoda

texts.en:
Ma.Rhoda is 37 years old and married with eight children. Ma.Rhoda works very hard to provide for them.

Ma.Rhoda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products, junk food, school supplies, and other items.

Ma.Rhoda has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Ma.Rhoda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal care products, junk food, school supplies, and other items

loans.name: Bublen Group

texts.en:
Bublen Group was started in the year 2011 at Tentulikhunti village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. There are 11 active self-dependent women, with the objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses.

Rebati is one of them who taken a great role for her development and their group members’ source of revenue improvement. She is standing as the third person from the right hand side with raised hand in the photo. She is about 41 years old and living with her small family, her husband and two sons.

Rebati has been engaged in a tailoring shop beside her own home in Tentulikhunti for the last eight years. Her husband is also helping her to promote the shop. Through the concerned business, she earns a monthly income of 9,000 INR. Her opinion is that from this small income it is very difficult to maintain her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible.

In the current market situation, the competition is also very high. Another big investment is necessary for the expansion of business. Fund scarcity is the main concern. So she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to avail a loan for the expansion of her business. It will be their fourth loan cycle.

Rebati planned to purchase four tailoring machines and a Pico machine. She will also appoint two employees to make dresses so as to meet the demands of customers. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for re-construction of her house.

The other ten members of the group are also smart at their professions and also actively engaged with different professions like vegetable cultivation, vegetable vending, animal trading, grocery shop, etc. With this loan, they hope to boost their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase four tailoring machines and a Pico machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron, and to pay for labor to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Kulzhakan

texts.ru: Кулжакан, 60 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее среднее образование. В качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается сельским хозяйством. У Кулжакан в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 10 овец, 2 лошади. На земельном участке мерою 2,59 ГА она выращивает фасоль. Продает экологически-чистое молоко. Заготавливает овощи и фрукты летом с целью продажи в зимний период. Кулжакан известна, как добрый, ответственный, жизнерадостный человек. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулжакан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации молока, часть средств направит на сбор и заготовку картофеля и клубники под реализацию. Доходы от кредита Кулжакан планирует использовать для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Kulzhakan is 60 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She has a high school education. To earn income for her family she farms. Currently she owns three cows, ten sheep, and two horses, and raises beans on 2.59 hectares. She also sells organic milk, and in the summer stores vegetables and fruit which she can then sell during winter. Kulzhakan is known as a good, responsible, and joyful person. To further develop her business Kulzhakan came to the Bai-Tushum bank for a 150,000 som (KGS) loan to buy two dairy cows to increase the amount of milk she can sell. Part of the money will also go to harvesting and preparing potatoes and strawberries for sale. She plans to reinvest proceeds from use of the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows to increase her volume of organic milk sales, and to harvest and prepare potatoes and strawberries for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invsest in an electroporator and a high-frequency sonic peeler.

loans.name: Ikatu Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado IKATU está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres integrado por 21 mujeres todos ellas vecinas y amigas que hacen de todo para poder ayudar a su familia.
Paola es una de las integrantes de este grupo, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo y comenta que su trabajo es sacrificado ya que busca poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Está esforzándose para poder crecer y salir adelante y comenta que a través de su grupo quiere lograrlo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y otras prendas, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo y ayudar así a su familia. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called IKATU is in its second cycle of the women’s committee program, consisting of 21 women, all of whom are neighbors and friends that do whatever it takes to help their families. 
Paola is one of the members of the group who is dedicated to selling all types of clothing. She comments that her work is demanding since she seeks to help her family through her job. She is doing her best to grow and progress and comments that through this group she wants to achieve that. 
She requests this loan to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, and other articles of clothing in order to continue with her sales as she has been doing and to help her family. She is grateful for this opportunity that she receives to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing to sell, such as: t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more shirts and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, biscuits and soap to resell.

loans.name: Jyambere Cb Sub Group B

texts.en: Carine is the group leader. and she is 27 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 3 and 5 years. The group is called JYAMBERE which means “GO AHEAD” in English. The members of the group sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses to give themselves a better future. Carine owns a bar and has been running this business for 4 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to increase the volume of organic milk sales and to purchase 10 sheep

loans.name: Hilda Maria

texts.es: Hilda, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio  de Gracias, Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, lleva varios años de tener su propia finca de café que es su fuente de ingresos para la familia. Para seguir dándole mantenimiento ha decidido solicitar otro prestamo con la institución y es por 9,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizar la finca de café. Ella espera obtener mejor cosecha y poder mejorar su casa en su futuro.
texts.en: Hilda is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a village in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. She has always made a living from agriculture, and has had her own farm for a number of years, which is her family's source of income. In order to keep looking after her crops, she has decided to request another loan of 9,000 lempiras from the institution to buy compost and fertilise her coffee farm. She hopes to achieve a better harvest and make improvements to her home in the future.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilise her coffee farm.

loans.name: Rosa Esthela

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, estudió hasta el sexto grado de educación básica, ahora está casada y su esposo se dedica  la agricultura, viven con sus 3 hijos y nietos. 

Rosa tiene una mini tienda como negocio, en el cual tiene un año de haber comenzado esta experiencia, decidió dedicarse a esto cuando en la empresa donde ella trabajaba hubo recorte de personal y ella fue una de las que quedó desempleadas, su hija menor es quien le ayuda  a Rosa a atender la tienda.


Este préstamo lo necesita para comprar más mercadería como productos alimenticios, golosinas, bebidas, productos de limpieza, etc. para su tienda.

Ella tiene entre sus planes darles buen servicio a sus clientes y tener la mayor cantidad de productos disponibles para ofertar y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos al núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45. She studied until grade 6. She is now married to a farmer. They live with their three children and grandchildren.
Rosa has a small store which she started a year ago. She decided to do this when the business that she worked for cut back on staff and she was left unemployed. Her youngest daughter helps her with the store.
She needs this loan to purchase more merchandise such as food, candy, drinks, and cleaning products for her store.
Among her plans, she plans to provide good customer service and have a greater amount of products on offer. This way, she will have more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as food, candy, drinks, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es: Doña Maria, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de las Flores Lempira. Doña Maria lleva 10 años de tener su propia pulpería para vender productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, manteca, churros, refrescos, harina, café, pan, y otros abarrotes. El prestamo que solicita es el séptimo ciclo con la institución y es por 25,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar mas granos básicos, refrescos, manteca, churros, dulces, galletas, productos de limpieza y otros que necesite. Esta inversión le ayudará a incrementar el inventario y ofrecer más productos. Su meta a futuro es poder hacer un local aparte de su casa para establecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is 52 years old. She is a single mother of two children and lives in a village in the municipality of Las Flores, Lempira. Maria has had her own grocery store for 10 years, selling foodstuufs such as rice, beans, butter, churros, soft drinks, flour, coffee, bread and other groceries. 

The loan she is requesting is her seventh cycle with the institution and is for the amount of 25,000 lempiras, which she is going to use to buy more basic grains, soft drinks, butter, churros, sweets, biscuits, cleaning products and other items she needs. This investment will help her to increase her stock and offer a wider variety of products Her future goal is to have a separate premises away from her home to set up the business.

loans.use: to buy more basic grains, soft drinks, butter, churros, sweets, biscuits, cleaning products and other items she needs.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una gran muchacha tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y vive por y para sus sueños, es emprendedora, eficaz, entusiasta con cada cosa que realiza, Manuela desde hace varios años se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica con el que obtiene sus ingresos y con ello logro efectuar sus pagos con el préstamo anterior, ella con sus ganas de superación ha alcanzado sus objetivos pues anteriormente tuvo la oportunidad de comprar media cuerda de terreno que con mucho sacrificio pudo comprar y lo realizo con el apoyo que  recibió del crédito, por lo que hasta ahora tiene más terreno donde cultiva café y banano, con este avance Manuela se encuentra satisfecha mas no conforme porque tiene el anhelo de seguir incrementado su cultivo a raíz de esta meta solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar una cuerda de terreno donde ella piensa seguir cultivando.
Manuela sigue soñando en grande y espera construir su casa de terraza e instalar una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Manuela is a great 29 year old girl. She is single and lives for her dreams. She is an entrepreneur, effective, and enthusiastic in everything that she does. For many years she has been making clothes that are typical of the region, which gives her an income and allowed to her to pay off previous loans. With her desire to excel, she has reached her goals because she previously had the opportunity to buy half a block of land with a lot of sacrifice and support from the loan. So far she has more land where she grows coffee and banana plants. With this progress, Manuela feels satisfied but she does not conform because she has the desire to keep increasing her crops. Following this goal, she is asking for a new loan to buy a block of land where she thinks to keep cultivating. Manuela continues to dream big and she hopes to build her terrace house and set up a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy a block of land to cultivate.

loans.name: Bonis Fiorela

texts.es: Bonis es una mujer trabajadora de 42 años de edad que todos los días pone todo su esfuerzo para salir adelante, apoyada en su trabajo como dependiente de tienda, pero además esta laboriosa mujer en sus días libres vende medicina y vitaminas, para lo cual ya cuenta con una cartera de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Bonis vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas la mayor le apoya con los gastos del hogar y la menor desea seguir estudiando la universidad y es por ello el esfuerzo de Bonis. Ella desea invertir en más vitaminas, ya que actualmente solo trabaja por encargo pero ella desea tener para ofrecer a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: vitaminas para el cerebro, para el apetito, entre otras para apoyar a su hija en los estudios.
texts.en:
Bonis is a hard working 42 year old woman who every day puts all her efforts into getting by, supported by her work as a shop assistant. This industrious woman also sells medicine and vitamins on her days off and already has a group of clients that buy her products.  

Bonis lives in her own home together with her partner and two daughters.  The oldest daughter helps out with covering the household expenses and the youngest wants to continue studying at university, this is why Bonis is working hard. 

She wants to buy more vitamins because she wants to sell directly to her clients as she currently only orders stock for each sale. So, she is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy: vitamins for the brain, the appetite and other things in order to support her daughter's studies.

loans.use: to buy: vitamins for the brain, the appetite and other things in order to support her daughter's studies.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Imagine investing in a venture and reaping nothing at the end of the day. This is the sad story of Jacob, a youthful 39-year-old Mzee (old man), a wise farmer whose neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. He farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills near Kitale, in the northern Rift Valley region of Kenya. Jacob's farming experience dates back to 2000.

Like many other farmers in the region, maize is a staple crop which he has been planting for as long as he can remember.He also does dairy farming. With time, the fertility of his land has started to dwindle and whenever he plants maize the yields go down with each cropping season. Jacob has also been affected with weeds. At some point he could not be assured of harvesting anything at all.

Today, Jacob is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy fertilizers, pesticides and good quality seeds. Through this loan Jacob is going to increase his crop production and this will translate to an improved income level. This loan will permanently change the living standards of Jacob; there is no doubt that you can find rewarding employment in farming.

Change the life of this farmer, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and good quality seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, gravel, and sand to finish the exterior walls of her house and repair the bathroom.

loans.name: Nkomezi Group

texts.fr:
Anaclet fait partie du groupe Nkomezi  et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a  60 ans et est marié  à Véronique, une cultivatrice. 

Il fait le commerce de bananes depuis 5 ans. 

Il est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Anaclet is part of the Nkomezi Group and lives in Gitega. He is 60 years old and is married to Véronique, a farmer.

He has been selling bananas for five years.

He is on his fifth loan with Turame. With the loan that he receives from Kiva, he will increase his capital and buy a large amount of bananas in order to resell them to earn more money.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large amount of bananas in order to resell them to earn more money.

loans.name: Monica Patricia

texts.es:
Mónica es una mujer de 36 años de edad, que se dedica al alquiler de lavadoras, una actividad que ha venido desempeñando hace un año y que inicio por necesidad económica ya que asumió las riendas financieras de su hogar puesto que se separó de su pareja.

Esta trabajadora y sorprendente mujer no le quedó grande esta labor, con su profesión ha solventado sus necesidades económicas y ahora quiere progresar y demostrar de lo que está hecha, es por ello que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un carreta para desplazar sus lavadoras con mayor facilidad, ya que sus hijos están empezando a trabajar para ayudarle económicamente y le queda muy difícil cargar las lavadoras.

Con la ayuda de este préstamo una empresaria tendrá una herramienta de transporte muy útil para su negocio, anímate y apóyala con un préstamo.
texts.en:
Mónica is a 36-year-old woman, who works renting washing machines, a job that she has been doing for a year and that she began due to economic need since she took over the financial reins of the household when she separated from her partner. 

To this hard-working and surprising woman, this job was not too big. With her profession, she has covered her economic needs and now wants to progress and show what she is made of. So, she asks for a loan to purchase a cart to carry her washing machines more easily, since her children are beginning to work to help her economically and it is very difficult for her to carry the washing machines. 

With the help of this loan, a businesswoman will have a very useful transportation tool for her business. Go ahead and support her with a loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cart to carry the washing machines to their destinations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to boost his retail trade business.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia es una señora trabajadora que vive con su esposo que trabaja de chofer y sus 4 hijas de 17, 13, 7 y 5 años que se encuentran estudiando, Cecilia se dedica al comercio de edredones,  cobijas y ropa de puerta en puerta y sobre todo a sus amigas y familiares, Cecilia el crédito lo va a utilizar comprando mercadería en cobijas y edredones, Cecilia del negocio  espera mejorar sus ingresos y que no le haga falta el dinero para los gastos de educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking woman who lives with her husband, who works as a driver, and her four daughters aged 17, 13, 7 and 5, who are students. Cecilia makes a living selling duvets, blankets and clothing from door to door, mainly to her friends and family members. 

Cecilia is going to use the loan to buy blankets and duvets. Cecilia hopes to improve her business income, so that she has enough money to pay for her children's education costs.

loans.use: to buy blankets and clothing.

loans.name: Nirupama

texts.en:
Nirupama, age 38 years, is an unmarried and differently abled lady from a small village of Khurda district, Odisha, India. She lives with her elder brother and sister-in-law in their house.

For the last five years, she has been engaged in weaving clothes. She has inherited this from her ancestors, as this was her family business. She earns a pretty good amount of money from this business and has a very large customer base. Nirupama is a very ambitious lady who has never looked back. Her high aspirations and dreams have always helped her in moving forward in life, overcoming all the hurdles.

She is requesting a loan amount of 25,000 INR to repair her weaving machine, which is not working properly and is causing delay in processing her orders. The other part of the loan amount will be used to purchase raw materials for her weaving business like colourful thread, ribbons, needles, etc.

Nirupama dreams to open a boutique someday and attract the attention of premium segments of customers.

loans.use: to repair her weaving machine and to purchase raw materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Nomsa

texts.en:
Nomsa is a 47-year-old mother of five. She rents rooms in her backyard. She is hardworking and has managed to save enough money to upgrade the rooms from tin shacks to a concrete structure. However, she ran out of money before finishing the concrete room and is requesting a loan to complete the structure.

With a Kiva loan, Nomsa will be able to buy two steel doors, iron sheets and paint. She will also pay for the installation of these things and painting.

"I want to buy land and build many rooms for rent," says Nomsa when asked about her plans for the future.

loans.use: to buy two steel doors, iron sheets and paint.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more telephone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is a permanent resident of Kyebando- Kikaya zone, Kampala. She is a single mother with three children. She operates a cosmetics and salon business in Kampala town. She uses this business as her main source of income to cater for her family, paying school fees for the children.

Milly wants to boost her business by borrowing UGX 500,000. She is a repeat borrower from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited. She has got a high number of customers and she needs more cosmetics to meet their demands and now has opted to borrow a small loan that will help her to buy stock of cosmetics for her business.

She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy stock of cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Nerio

texts.en:
Nerio is a 45-year-old man from Bohol, Philippines. He is married and has four children. Two of his children are still attending school, and are 18 and 16 years old. 

Nerio is a fisherman and has been engaged in selling fish for 20 years. His wife is also a vendor and they work together for their family. 

Nerio is requesting a loan of PHP 10000 to buy more fish to sell. He also needs to buy foam (used for storing fish) and plastic bags (used in selling). In the future, he wishes to expand his business to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: buy fish & storage supplies

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma is 43 years old and four of her children are in school.

Emma has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Emma has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy food ingredients

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Erlinda is 57 years old now.

Erlinda has a buy and sell beverages business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of beverages to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy beverages

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 49 years old and has nine children. She is married and has six children who are in school.

Consolacion is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Consolacion has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy pig feed & vitamins

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Mary Jean works hard to support her family.  She has a general store business in the Philippines. Mary Jean is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Mary Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a 40-year-old, smallholder farmer based in Kericho, which is a small agricultural center near the famous Rift Valley escarpment. He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely wife, and they have been blessed with six children. On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for five years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. They recently ventured into a small side hustle business.

From Kiva lenders, Alexander is seeking a loan worth KES 20,000 to buy seeds and grow his horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector.

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford Alexander access to a loan facility that will aid him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Alexander’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano, con el crédito anterior obtuvo una cosecha de granos básicos muy abundante y sin problemas de plagas, tiene estabilidad económica y ha podido iniciar la venta de helados para tener otros ingresos. 
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas con los que podrá realizar la siembra de granos básicos, además invertirá un poco en cajas de sorbete, fortalecerá su negocio para ir teniendo ingresos con los que cumplirá con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
With his previous loan, Mariano obtained a very plentiful harvest and had no problems with pests. He has financial stability and was able to start selling ice cream in order to make some extra income.
 
He is requesting a new loan to buy farm supplies in order to start a new crop of basic grains. He will also invest a small portion in cases of sorbet. He will strengthen his business in order to make enough income to meet his obligations.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Halina

texts.en:
Halina is 33 years old, married, and has two children who are both in school.

Halina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Halina requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Halina has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy pig feed & vitamins

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Erlinda is 40 years old and two of her children are in school.

Erlinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Erlinda has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: buy food ingredients

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 54 years old and has six children, three of them are in school. 

Leah is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Leah requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.  Leah has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy livestock feeds, vitamins & supplies

loans.name: Erlinda Maribel

texts.es:
Erlinda, de 67 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, tuvo 6 hijos pero todos tienen sus propios hogares, en casa de Erlinda solo viven cuatro nietos de ella.

Erlinda, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 26 años, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres, quienes desde muy pequeña le enseñaron todo acerca de la agricultura, porque era la única forma en que podían trabajar.- Además de la agricultura Erlinda, se encarga de los oficios domésticos de su hogar y a la venta de leche y queso; para desempeñar su trabajo recorre aproximadamente 6 cuadras al día para distribuir el producto y su horario de trabajo es 4 horas al día. 

A ella anteriormente se le otorgó un préstamo para comprar una vaquilla y en esta ocasión está solicitando otro préstamo para comprar dos vaquillas, para mejorar el ingreso de la venta de lácteos. 

Los sueños que Erlinda tiene son ayudar a sus hijos hasta donde pueda y darles la oportunidad a sus nietos para que estudien en la universidad la carrera que más les guste.
texts.en:
Erlinda is 67 years old and went to school until the 5th grade. She six children but they all have their own homes. Only four of her grandchildren live at home with her. 

Erlinda has been working in agriculture for 26 years. She learned this business from her parents who, from a young age, taught her everything about agriculture because it was the only way in which they could work. Besides agriculture, Erlinda is responsible for her household chores and selling milk and cheese. To do her work, she covers about six blocks a day to distribute the product. Her work schedule is four hours a day. 

She was previously given a loan to buy a heifer and this time she is requesting another loan to buy two heifers to improve the income from her sale of dairy products. Erlinda's dreams are to help her children as much as she can and to give her grandchildren the opportunity to study what they like most in college.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba Luz vive con sus 4 hijos, Alba Luz trabaja a diario junto con sus hijas e hijos para salir adelante, ellos se dedican a la producción de café bajo distintos sellos de certificación como ser: Comercio Justo y Rain Forest. Alba Luz tiene más de 20 años de producir café y cada día ponen en práctica nuevas técnicas para hacer el cultivo más sostenible y rentable. Ella sueña con poder darle a sus hijos un buen futuro y Alba Luz dice: “Me gustaría seguir poniendo en práctica nuevas técnicas para mejorar la calidad de mi cafe y cuidar la tierra de la cual dependemos” es por eso que Alba Luz quiere certificar sus fincas bajo el sello de certificación orgánica.
La producción de café orgánico es una novedad en la región ya que no solo permite tener mejores precios por el café también ayuda a no contaminar las numerosas fuentes de agua de la zona. 
Alba Luz solicita un crédito para convertir sus cafetales a producción orgánica y aprovechando que las condiciones de su cafetal no son las mejores la decisión es replantar el cafetal e iniciar la certificación desde 0 con las ganancias obtenidas por su café Alba Luz piensa darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y formar un pequeño patrimonio para sus hijos y nietos.
Un crédito ayudara a Alba Luz a mejorar la sostenibilidad de su cafetal y tener mejores mercados para el producto y por lo tanto poder mejorar su calidad de vida y hacer crecer un poco el patrimonio de la familia.
texts.en:
Alba Luz lives with her 4 children. Alba Luz works daily with her daughters and sons to get ahead. They work producing coffee under different certification stamps such as Fair Trade and Rain Forest. Alba Luz has been growing coffee for more than 20 years and day by day they put new techniques into practice to make the crop more sustainable and profitable. She dreams of being able to give her children a good future and Alba Luz says, "I would like to continue putting new techniques into practice to improve the quality of my coffee and care for the land on which we depend." For this reason, Alba Luz wants to certify her farms under the organic certification stamp.

Organic coffee production is of interest in the region because it not only permits having better prices for the coffee but also helps to not contaminate the numerous sources of water in the zone.

Alba Luz asks for a loan to convert her coffee crops to organic production and, taking advantage of the condition of her coffee crops which is not the best, the decision is to replant the coffee crops and begin the certification from scratch. With the earnings gotten from her coffee, Alba Luz plans to give her family a better quality of life and to create a small legacy for her children and grandchildren.

A loan will help Alba Luz to improve the sustainability of her coffee crops and to have better markets for her product and, so, to be able to improve her quality of life and grow the family's legacy a bit.

loans.use: to purchase organic coffee plants, organic manure, organic insecticides and pesticides and other materials needed to convert her coffee plantation to organic.

loans.name: Pon's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Cham province, Pon is 46-year-old and a mother of three dependent children. Her main sources of her income are from rice farming and boat making. Her rice did not grow well and this is her main challenge in earning income to support her family. 

Pon has been involved her farming for 26 years. For Pon, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of seven to seek for a new loan with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and diesel to support on her rice farm to get good yield. She hopes that this loan can help her farm to produce more yields, so she can increase her family’s income to improve her family living condition.

loans.use: buy fertilizer & fuel

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Aged 45 years, Sopheap is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living through farming rice and selling grocery items. Moreover, she can get additional income via pig raising. She can save from her daily income about 31,000 KHR per day.

For Sopheap, this is her first micro loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four, she is the group leader. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and diesel to support on her farmland and increase her crop yield.  Her rice is not growing well because of drought.  She hopes that she can gain more yields from her rice farming than last year.

loans.use: buy fertilizer & fuel

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Grupo Las Cruces El Camino Group

texts.es:
Aracely es una mujer casada de 25 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 9 años que actualmente se encuentra estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad, ellos viven en la comunidad llamada Cantón las Cruces.
Aracely (la primera del lado derecho de la foto de blusa rosada)  por tener la satisfacción de apoyar a su honorable familia, desde hace dos años decidió elegir una actividad que le generara ganancias y así apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, fue así como empezó su negocio de compra y venta de abarrotes, pero ella también se dio cuenta que instalar un molino de nixtamal era muy fundamental pues la gente de su comunidad tenía que recorrer largos kilómetros para adquirir este servicio, gracias a estos dos tipos de negocio contribuye al sustento de su familia. Su amabilidad, respeto y carisma con la gente lo ha ayudado a ser una de las mejores tiendas de abarrotes, y para poder seguir brindando buenos servicios ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos de abarrotes como; gaseosas, golosinas, azúcar, frijol entre otros. Aracely espera seguir superándose para comprar una cuerda de terreno donde su hijo pueda algún día construir su casa.
texts.en:
Aracely is a 25-year-old married woman with a 9-year-old son who is a pupil at the local school. They live in a community called Cantón las Cruces. To have the satisfaction of supporting her honoured family, two years ago, Aracely (on the left of the photo wearing a pink top) decided to choose an activity that would generate earnings and in this way, help her husband out with the household expenses. This is how she began her business buying and selling groceries.

However, she also realised that installing a cornflour mill was vital because the people in her community had to travel large distances to obtain this service. Thanks to these two businesses, she contributes to her family's livelihood. 

Her kindness, respect and charisma with people has helped her to create one of the best grocery stores. To continue providing good services, she is requesting a loan to buy groceries such as fizzy drinks, sweets, sugar, beans and other items. Aracely hopes to continue improving so that she can buy a tract of land on which her son can one day build his home.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as fizzy drinks, sweets, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Carline

texts.fr: Carline est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et a deux enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une petite boutique de vente de boissons gazeuses. Elle a pris contact avec Palmis Mikwofinans Sosyal pour obtenir un appui pour développer son activité. Elle a déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits et jouit d’une bonne réputation pour son respect à l’égard de son engagement dans le crédit. Maintenant, elle sollicite un nouveau microcrédit pour diversifier son stock. Elle souhaite donc ajouter du riz par sac et de l'huile par gallon à sa boutique.
texts.en:
Carline is 35 years old. She is married and has two children. She owns a small shop and sells carbonated drinks.

She made contact with Palmis Mikwofinans Sosyal, because she wanted support to develop her business. She has already benefited from five loans, and she has a good reputation for respecting the commitment of borrowing.

Now, she is seeking a new loan to diversify her stock. Her plan is to add sacks of rice and oil by the gallon to her shop.

loans.use: to buy rice and oil

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
To earn a living, Prudencia is engaged in selling fish. She has been doing this business for 20 years.

Prudencia is a 61-year-old woman who dreams to increase her livelihood for her family. She dreams to have a better life in the future. She has raised three children that are already grown up.

Her husband is a fisherman and works hard for their daily needs. Thus, Prudencia is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Candida works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Candida is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business and for her food vending business.

Candida has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Willman Jose

texts.es:
Siempre es importante Innovar y mostrar algo diferente a la comunidad, Willman ha tratado de seguir los caminos de su tío quien se dedica a prestar los servicios de mecánica en una zona como Sahagún que se caracteriza por la agricultura y la cría de animales.

Willman es padre de dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad, realiza su profesión para generar recursos para la alimentación, estudio y vivienda de los muchachos y en parte para darles ejemplo de que estudien y trabajen en la profesión que deseen, que rompan paradigmas.

Su profesión la ejerce 6 días a la semana con una intensidad de 12 horas diarias, ya que busca mejorar sus ventas, hacerse conocer en el pueblo y fidelizar clientes.

Willman se encuentra gestionando un apoyo económico para invertirlo en la compra de herramienta que necesita para su taller, como lo son un taladro, pulidora, herramienta de mano y cortadora de baldosa.
texts.en:
It is always important to innovate and show something different to the community. Willman has tried to follow his uncle's path who worked providing mechanical services in a zone such as Sahagún, which is known for agriculture and raising animals. 

Willman is the father of two children, ages 8 and 2, and works in his profession to generate resources for food, education and housing for his children and, in part, to give them an example of studying and working in the profession that they want, to break paradigms.

He works at his profession 6 days a week with an intensity of 12 hours each day, since he seeks to improve his sales, be known in the town and create loyal customers.

Willman is asking for a loan to invest it in the tools that he needs for his shop, such as a drill, a polishing machine, hand tools and a tile cutter.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for his shop such as a drill, a polishing machine, hand tools and a tile cutter.

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es:
Ana es una señora soltera con 37 años de edad, madre de cuatro hijos con 8,10, 13 y 15 años de edad, trabajadora y muy humilde, dedicada a la preparación de comidas , un negocio que inicio desde hace poco y del cual dependen sus pequeños, con esto logro salir de una crisis económica la cual vivió luego de separarse de su esposo, quien era el sostén del hogar.
