This form of work helps her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is single and lives with her child.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the teaching that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 63 years old and married with one child. Trinidad works very hard to provide for them.

Trinidad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, noodles, junk foods, and other groceries.

Trinidad has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Trinidad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, noodles, junk foods, and other groceries

loans.name: Ronal

texts.es:
Ronal es un joven estudiante de SENATI que estudia la Carrera de Técnico en Ingeniería Electrónica, la cual siempre le ha interesado desde muy niño, también es una de las carreras más demandadas hoy en día. Por eso, sueña con formar su propia empresa para generar empleos a personas que lo necesiten. Él ya está estudiando hace un año y medio, aún le falta 2 años y medio por culminar su carrera.

Actualmente le va muy bien en sus estudios, el único problema que tiene es que no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para que pueda continuar debido a que la carrera que está estudiando es una de las más costosas. Él aún así, piensa especializarse en Telecomunicación o Electrónica Industrial.

Él pide a KIVA que lo puedan apoyar para cubrir la deuda de las pensiones del III Semestre y no truncar sus sueños de ser un excelente profesional, formar su propia empresa y generar empleo para personas que lo necesiten.Esta ayuda también le permitirá ser una persona más productiva y competente, porque solo se dedicará a estudiar.

Ronal se siente muy agradecido y satisfecho con el apoyo brindado por KIVA porque podrá continuar sus estudios. Él quiere expresarles algunas palabras: "Me siento muy feliz y agradecido porque sé que a mi y a muchos jóvenes como yo, nos ayudan a terminar nuestras carreras. Nunca dejen de seguir apoyando a jóvenes que quieren triunfar en la vida siendo excelentes profesionales. Gracias KIVA!!
texts.en:
Ronal is a young student at SENATI who is studying for his technical degree in Electrical Engineering, in which he has always been interested since he was very young. It is also one of the degrees in most demand today. Because of this, he dreams of starting his own business to create jobs for people who need them. He has already been studying for a year and a half and he still has 2 and a half years left to finish his degree. 

Currently his studies are going very well, the only problem is that he doesn't have the necessary economic resources to continue since the degree that he is studying is one of the more expensive degrees. Yet he is still thinking about specializing in Telecommunications or Industrial Electronics.

He asks KIVA to help cover the debt from the 3rd semester tuition and to not truncate his dreams to be an excellent professional, to start his own business and create jobs for people who need them. This help will also allow him to be a more productive and competent person because he will only dedicate himself to his studies. 

Ronal feels very appreciative and satisfied with the help offered by KIVA because he will be able to continue his studies. He wants to express a few words: "I feel very happy and appreciative because I know that you are helping me and many young people like me finish our degrees. Never stop helping young people that want to succeed in life by being excellent professionals. Thank you KIVA!"

loans.use: to pay his tuition for Electronic Engineering Technical school and create his own workshop to help his family.

loans.name: Lot's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Phnom Proek district of Battambang province, Lot is a 38-year-old, mother of three children. Nowadays, she needs to support two children in school. She can earn income to improve her family’s living via selling grocery items and working for others for a fee to supplement her income. Lack of working capital to buy more grocery items is her main challenge in her business. She can save from her income only 5,000 KHR each day. She has been involved this business for five years.

For Lot, this is her first microloan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will manage her loan portion to buy more grocery items to sell and renovate her store to bigger than before, in order to attract more customers. She hopes that she can get more income from her business to upgrade her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell and renovate her store to bigger than before, in order to attract more customers.

loans.name: Chuparrosa Group

texts.es:
El cantar de las aves, el paisaje que ofrecen los cerros y la presa es lo que caracteriza al municipio además de las costumbres que aún  prevalecen de la cultura mazateca tan es así que el 90 % de la población adulta habla mazateco y español, en una de las colonias del municipio se formó un grupo llamado “Chuparrosa”  por la hermosura de la hembra del colibrí (chupamirto)  pues al observarlos encuentran tranquilidad e inspiración, el grupo está conformado por: 
Adolfo -Masa
Sidronio –Mojarra 
Ana, Juliana, Angela –Antojitos 
Angelica –Panadería 
Alondra – Cosméticos Y Ropa Interior Por Catalogo
Lilia –Comida Y Refrescos 
Doña Lilia tiene 40 años de edad, comenta que solo estudio  4 años de primaria pues sus padres no podían solventar los gastos del hogar y de la educación, está casada con el señor marco con quien ha procreado 5 hijos de los cuales solo 2 depende económicamente de ellos, “que mis hijos estudien  y tengan buena calidad de vida es lo que me motivo para iniciar con la venta de refresco y comida hace ya 5 años” son las palabras de doña Lili como le conocen en la comunidad, comenta que el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba y no quería la historia se repitiera con sus hijos.
Desde hace 5 años se ha dedicado a vender comida y refrescos comenta que inicio únicamente con  refrescos, sabritas y galletas más con el paso de los meses los maestros de la primaria y secundaria comenzaron a pedirle comida y fue entonces cuando con ayuda de su esposo y empleando parte de las ganancias obtenidas construyo una pequeña palapa donde coloco su enfriador para los refrescos, las sabritas, galletas y ha colocado 5 mesas al igual que un fogón que es donde da cocción a los alimentos, lo que más cocina son mojarras, fritas, en caldo, empapeladas, enchipotladas satisfaciendo a sus clientes, también prepara pollo, bistecs, chuletas dependiendo de lo que le soliciten.
Su pequeña cocina brinda servicio de lunes a viernes a partir de las 8 de la mañana  hasta las 6 de la tarde, su esposo le ayuda a buscar leña, limpiar las mojarras, acomodar y limpiar las mesas con sus respectivas sillas.
Para doña Lili apoyo que su familia le brinda es la motivación principal pues argumenta que está trabajando por ellos y para ellos, cada uno de los préstamos otorgados le han sido de utilidad pues al invertirlos en su cocina favorece el crecimiento de la misma esta ocasión el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de aceite, carne, verduras,crema, queso,  refrescos, sabritas y dos mesas.
Cada uno de los préstamos ha impactado de manera favorable cada una de nuestras actividades por ello agradecemos a quienes hacen posible que los prestamos sean otorgados para que al igual que a nosotros a otros clientes les beneficie, son las palabras con las que el grupo expresa su gratitud.
*Ellos son los integrantes del grupo Chuparrosa, la fotografía fue tomada en la novia del sol, doña Lili es quien viste blusa color rosado y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
Bird songs, the landscape that offers hills and the dam are what characterize the municipality in addition to the customs which still prevail from the Mazateca culture so that almost 90% of the adult population speaks Mazatec and Spanish. One of the colonies in the municipality formed a group called Chuparrosa for the beauty of the female hummingbird (chupamirto) since, looking at it, one finds peace and inspiration. The group is made up of:

Adolfo - dough
Sidronio –bream 
Ana, Juliana, Angela – snacks 
Angelica – bakery 
Alondra – cosmetics and lingerie from a catalog
Lilia – food and soft drinks

Lilia is 40 years old, and says that she only went to school for 4 years because her parents couldn't cover the household expenses and those of education. She is married to Marco, with whom she has 5 children of whom only 2 depend economically on them. "That my children go to school and have a good quality of life is what motivated me to begin selling soft drinks and food 5 years ago," are the words of Lili, as she is known in the community.  She says that her husband's salary was not enough and she didn't want history to repeat itself with her children.

For 5 years, she has worked selling food and soft drinks and says that she began just with soft drinks, chips and cookies, but with the passing of the months, the teachers at the primary and secondary school began to ask her for food and then she began, with the help of her husband and using part of the earnings she got, built a small structure where she set up her refrigerator for the soft drinks, the chips, and cookies, and 5 tables and a burner where  she makes the food. What she cooks are bream - fried, in soup, wrapped, or with chipotle, satisfying her customers and she also prepares chicken, steak, and cutlets depending on what is ordered. 

Her small kitchen offers service from Monday to Friday from 8 in the morning to 6 in the evening, her husband helps her find firewood, clean the bream, and set up and clean the tables and chairs.

For Lili, the support that her family offers her is the principal motivation because she says that she is working for them, each one of the granted loans has been useful since by investing them in her kitchen, it encourages its growth. This time, the loan will be invested in the purchase of oil, meat, vegetables, cream, cheese, soft drinks, chips and two tables.  

"Every one of the loans has had a positive impact on each of our businesses, so we are grateful to those who make it possible for our loans to be granted, so that we and our customers benefit."  These are the words with which the group expresses its gratitude.

*These are the members of the Chuparrosa group, the photo was taken at the Novia del Sol. Lili is wearing a pink blouse and black pants.

loans.use: to purchase oil, meat, vegetables, cream, cheese, soft drinks, chips, and two tables.

loans.name: Las Agradables Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad de Veracruz los habitantes se sientes orgullosos de las actividades que rigen la economía local. En el recorrido para entrar a dicha región se pueden apreciar los amplios sembradíos de caña de azúcar, maíz y frijol. De igual forma es notable el ingenio azucarero por ser de los que más produce cada año dentro del país. La ganadería, no obstante, se mantiene como una de las actividades de mejor aceptación para los lugareños.
   El grupo Las Agradables es originario de la comunidad y está integrado por: Julia quien se dedica a vender abarrotes y caña de azúcar; Cristina, ropa por catálogo; Reyna y Daira, cosméticos; Dulce, artículos para habitación; Paula, abarrotes mientras que Jairo maneja un taller eléctrico y Agustín da servicio de taxi. 
   Don Agustín ha estado detrás del volante desde hace 37 años cumpliendo su labor como  taxista recorriendo diferentes zonas de su comunidad con el objetivo de brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con base en un gran esfuerzo y sacrificio pasó de ser un empleado a ser su propio jefe ya que desde hace 30 años trabaja con su propia unidad. Una de las situaciones que más disfruta de su actividad es el trato con los clientes, por ello brinda servicio a partir de las 5:00 am y hasta las 9:00 pm; después de ese horario los viajes se cobran como especiales pero sus clientes no dudan en llamarlo debido a su gran calidady profesionalismo.
   Con préstamos anteriores ha podido dar mantenimiento general al automóvil además de cambiar las llantas; esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para ofrecer un ajuste eléctrico y mecánico a la unidad. Hoy día tiene dos objetivos en mente: adquirir un taxi nuevo y abrir una tienda de abarrotes, esto le ayudaría a incrementar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
   “Gracias por confiar en nosotros, otorgándonos préstamos para invertirlos en nuestras actividades de manera que gradualente hacemos posible nuestros sueños” son palabras que comparte Don Agustín junto con sus compañeros de grupo.
*En la fotografía, además se observarse a los integrantes del grupo, también se aprecia el taxi de don Agustín, él es quien viste camisa color gris.
texts.en:
In the community of Veracruz, the people are proud of the work that governs the local economy. On the way to get to this community, one can appreciate the large fields of sugar cane, corn and beans. Also noticeable are the sugar cane mills for being those that produce the most annually in the country. Animal husbandry, however, is maintained among the most common activities for the local people. 
 
The Las Agradables is from the community and is made up of Julia, who works selling groceries and sugar cane: Crisitina, clothing from catalogs; Reyna and Daira, cosmetics: Dulce household items; Paula groceries; while Jairo has an electrcial shop and Agustín provides a taxi service.  

Agustín has been behind the wheel for 37 years, doing his work as a taxi driver, going around the different zones in his community with the objective of offering the best service to his customers. With a base of great effort and sacrifice, he went from being employed to being his own boss and has worked with his own vehicle for 30 years. One of the situations that he enjoys the most of his job is interacting with customers. For this, he offers his service from 5:00 am to 9:00 pm. After this time, his trips have a different cost but his customers don't hesitate to call him due to his great quality and professionalism. 

With previous loans, he has been able to do general maintenance to the car in addition to changing the tires. This time, he has asked for the loan to get an electrical and mechanical adjustment on the vehicle. These days, he has two objective in mind: get a new taxi and open a grocery store. This would help him to increase his income and improve his quality of life. 

“Thank you for trusting in us, granting us loans to invest in our businesses so that we gradually make our dreams possible," are works that Agustín shares along with the members of his group. 

*In the photo, in addition to seeing the members of the group, Agustín's taxi is also visible. He is the one in the grey shirt.

loans.use: to an electrical adjustment on the taxi.

loans.name: Saidrahmon

texts.ru: Это Саидрахмон. Ему 27 лет. Он женат и отец троих маленьких детей. Саидрахмон родился и вырос в городе Вахдат. Он воспитанный и самостоятельный парень. Саидрахмон умный парень, и он  хочет заниматься бизнесом, чтобы было выгодно и полезно. Он решил заниматься торговлей деятельностью, продажи продукт питания. С такими планами Саидрахмон обратился к вам за кредитом. За счет кредита он перевозить продукт питания. Он надеется на Вашу поддержку. Он думает, что с вашей помощью он может зарабатывать и обеспечить своих детей
texts.en:
This is Saidrahmon. He is 27 years old. He is married, and the father of 3 small children. Saidrahmon was born and raised in Vahdat, and he is an experienced and independent man. Saidrahmon is smart, and he wants to have a business, which will be profitable and good for him. He has decided to work in trade, selling drinks.

With these plans, Saidrahmon has applied to you for a loan. With the money from the loan, he will purchase and transport drinks. He relies on your support. He thinks that, with your help, he will be able to earn money and provide for his children.

loans.use: to transport drinks and start a new business.

loans.name: Las Chelas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Chelas lleva tal nombre debido a que a una de sus integrantes, Doña Graciela, la llaman Chela de cariño. Todos son originarios de una comunidad veracruzana que es celebre porque por allí circula el ferrocarril conocido como “la bestia” que transporta generalmente toneladas de azúcar. Los miembros del grupo son: Graciela quien se dedica a vender postres; Inocencia, Teresa, María G. y Aurelia, zapatos; Petra, Mirelia y Yessenia, comida típica; Eva, ropa por catálogo; Felipe, piñas; Jazmín, cosméticos; María T., dulces y Emelia, artesanías.
   Con los valores del trabajo y el esfuerzo arraigados desde pequeño, Don Felipe se ha dedicado enteramente a los labores del campo. No obstante, para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus cuatro hijos decidió vender piñas dentro de su comunidad; ofrece el fruto entero, en jugo, o bien, preparado con limón y picante en polvo. Así pues, todas las tardes recorre las calles de su localidad montado es un triciclo para ofrecer su mercancía a los transeúntes, mientras que por las mañanas establece su negocio fuera de una tienda comercial donde la fluencia de personas favorece el éxito de su actividad. 
   En tanto a los préstamos adquiridos siempre ha mostrado una responsabilidad encomiable pues cuenta con cuatro dentro de VFMéxico.  En esta ocasión le será de utilidad pues compraría más piñas, chile en polvo y bolsas plásticas. Además comenta, “gracias por creer en nosotros, por ayudarnos a cumplir nuestros sueños, Dios los bendiga hoy y siempre”.
   Una de las metas de Don Felipe es instalarse en el patio de su casa para vender aperitivos típicos como cocteles de fruta, chicharrones preparados, elotes o esquites que se realizan con los granos del maíz.
*La fotografía fue tomada  frente a la casa de Eva, Don Felipe es el único hombre del grupo; los niños que aparecen son hijos de Mirelia.
texts.en:
Las Chelas loan group gets its name from one of its members, Graciela, who they call "Chela de cariño". They are all native to a Veracruz community that is famous because there is a railroad that runs there known as "la bestia (the beast)" which transports mainly tons of sugar. 

The members of the group are: Graciela (sells desserts), Inocencia, Teresa, María G. and Aurelia (sell shoes), Petra, Mirelia y Yessenia (sell traditional food), Eva (sells clothing from a catalog), Felipe (sells pineapple), Jazmín (sells cosmetics), María T. (sells sweets), and Emelia (sells crafts). 

With work values and effort rooted from the time he was a young boy, Felipe has made a living entirely with farm work. However, to be able to cover the household expenses and the education of his four children, he decided to sell pineapples within his community. He offers the fruit whole, in juice, or prepared with lemon and spices. So, every afternoon he roams the streets of his area, riding a tricycle to offer his merchandise to the passersby. In the mornings, he sets up his business outside of a commercial store where the fluidity of the people favors the success of his job. 

As for the loans he has gotten, he has always shown a commendable responsibility as he has had four so far with VFMéxico. On this occasion, he will use the loan to buy more pineapples, chili powder, and plastic bags. He says, "Thank you for believing in us, for helping us to reach our dreams. May God bless you today and always." One of Felipe's goals is to put a store on the patio of his house to sell traditional appetizers such as fruit cocktails, prepared pork rinds, and ears of corn or popcorn with the grains of corn. 

*The photo was taken in front of Eva's house. Felipe is the only man in the group. The children that are there are Mirelia's sons.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, chilies and bags.

loans.name: Rubin

texts.en:
Rubin (on the right of the photo) and Tricia (on the left) started their business, My Christian Heart,  in November of 2014. Prior to starting their business Tricia worked in the hotel industry for over 25 years while Rubin served in the United Air Force. Rubin and Tricia have been married for 23 years and have two kids together. In the past year they were both motivated by their Christian faith to open a business dedicated to selling inspirational products. Although Rubin is still serving, together he and Tricia run their business in Virginia. 

Their biggest challenge thus far has been the inability to get the capital required to fund all start-up costs of their new business. They are currently seeking a loan to purchase a trailer that would be used to store their products in between trunk shows and vending opportunities. 

Tricia and Rubin hope to grow their business into a clothing line that will become a household brand within the Christian community. Their hopes are to change people’s lives for the better through their kindness, faith and inspirational business.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile storage unit for business products.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a strong, positive woman and an inspiration to others due to her perseverance in the face of many challenges. After years of marriage, Susan found herself on her own without the training and experience needed to find work in Florida's damaged economy. Not only was Susan left to provide for herself with no previous work experience, but she was also left with a lot of debt and damaged credit.  Because of her years of determination, she has seen the positive results ever since her unfortunate situation. She decided to go to school and receive training to become a Registered Nurse (RN) so that she could support herself financially and effectively help others medically. Due to the current record high temperatures in the area, Susan’s home is hotter inside than out. She hopes that SELF and Kiva can help her obtain an affordable loan with small payments that fit within her budget. 

Susan is very careful with her expenses, and she only takes on debt that she can afford and pay back. Susan’s past struggles has hindered her opportunity to obtain an affordable loan to make necessary upgrades to her home through a bank. 

Susan will improve her health, quality of life and the overall living conditions in her home with this Kiva loan, and will also attend a required credit counseling seminar so that she can use the Kiva loan to re-build her credit.

loans.use: to greatly improve her quality of life as well as her health by allowing her to purchase a new air conditioner for her home.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan started his business, Gio’s Party Rentals, in June of last year as a way to make more money on a part-time basis. Juan has been working for a local school district as a network engineer for 19 years, and he noticed the demand for jumpers and other equipment for parties.  

Juan has invested much of his personal savings to purchase jumpers, chairs, tables and music equipment. His business has grown so much that he is currently looking to purchase additional equipment to keep up with the demand, especially during the summer. 

Juan will use his Kiva loan to purchase two additional jumpers, so he can service more parties and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase two additional jumpers, so he can service more parties and expand his business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 42 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Gina has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer trabajadora de 45 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos. Juntos viven en la zona rural de Cocachacra al sur de Arequipa. Desde hace casi diez años se dedica a la ganadería, es decir a la vez a la cría de animales domésticos, como de ganado vacuno, ovino, caprino y de caballar. Solicita un préstamo en aras a realizar la compra de dos cabezas de ganado vacuno de engorde y sus respectivos alimentos. Esta muy agradecida con la ayuda que le sera brindada. En el futuro, espera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is a hard-working woman of 45, married, and the mother of two children. They live together in the rural area of Cocachacra, south of Arequipa. She has been raising livestock for almost ten years, That is to say raising farm animals such as cattle, sheep, goats and horses.

She is requesting a loan to buy two head of cattle, as well the feed for them. She is very grateful for the help she will be provided. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase two head of cattle for fattening, as well as purchase feed for them.

loans.name: Mary Chiles

texts.en:
Mary Chiles from Pasay City just joined Center for Community Transformation (CCT) this March 16, 2015. She is a 39-year-old businesswoman and a wife of Marlon. Basically, their sources of income are: buying and selling of personal or home products and an E-loading business. She’s been in the business for only four months and is striving her best to succeed in the industry, for it provides income for their day-to-day expenses.

The E-loading business is currently growing, since cellphones are being used by anyone, even kids at least seven years old already know how to use them, by means of communication or playing games using a smartphone. To start the E-loading business, you just need a phone, a retailer sim card and around PHP 500-1000 as a starting balance. Most of her customers are her neighbors and friends.

On the other hand, for the buy and sell business she signed up to become a member of a certain company, paying for a registration fee then selling their products. Once you sign up you are given a brochure, where you can show to customers all of the products that they offer. Customers select items on the brochure then the payment is on an installment basis. However, aside from brochures, she should have items on display as well, so that customers will not wait for weeks to have the items. Same on the E-loading business where there’s an increase on market demand, the phone balance should always be sufficient or otherwise ample.

For the past four months, Mary Chiles has considered the businesses growing. To continue this, she decided to apply for a loan of PHP 10,000 as a supporting capital for her to buy necessities for her business. She is hoping that CCT will grant her request since this will be a great help for her to grow her businesses.

Despite being busy, Mary Chiles gives time in attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals, where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and is able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy necessities for her business, like stock for displays, so that customers will not wait for weeks to have the items, which will increase sales.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 26 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Jenelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jenelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, cigarettes, home care products, and other groceries. Jenelyn has been in this business for six years now. 

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, cigarettes, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Kyon Paing Village Group 1 B

texts.en:
Aye (second from right in the picture) is 47 years old and married with five children. She and her husband plant at their 6 acres of crop farm and also plant seasonal fruits. The family has also raised ducks to sell the eggs for more income.

The loan from Proximity will help Aye during the harvesting period, and also to invest for the next crop season. Since the village only goes up until primary school, secondary and higher students have to travel to other villages for school.

Pictured above are the group members from Kyon Paing Village Group 1 B named Aye, Aye K, Chin and Than. This loan will help the group to purchase fertilizers and gas for cropping machines.

Kyon Paing Village is located in the Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar, where they mainly focus on crop farming. Some households have a grocery store in the village and plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and gas for cropping machines.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
A vegetable and fruit vending business is the source of income for Domingo from Pasay City. He is 34 years old and a husband to Jeny. He is a new member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and just signed up in March 2015. In running the business it’s just them without any other employees. He is thankful that God blesses them by providing sufficient income for their day-to-day expenses.

Perseverance and passion for the job are what made him stay in the business, since he has children that he needs to support and raise. The competition in this line of business is what he considered a challenge since it also affects their daily income. However, he is grateful for what God gave them including CCT, as he considers it God’s extension of blessing to them. Domingo applied for a PHP 10,000 loan to have supporting capital for the business, so that he and his wife will be able to buy large quantities of fruits and vegetables daily. The amount that he requested will be of great help for the business.

Domingo is consistent in attending the weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members. There he gains spiritual strength, hears members' life changing testimony, shares his own experience of God’s love, pays micro finance loans and hears God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: To have supporting capital for the business, so that he and his wife will be able to buy large quantities of fruits and vegetables daily.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia has been in the tailoring business for years now. Each month, she earns an approximate profit of P12,000 considering the market demand. Not all of the profits earned on the business are being used to buy tailoring materials. Most were spent on their daily expenditures. The loan that was approved last year was used to purchase necessary materials for her tailoring business. The amount made a great impact since then; she’s able to make any designs of clothing as she has the capability to buy materials that are essential. Compared to before wen she only had limited materials it means the output that she produced was limited as well. She is thankful and she considered CCT as God’s medium of blessing.

On the past six months, she considered the business growing. It means the increase of demand is present. Sonia decided to apply for another loan this year for Php 15,000 so that she will have stocks of different fabrics and other sewing materials. Availability of materials means the possibility to earn more profit. She is hoping that CCT will grant her request of another loan as she wants her children to finish college and provide essential needs to her family.

Sonia believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for tailoring materials such as fabric, needles, and thread

loans.name: Geovanni

texts.es: Geovanni, tiene la edad  de 45 años, está casado, vive con su esposa y sus hijos,  los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de arroz de buena calidad y que tenga una buena greminación y de fertilizantes orgánicos que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones de materia orgánica del suelo y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y durante el desarrollo y cosecha, además pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y de labores que le ayuden a que el agua de lluvia no cause daños por la erosión, y también para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del cultivo. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Geovanni, age 45, is married and lives with his wife and children. They are his greatest priority. He plans to use the loan the buy good quality rice seeds that will have good germination. He will also buy organic fertilizers that will help him to improve the condition of the organic earth material and other products to apply to the crop and use during its development and harvest.

In addition, he will pay for the labor to prepare the land and for the labor to help the rainwater not to cause damage from erosion. He will also use the loan for the application of the products and the care of the crops once they have started developing. This way he will be assured of doing a good job.

He plans to take advantage of the good climate and soil conditions in the area for this crop. He will also put into practice several years of experience in managing this crop. In addition to buying the best products that are better quality so that his crops will develop healthy and well for a good harvest, he will have an important short term production.

He wants to use the earnings from the harvest he hopes to get for the well-being and education of his family, to fulfill some family goals, and to continue investing more in the crops.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not previously had other loans with state banks. FUDECOSUR has provided a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant rice.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew and his family live in a rural home in Nandi Hills, Kenya. He lives and works on a 0.8 acre farm together with his wife and 2 children. Mathew has been practicing dairy and poultry farming for 15 years; his main income sources are milk and eggs.   

Mathew is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed for his cow. The borrowed money will be used to buy construction tools and materials to get the project done. He expects that the animals' health and welfare will be improved as a result of the loan investment. This will further lead to improved milk production and income. Your loan investment will help Mathew and his family elevate their livelihoods and lead a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Battambang province, Than is 32 years old. She is a mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school. Her main sources of income are from rice cropping and cassava growing on one hectare area of farmland. Moreover, she can earn more income via working for a labor fee. Her crop has grown not well, because of not having enough fertilizer. She has been involved her current businesses for 5 years.

This is the second time for Than with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully paid back her past loan. With the loan, she can get more income to upgrade her living and support her children’s education. She leads a group of five members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her portion of loan to buy fertilizer, seed and pay for labor fee to increase productivity of her crop. She hopes that she can gain higher than last year to increase her family’s income more than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and pay for labor fee to increase productivity of her crop.

loans.name: Bunhuor's Group

texts.en:
A father of three children living in Banteay Meanchey province, Bunhuor is 59-year-old. He struggles his family’s hardship via rice cropping and selling grocery items to get extra income. His rice did not provide good yields for him, because it has been destroyed by insects. Bunhuor has been involved with his current businesses for 30 years. He can earn income about 22,800KHR per day and he can save his daily income only 6,800KHR each day after offsetting his family’s expense.

This is seventh loan cycle for him with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He wisely repaid his past loans which enable him to earn more income and have enough decent household supplies for his family. In a group of two, he is the group leader. He will manage his entire loan portion to buy seed, fertilizer and organic pesticide to increase his crop yields. He hopes that his farmland produces higher yields and provide more income, so that he will be able to create a new business in the future.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and organic pesticide to increase his crop yields

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Sokheng is aged 32 years and a single women living in Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she grows rice on one hectare area of farmland as the main source of income. Moreover, she can make additional income via working for others for a fee. Her rice was destroyed by insects, so it did not grow well and it caused her to not have enough working capital for doing farming in this season. For Sokheng, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her entire loan portion to buy a decent motorbike to drive her to work on time. She hopes that she can get more income from her work and her rice farm to upgrade her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to drive her to work on time

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Diedo

texts.en: Diedo is a 52-year-old man from Bohol, Philippines. He is married and has two children ages 20 and 18 years old. His wife is a housekeeper while he is engaged in selling coconut wine and vinegar. Diedo wants to increase his livelihood to provide the needs of his family. With this, he is asking for a loan, which will help him increase his earnings. He is requesting a loan amount of PHP 6,000 to buy containers (used for storing wine and vinegar), “sanggot” (a term used by Boholano’s which means “sickle”, a knife used by tuba gatherers) and “tungog” (refers to the tannin powder used by tuba gatherer to add color to the coconut wine).

loans.use: to buy containers, a "sanggot" (sickle), and "tungog" (tannin powder).

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is a 40-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 2 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past 18 years; her husband is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Kosar's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in a suitable position to buy these products for resale. Therefore Kosar has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities which will help him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.
Kosar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business.

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Kheng is 37 years old. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school; the other one is too young to attend school. Because of her living, she earns income via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to get more income. Her rice has grown not well because it was destroyed by insects.

Due to a lack of working capital, she leads a group of three to get this first Kiva loan via VisionFund. As the group leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy seed, fertilizer, and organic pesticide to grow her crops fruitfully. She hopes that she can gain higher yields and can sell at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and organic pesticide to grow her crops fruitfully.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
A mother of four dependent children living in Kampong Cham province, Vy is 39 years old. Nowadays, she needs to support three children, two of whom are still in school.

She can earn income to improve her family's condition via rice cropping. Her rice has grown not well because it was destroyed by insects. Moreover, she grows cassava and works for others for a fee to get extra income. She has been involved in her current businesses for 21 years.

This Vy's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She fully repaid her past loan, which helped her to improve her family’s living condition. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland to gain more yield. She hopes that she can get more income from her farm to upgrade her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her farmland to gain more yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Yeab's Group

texts.en:
Yeab is 38 years old, lives in a remote area of Siem Reap province, and is a married mother of three children. To support her living, she grows rice as the main source of income. She raises chicken to sell to get additional income. She has been involved in her business for 20 years and it earns her about 27,000 KHR per day to support her family’s living condition. After her business expenses, she is able to save around 15,000 KHR each day. Insects destroying the crops is the main challenge for her business, which causes her to not have enough working capital for doing farming this season. This is Yeab’s eighth cycle with VisionFund and her past loans helped to improve her living lifestyle.

In a group of three, she is the leader. She will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees for supporting her rice farming. She hopes that she can gain higher yields than last year so as to get more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to support her rice farming.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, condiments, fruits, baked good, and other items.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline has been in a vegetable vending business for years now. For the past six months, she considered the business as growing. She’s grateful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) granted her previous loan request of PHP 12,000, and she considered it as God’s blessing to her. The loan that was granted previously became a medium for her to buy a large quantity of vegetables to sell to consumers and provide a variety of options.

Since it is her bread and butter, Evangeline is persistently persevering to be successful in her chosen industry. Currently, she’s just a tenant and dreams to invest in her own lot so that she will no longer pay for monthly rental. She wants to have savings for their future as well, and is praying that God will bless them continuously and grow the business so that she’ll just hire workers and have time for Sunday worship.

Not all of the profits are being used for the business; basically some are spent for their daily expenditures. That’s why she applied for a PHP 15,000 loan this year, since she needs additional capital to buy a large quantity of vegetables, so that customers will have a variety of choices.

On a weekly basis, Evangeline regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experience with the business, to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship, and to listen to the Word of God.

A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of vegetables for her business, so that customers will have a variety of choices.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 35 years old and grows rice as the main source of her income to support the family. Moreover, she makes snacks to sell as her additional income source. Originally, from the Kampong Cham province, she is a married mother of two young children. Sokha can save about 35,100 KHR each day from income from this business. She has been involved with these businesses for 17 years. Recently, insects destroyed her rice and it is her main challenge in earning income to support her family.

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully paid back her past loan. She wisely used her previous loan to improve her living condition as well. Now, she is seeking a new loan in order to buy a machine to make snacks to support her current business. She hopes to upgrade her family’s living and lifestyle through this loan.

loans.use: to buy a machine to make snacks to support her current business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD DE TAMBO REAL, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de leche para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece a los inversionistas por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the SOLIDARIDAD DE TAMBO REAL communal bank. The member continues to make a living selling milk to all the customers who come to her. She has been running this business for a long time, thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She wishes to continue working so that she can keep supporting her family.  

The member thanks the investors for the loan, and she promises to comply with the established payment terms. She is requesting the loan in order to buy milk, among other things.

loans.use: to buy milk and other things.

loans.name: Jose Ezequiel

texts.es:
José, está satisfecho por el resultado positivo que ha tenido al invertir el crédito anterior en su negocio, comenta que su peluquería está mucho más moderna y que tiene mejor equipo para los videos juegos del negocio, sus ingresos han aumentado y ha cumplido con sus compromisos.
Está optando por otro crédito para comprar peines, gel para el caballo, tijeras, etc., para la peluquería así mismo controles para para los video juegos, su objetivo es mantener su negocio funcionando, ya que es su fuente de subsistencia.
texts.en: José is satisfied with the positive results that he experienced investing the previous loan in his business. He comments that his barber shop is much more modern and has better equipment for the video games in his business. His income has increased and he has met his obligations. He has decided on another loan to buy combs, hair gel, scissors, etc. for the barber shop and also video game controls. His objective is to keep his business functioning as it is the source of his subsistence.

loans.use: to buy combs, hair gel, scissors, etc. for his barbershop and also video game controls.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is 50-year-old woman and mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells fruits e.g. apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Shaheen's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit for reselling purposes so that her husband can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase fruit for his business purpose.

Therefore, Shaheen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business.

loans.name: Meraj

texts.en:
Meraj has successfully built her business, selling animals, with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She is very good with handling her business activities along with her housework.

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Meraj has requested for 60,000 PKR to buy more cattle for providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for providing a better standard of living for her family members.
